# VS Code API

**VS Code API** is a set of JavaScript APIs that you can invoke in your Visual Studio Code extension. This page lists all VS Code APIs available to extension authors.

## API namespaces and classes

This listing is compiled from the [vscode.d.ts](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vscode-dts/vscode.d.ts) file from the VS Code repository.

</div>

## commands



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for dealing with commands. In short, a command is a function with a
unique identifier. The function is sometimes also called <em>command handler</em>.</p>
<p>Commands can be added to the editor using the <a href="#commands.registerCommand">registerCommand</a>
and <a href="#commands.registerTextEditorCommand">registerTextEditorCommand</a> functions. Commands
can be executed <a href="#commands.executeCommand">manually</a> or from a UI gesture. Those are:</p>
<ul>
<li>palette - Use the <code>commands</code>-section in <code>package.json</code> to make a command show in
the <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/userinterface#_command-palette">command palette</a>.</li>
<li>keybinding - Use the <code>keybindings</code>-section in <code>package.json</code> to enable
<a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/keybindings#_advanced-customization">keybindings</a>
for your extension.</li>
</ul>
<p>Commands from other extensions and from the editor itself are accessible to an extension. However,
when invoking an editor command not all argument types are supported.</p>
<p>This is a sample that registers a command handler and adds an entry for that command to the palette. First
register a command handler with the identifier <code>extension.sayHello</code>.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">commands</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">registerCommand</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;extension.sayHello&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">showInformationMessage</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Hello World!&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Second, bind the command identifier to a title under which it will show in the palette (<code>package.json</code>).</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">{</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;commands&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.sayHello&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;title&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;Hello World&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>

#### Functions



<a name="commands.executeCommand"></a><span class="ts" id=2517 data-target="#details-2517" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">executeCommand</span><span>&lt;</span>T<span>&gt;</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">command</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span>...</span><span class="ident">rest</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2517">
<div class="comment"><p>Executes the command denoted by the given command identifier.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Note 1:</em> When executing an editor command not all types are allowed to
be passed as arguments. Allowed are the primitive types <code>string</code>, <code>boolean</code>,
<code>number</code>, <code>undefined</code>, and <code>null</code>, as well as <a href="#Position">Position</a>, <a href="#Range">Range</a>, <a href="#Uri">Uri</a> and <a href="#Location">Location</a>.</li>
<li><em>Note 2:</em> There are no restrictions when executing commands that have been contributed
by extensions.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="command"></a><span class="ts" id=2519 data-target="#details-2519" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">command</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Identifier of the command to execute.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="rest"></a><span class="ts" id=2520 data-target="#details-2520" data-toggle="collapse"><span>...</span><span class="ident">rest</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Parameters passed to the command function.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A thenable that resolves to the returned value of the given command. Returns <code>undefined</code> when
the command handler function doesn&#39;t return anything.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="commands.registerTextEditorCommand"></a><span class="ts" id=2507 data-target="#details-2507" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerTextEditorCommand</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">command</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">callback</span><span>: </span>(textEditor: <a class="type-ref" href="#TextEditor">TextEditor</a>, edit: <a class="type-ref" href="#TextEditorEdit">TextEditorEdit</a>, args: <span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>[]) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>, <span class="ident">thisArg</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2507">
<div class="comment"><p>Registers a text editor command that can be invoked via a keyboard shortcut,
a menu item, an action, or directly.</p>
<p>Text editor commands are different from ordinary <a href="#commands.registerCommand">commands</a> as
they only execute when there is an active editor when the command is called. Also, the
command handler of an editor command has access to the active editor and to an
<a href="#TextEditorEdit">edit</a>-builder. Note that the edit-builder is only valid while the
callback executes.</p>
</div>

<a name="debug.asDebugSourceUri"></a><span class="ts" id=4058 data-target="#details-4058" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">asDebugSourceUri</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">source</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugProtocolSource">DebugProtocolSource</a>, <span class="ident">session</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4058">
<div class="comment"><p>Converts a &quot;Source&quot; descriptor object received via the Debug Adapter Protocol into a Uri that can be used to load its contents.
If the source descriptor is based on a path, a file Uri is returned.
If the source descriptor uses a reference number, a specific debug Uri (scheme &#39;debug&#39;) is constructed that requires a corresponding ContentProvider and a running debug session</p>
<p>If the &quot;Source&quot; descriptor has insufficient information for creating the Uri, an error is thrown.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="source"></a><span class="ts" id=4059 data-target="#details-4059" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">source</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugProtocolSource">DebugProtocolSource</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An object conforming to the <a href="https://microsoft.github.io/debug-adapter-protocol/specification#Types_Source">Source</a> type defined in the Debug Adapter Protocol.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="session"></a><span class="ts" id=4060 data-target="#details-4060" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">session</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An optional debug session that will be used when the source descriptor uses a reference number to load the contents from an active debug session.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A uri that can be used to load the contents of the source.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="debug.registerDebugAdapterDescriptorFactory"></a><span class="ts" id=4036 data-target="#details-4036" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerDebugAdapterDescriptorFactory</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">debugType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">factory</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugAdapterDescriptorFactory">DebugAdapterDescriptorFactory</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>

<a name="debug.registerDebugConfigurationProvider"></a><span class="ts" id=4031 data-target="#details-4031" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerDebugConfigurationProvider</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">debugType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfigurationProvider">DebugConfigurationProvider</a>, <span class="ident">triggerKind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind">DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4031">
<div class="comment"><p>Register a <a href="#DebugConfigurationProvider">debug configuration provider</a> for a specific debug type.
The optional <a href="#DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind">triggerKind</a> can be used to specify when the <code>provideDebugConfigurations</code> method of the provider is triggered.
Currently two trigger kinds are possible: with the value <code>Initial</code> (or if no trigger kind argument is given) the <code>provideDebugConfigurations</code> method is used to provide the initial debug configurations to be copied into a newly created launch.json.
With the trigger kind <code>Dynamic</code> the <code>provideDebugConfigurations</code> method is used to dynamically determine debug configurations to be presented to the user (in addition to the static configurations from the launch.json).
Please note that the <code>triggerKind</code> argument only applies to the <code>provideDebugConfigurations</code> method: so the <code>resolveDebugConfiguration</code> methods are not affected at all.
Registering a single provider with resolve methods for different trigger kinds, results in the same resolve methods called multiple times.
More than one provider can be registered for the same type.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="debugType"></a><span class="ts" id=4032 data-target="#details-4032" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">debugType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The debug type for which the provider is registered.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="provider"></a><span class="ts" id=4033 data-target="#details-4033" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfigurationProvider">DebugConfigurationProvider</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#DebugConfigurationProvider">debug configuration provider</a> to register.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="triggerKind"></a><span class="ts" id=4034 data-target="#details-4034" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">triggerKind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind">DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind">trigger</a> for which the &#39;provideDebugConfiguration&#39; method of the provider is registered. If <code>triggerKind</code> is missing, the value <code>DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind.Initial</code> is assumed.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#Disposable">Disposable</a> that unregisters this provider when being disposed.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="debug.startDebugging"></a><span class="ts" id=4044 data-target="#details-4044" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">startDebugging</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>, <span class="ident">nameOrConfiguration</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>, <span class="ident">parentSessionOrOptions</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSessionOptions">DebugSessionOptions</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4044">
<div class="comment"><p>Start debugging by using either a named launch or named compound configuration,
or by directly passing a <a href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>.
The named configurations are looked up in &#39;.vscode/launch.json&#39; found in the given folder.
Before debugging starts, all unsaved files are saved and the launch configurations are brought up-to-date.
Folder specific variables used in the configuration (e.g. &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;) are resolved against the given folder.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="folder"></a><span class="ts" id=4045 data-target="#details-4045" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folder</a> for looking up named configurations and resolving variables or <code>undefined</code> for a non-folder setup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="nameOrConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=4046 data-target="#details-4046" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">nameOrConfiguration</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Either the name of a debug or compound configuration or a <a href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a> object.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="parentSessionOrOptions"></a><span class="ts" id=4047 data-target="#details-4047" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">parentSessionOrOptions</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSessionOptions">DebugSessionOptions</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Debug session options. When passed a parent <a href="#DebugSession">debug session</a>, assumes options with just this parent session.</p>
</div></td></tr>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="env.remoteName"></a><span class="ts" id=2492 data-target="#details-2492" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">remoteName</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2492">
<div class="comment"><p>The name of a remote. Defined by extensions, popular samples are <code>wsl</code> for the Windows

a specific extension runs remote or not.</p>

#### Functions



<a name="env.asExternalUri"></a><span class="ts" id=2478 data-target="#details-2478" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">asExternalUri</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">target</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2478">
<div class="comment"><p>Resolves a uri to a form that is accessible externally.</p>
<h4 id="http-or-https-scheme"><code>http:</code> or <code>https:</code> scheme</h4>
<p>Resolves an <em>external</em> uri, such as a <code>http:</code> or <code>https:</code> link, from where the extension is running to a
uri to the same resource on the client machine.</p>
<p>This is a no-op if the extension is running on the client machine.</p>
<p>If the extension is running remotely, this function automatically establishes a port forwarding tunnel
from the local machine to <code>target</code> on the remote and returns a local uri to the tunnel. The lifetime of
the port forwarding tunnel is managed by the editor and the tunnel can be closed by the user.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that uris passed through <code>openExternal</code> are automatically resolved and you should not call <code>asExternalUri</code> on them.</p>
<h4 id="vscodeenvurischeme"><code>vscode.env.uriScheme</code></h4>
<p>Creates a uri that - if opened in a browser (e.g. via <code>openExternal</code>) - will result in a registered <a href="#UriHandler">UriHandler</a>
to trigger.</p>
<p>Extensions should not make any assumptions about the resulting uri and should not alter it in any way.
Rather, extensions can e.g. use this uri in an authentication flow, by adding the uri as callback query
argument to the server to authenticate to.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that if the server decides to add additional query parameters to the uri (e.g. a token or secret), it
will appear in the uri that is passed to the <a href="#UriHandler">UriHandler</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong> of an authentication flow:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">registerUriHandler</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">handleUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">ProviderResult</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">void</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt; {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">if</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> (</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/did-authenticate&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">console</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">log</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">toString</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">());</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">callableUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #C586C0">await</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">env</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">asExternalUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">parse</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">env</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uriScheme</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;://my.extension/did-authenticate&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #C586C0">await</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">env</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">openExternal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">callableUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p><em>Note</em> that extensions should not cache the result of <code>asExternalUri</code> as the resolved uri may become invalid due to
a system or user action â€” for example, in remote cases, a user may close a port forwarding tunnel that was opened by
<code>asExternalUri</code>.</p>
<h4 id="any-other-scheme">Any other scheme</h4>
<p>Any other scheme will be handled as if the provided URI is a workspace URI. In that case, the method will return
a URI which, when handled, will make the editor open the workspace.</p>
</div>

<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

## extensions



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for dealing with installed extensions. Extensions are represented
by an <a href="#Extension">Extension</a>-interface which enables reflection on them.</p>
<p>Extension writers can provide APIs to other extensions by returning their API public
surface from the <code>activate</code>-call.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #C586C0">export</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">function</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">activate</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">context</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">ExtensionContext</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">api</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">sum</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    },</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">mul</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">*</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  };</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// &#39;export&#39; public api-surface</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">api</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>When depending on the API of another extension add an <code>extensionDependencies</code>-entry
to <code>package.json</code>, and use the <a href="#extensions.getExtension">getExtension</a>-function
and the <a href="#Extension.exports">exports</a>-property, like below:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">mathExt</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">extensions</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">getExtension</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;genius.math&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">importedApi</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">mathExt</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">exports</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">console</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">log</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">importedApi</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">mul</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">42</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>

## l10n



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for localization-related functionality in the extension API. To use this properly,
you must have <code>l10n</code> defined in your extension manifest and have bundle.l10n.<language>.json files.
For more information on how to generate bundle.l10n.<language>.json files, check out the
<a href="https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-l10n">vscode-l10n repo</a>.</p>
<p>Note: Built-in extensions (for example, Git, TypeScript Language Features, GitHub Authentication)
are excluded from the <code>l10n</code> property requirement. In other words, they do not need to specify
a <code>l10n</code> in the extension manifest because their translated strings come from Language Packs.</p>
</div>

#### Variables



<a name="l10n.bundle"></a><span class="ts" id=4221 data-target="#details-4221" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">bundle</span><span>: </span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4221">
<div class="comment"><p>The bundle of localized strings that have been loaded for the extension.
It&#39;s undefined if no bundle has been loaded. The bundle is typically not loaded if
there was no bundle found or when we are running with the default language.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="l10n.uri"></a><span class="ts" id=4225 data-target="#details-4225" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>

<div class="comment"><p>The URI of the localization bundle that has been loaded for the extension.

## languages



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for participating in language-specific editor <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved">features</a>,
like IntelliSense, code actions, diagnostics etc.</p>
<p>Many programming languages exist and there is huge variety in syntaxes, semantics, and paradigms. Despite that, features
like automatic word-completion, code navigation, or code checking have become popular across different tools for different
programming languages.</p>
<p>The editor provides an API that makes it simple to provide such common features by having all UI and actions already in place and
by allowing you to participate by providing data only. For instance, to contribute a hover all you have to do is provide a function
that can be called with a <a href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a> and a <a href="#Position">Position</a> returning hover info. The rest, like tracking the
mouse, positioning the hover, keeping the hover stable etc. is taken care of by the editor.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">languages</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">registerHoverProvider</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">provideHover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">document</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">position</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">token</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;I am a hover!&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Registration is done using a <a href="#DocumentSelector">document selector</a> which is either a language id, like <code>javascript</code> or
a more complex <a href="#DocumentFilter">filter</a> like <code>{ language: &#39;typescript&#39;, scheme: &#39;file&#39; }</code>. Matching a document against such
a selector will result in a <a href="#languages.match">score</a> that is used to determine if and how a provider shall be used. When
scores are equal the provider that came last wins. For features that allow full arity, like <a href="#languages.registerHoverProvider">hover</a>,
the score is only checked to be <code>&gt;0</code>, for other features, like <a href="#languages.registerCompletionItemProvider">IntelliSense</a> the
score is used for determining the order in which providers are asked to participate.</p>
</div>

<a name="languages.match"></a><span class="ts" id=3354 data-target="#details-3354" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">match</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">selector</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentSelector">DocumentSelector</a>, <span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3354">
<div class="comment"><p>Compute the match between a document <a href="#DocumentSelector">selector</a> and a document. Values
greater than zero mean the selector matches the document.</p>
<p>A match is computed according to these rules:</p>
<ol>
<li>When <a href="#DocumentSelector">DocumentSelector</a> is an array, compute the match for each contained <code>DocumentFilter</code> or language identifier and take the maximum value.</li>
<li>A string will be desugared to become the <code>language</code>-part of a <a href="#DocumentFilter">DocumentFilter</a>, so <code>&quot;fooLang&quot;</code> is like <code>{ language: &quot;fooLang&quot; }</code>.</li>
<li>A <a href="#DocumentFilter">DocumentFilter</a> will be matched against the document by comparing its parts with the document. The following rules apply:<ol>
<li>When the <code>DocumentFilter</code> is empty (<code>{}</code>) the result is <code>0</code></li>
<li>When <code>scheme</code>, <code>language</code>, <code>pattern</code>, or <code>notebook</code> are defined but one doesn&#39;t match, the result is <code>0</code></li>
<li>Matching against <code>*</code> gives a score of <code>5</code>, matching via equality or via a glob-pattern gives a score of <code>10</code></li>
<li>The result is the maximum value of each match</li>
</ol>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Samples:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// default document from disk (file-scheme)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">//&#39;file:///my/file.js&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">languageId</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// &#39;javascript&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 10;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">language:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 10;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">language:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">scheme:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 10;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 5</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;fooLang&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 0</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">([</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;fooLang&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">], </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 5</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// virtual document, e.g. from git-index</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// &#39;git:/my/file.js&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">languageId</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// &#39;javascript&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 10;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">language:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">scheme:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;git&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 10;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">match</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// 5</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// notebook cell document</span></span>

<a name="languages.registerCompletionItemProvider"></a><span class="ts" id=3369 data-target="#details-3369" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerCompletionItemProvider</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">selector</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentSelector">DocumentSelector</a>, <span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItemProvider">CompletionItemProvider</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItem">CompletionItem</a>&gt;, <span>...</span><span class="ident">triggerCharacters</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3369">
<div class="comment"><p>Register a completion provider.</p>
<p>Multiple providers can be registered for a language. In that case providers are sorted
by their <a href="#languages.match">score</a> and groups of equal score are sequentially asked for
completion items. The process stops when one or many providers of a group return a
result. A failing provider (rejected promise or exception) will not fail the whole
operation.</p>
<p>A completion item provider can be associated with a set of <code>triggerCharacters</code>. When trigger
characters are being typed, completions are requested but only from providers that registered
the typed character. Because of that trigger characters should be different than <a href="#LanguageConfiguration.wordPattern">word characters</a>,
a common trigger character is <code>.</code> to trigger member completions.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="selector"></a><span class="ts" id=3370 data-target="#details-3370" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">selector</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentSelector">DocumentSelector</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A selector that defines the documents this provider is applicable to.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="provider"></a><span class="ts" id=3371 data-target="#details-3371" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItemProvider">CompletionItemProvider</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItem">CompletionItem</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A completion provider.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="triggerCharacters"></a><span class="ts" id=3372 data-target="#details-3372" data-toggle="collapse"><span>...</span><span class="ident">triggerCharacters</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Trigger completion when the user types one of the characters.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#Disposable">Disposable</a> that unregisters this provider when being disposed.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3449">
<div class="comment"><p>Register a formatting provider for a document range.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> A document range provider is also a <a href="#DocumentFormattingEditProvider">document formatter</a>
which means there is no need to <a href="#languages.registerDocumentFormattingEditProvider">register</a> a document
formatter when also registering a range provider.</p>
<p>Multiple providers can be registered for a language. In that case providers are sorted

of the selected provider will cause a failure of the whole operation.</p>

<a name="languages.registerDocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider"></a><span class="ts" id=3440 data-target="#details-3440" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerDocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">selector</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentSelector">DocumentSelector</a>, <span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider">DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider</a>, <span class="ident">legend</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokensLegend">SemanticTokensLegend</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3440">
<div class="comment"><p>Register a semantic tokens provider for a document range.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> If a document has both a <code>DocumentSemanticTokensProvider</code> and a <code>DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider</code>,
the range provider will be invoked only initially, for the time in which the full document provider takes
to resolve the first request. Once the full document provider resolves the first request, the semantic tokens
provided via the range provider will be discarded and from that point forward, only the document provider
will be used.</p>
<p>Multiple providers can be registered for a language. In that case providers are sorted
by their <a href="#languages.match">score</a> and the best-matching provider is used. Failure
of the selected provider will cause a failure of the whole operation.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="provider"></a><span class="ts" id=3442 data-target="#details-3442" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider">DocumentRangeSemanticTokensProvider</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A document range semantic tokens provider.</p>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3480">
<div class="comment"><p>Register a folding range provider.</p>
<p>Multiple providers can be registered for a language. In that case providers are asked in
parallel and the results are merged.
If multiple folding ranges start at the same position, only the range of the first registered provider is used.
If a folding range overlaps with an other range that has a smaller position, it is also ignored.</p>
<p>A failing provider (rejected promise or exception) will
not cause a failure of the whole operation.</p>
</div>

<table class="table table-bordered">

</table>
</div>

## notebooks



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for notebooks.</p>
<p>The notebooks functionality is composed of three loosely coupled components:</p>
<ol>
<li><a href="#NotebookSerializer">NotebookSerializer</a> enable the editor to open, show, and save notebooks</li>
<li><a href="#NotebookController">NotebookController</a> own the execution of notebooks, e.g they create output from code cells.</li>
<li>NotebookRenderer present notebook output in the editor. They run in a separate context.</li>
</ol>
</div>

#### Functions

<a name="window.registerUriHandler"></a><span class="ts" id=2721 data-target="#details-2721" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerUriHandler</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">handler</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#UriHandler">UriHandler</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2721">
<div class="comment"><p>Registers a <a href="#UriHandler">uri handler</a> capable of handling system-wide <a href="#Uri">uris</a>.
In case there are multiple windows open, the topmost window will handle the uri.
A uri handler is scoped to the extension it is contributed from; it will only
be able to handle uris which are directed to the extension itself. A uri must respect
the following rules:</p>
<ul>
<li>The uri-scheme must be <code>vscode.env.uriScheme</code>;</li>
<li>The uri-authority must be the extension id (e.g. <code>my.extension</code>);</li>
<li>The uri-path, -query and -fragment parts are arbitrary.</li>
</ul>
<p>For example, if the <code>my.extension</code> extension registers a uri handler, it will only
be allowed to handle uris with the prefix <code>product-name://my.extension</code>.</p>
<p>An extension can only register a single uri handler in its entire activation lifetime.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Note:</em> There is an activation event <code>onUri</code> that fires when a uri directed for
the current extension is about to be handled.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="handler"></a><span class="ts" id=2722 data-target="#details-2722" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">handler</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#UriHandler">UriHandler</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The uri handler to register for this extension.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#Disposable">disposable</a> that unregisters the handler.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="window.withProgress"></a><span class="ts" id=2682 data-target="#details-2682" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">withProgress</span><span>&lt;</span>R<span>&gt;</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProgressOptions">ProgressOptions</a>, <span class="ident">task</span><span>: </span>(progress: <a class="type-ref" href="#Progress">Progress</a>&lt;{increment: <span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, message: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}&gt;, token: <a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a>) =&gt; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#R">R</a>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#R">R</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2682">
<div class="comment"><p>Show progress in the editor. Progress is shown while running the given callback
and while the promise it returned isn&#39;t resolved nor rejected. The location at which
progress should show (and other details) is defined via the passed <a href="#ProgressOptions">ProgressOptions</a>.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="options"></a><span class="ts" id=2684 data-target="#details-2684" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProgressOptions">ProgressOptions</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#ProgressOptions">ProgressOptions</a>-object describing the options to use for showing progress, like its location</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="task"></a><span class="ts" id=2685 data-target="#details-2685" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">task</span><span>: </span>(progress: <a class="type-ref" href="#Progress">Progress</a>&lt;{increment: <span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, message: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}&gt;, token: <a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a>) =&gt; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#R">R</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A callback returning a promise. Progress state can be reported with
the provided <a href="#Progress">Progress</a>-object.</p>
<p>To report discrete progress, use <code>increment</code> to indicate how much work has been completed. Each call with
a <code>increment</code> value will be summed up and reflected as overall progress until 100% is reached (a value of
e.g. <code>10</code> accounts for <code>10%</code> of work done).
Note that currently only <code>ProgressLocation.Notification</code> is capable of showing discrete progress.</p>
<p>To monitor if the operation has been cancelled by the user, use the provided <a href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a>.
Note that currently only <code>ProgressLocation.Notification</code> is supporting to show a cancel button to cancel the
long running operation.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#R">R</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The thenable the task-callback returned.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

## workspace



<div class="comment"><p>Namespace for dealing with the current workspace. A workspace is the collection of one
or more folders that are opened in an editor window (instance).</p>
<p>It is also possible to open an editor without a workspace. For example, when you open a
new editor window by selecting a file from your platform&#39;s File menu, you will not be
inside a workspace. In this mode, some of the editor&#39;s capabilities are reduced but you can
still open text files and edit them.</p>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a> for more information on
the concept of workspaces.</p>
<p>The workspace offers support for <a href="#workspace.createFileSystemWatcher">listening</a> to fs
events and for <a href="#workspace.findFiles">finding</a> files. Both perform well and run <em>outside</em>
the editor-process so that they should be always used instead of nodejs-equivalents.</p>
</div>

#### Variables



<a name="workspace.fs"></a><span class="ts" id=3310 data-target="#details-3310" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">fs</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FileSystem">FileSystem</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3310">
<div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#FileSystem">file system</a> instance that allows to interact with local and remote
files, e.g. <code>vscode.workspace.fs.readDirectory(someUri)</code> allows to retrieve all entries
of a directory or <code>vscode.workspace.fs.stat(anotherUri)</code> returns the meta data for a
file.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.isTrusted"></a><span class="ts" id=3335 data-target="#details-3335" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isTrusted</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3335">
<div class="comment"><p>When true, the user has explicitly trusted the contents of the workspace.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.name"></a><span class="ts" id=3313 data-target="#details-3313" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">name</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3313">
<div class="comment"><p>The name of the workspace. <code>undefined</code> when no workspace
has been opened.</p>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a> for more information on
the concept of workspaces.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.notebookDocuments"></a><span class="ts" id=3322 data-target="#details-3322" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebookDocuments</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3322">
<div class="comment"><p>All notebook documents currently known to the editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.rootPath"></a><span class="ts" id=3311 data-target="#details-3311" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">rootPath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3311">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of the first entry of <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspaceFolders</a>
as <code>string</code>. <code>undefined</code> if there is no first entry.</p>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a> for more information
on workspaces.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - Use <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspaceFolders</a> instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.textDocuments"></a><span class="ts" id=3316 data-target="#details-3316" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">textDocuments</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3316">
<div class="comment"><p>All text documents currently known to the editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.workspaceFile"></a><span class="ts" id=3314 data-target="#details-3314" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">workspaceFile</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3314">
<div class="comment"><p>The location of the workspace file, for example:</p>
<p><code>file:///Users/name/Development/myProject.code-workspace</code></p>
<p>or</p>
<p><code>untitled:1555503116870</code></p>
<p>for a workspace that is untitled and not yet saved.</p>
<p>Depending on the workspace that is opened, the value will be:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>undefined</code> when no workspace is opened</li>
<li>the path of the workspace file as <code>Uri</code> otherwise. if the workspace
is untitled, the returned URI will use the <code>untitled:</code> scheme</li>
</ul>
<p>The location can e.g. be used with the <code>vscode.openFolder</code> command to
open the workspace again after it has been closed.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">commands</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">executeCommand</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;vscode.openFolder&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uriOfWorkspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a> for more information on
the concept of workspaces.</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> it is not advised to use <code>workspace.workspaceFile</code> to write
configuration data into the file. You can use <code>workspace.getConfiguration().update()</code>
for that purpose which will work both when a single folder is opened as
well as an untitled or saved workspace.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.workspaceFolders"></a><span class="ts" id=3312 data-target="#details-3312" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">workspaceFolders</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>[] &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3312">
<div class="comment"><p>List of workspace folders (0-N) that are open in the editor. <code>undefined</code> when no workspace
has been opened.</p>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a> for more information
on workspaces.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="workspace.onDidChangeConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=3334 data-target="#details-3334" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeConfiguration</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#ConfigurationChangeEvent">ConfigurationChangeEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3334">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when the <a href="#WorkspaceConfiguration">configuration</a> changed.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidChangeNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3323 data-target="#details-3323" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeNotebookDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocumentChangeEvent">NotebookDocumentChangeEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3323">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a> has changed.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3319 data-target="#details-3319" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeTextDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocumentChangeEvent">TextDocumentChangeEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3319">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#TextDocument">text document</a> is changed. This usually happens
when the <a href="#TextDocument.getText">contents</a> changes but also when other things like the
<a href="#TextDocument.isDirty">dirty</a>-state changes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders"></a><span class="ts" id=3315 data-target="#details-3315" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent">WorkspaceFoldersChangeEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3315">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a workspace folder is added or removed.</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> this event will not fire if the first workspace folder is added, removed or changed,
because in that case the currently executing extensions (including the one that listens to this
event) will be terminated and restarted so that the (deprecated) <code>rootPath</code> property is updated
to point to the first workspace folder.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidCloseNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3327 data-target="#details-3327" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidCloseNotebookDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3327">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a> is disposed.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> There is no guarantee that this event fires when an editor tab is closed.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> A notebook can be open but not shown in an editor which means this event can fire
for a notebook that has not been shown in an editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidCloseTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3318 data-target="#details-3318" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidCloseTextDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3318">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#TextDocument">text document</a> is disposed or when the language id
of a text document <a href="#languages.setTextDocumentLanguage">has been changed</a>.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> There is no guarantee that this event fires when an editor tab is closed, use the
<a href="#window.onDidChangeVisibleTextEditors">onDidChangeVisibleTextEditors</a>-event to know when editors change.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> A document can be open but not shown in an editor which means this event can fire
for a document that has not been shown in an editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidCreateFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3329 data-target="#details-3329" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidCreateFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileCreateEvent">FileCreateEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3329">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files have been created.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like creating a file from the
explorer, or from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api, but this event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidDeleteFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3331 data-target="#details-3331" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidDeleteFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileDeleteEvent">FileDeleteEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3331">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files have been deleted.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like deleting a file from the
explorer, or from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api, but this event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> When deleting a folder with children only one event is fired.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidGrantWorkspaceTrust"></a><span class="ts" id=3336 data-target="#details-3336" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidGrantWorkspaceTrust</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3336">
<div class="comment"><p>Event that fires when the current workspace has been trusted.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidOpenNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3326 data-target="#details-3326" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidOpenNotebookDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3326">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a> is opened.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidOpenTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3317 data-target="#details-3317" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidOpenTextDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3317">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#TextDocument">text document</a> is opened or when the language id
of a text document <a href="#languages.setTextDocumentLanguage">has been changed</a>.</p>
<p>To add an event listener when a visible text document is opened, use the <a href="#TextEditor">TextEditor</a> events in the
<a href="#window">window</a> namespace. Note that:</p>
<ul>
<li>The event is emitted before the <a href="#TextDocument">document</a> is updated in the
<a href="#window.activeTextEditor">active text editor</a></li>
<li>When a <a href="#TextDocument">text document</a> is already open (e.g.: open in another <a href="#window.visibleTextEditors">visible text editor</a>) this event is not emitted</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onDidRenameFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3333 data-target="#details-3333" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidRenameFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileRenameEvent">FileRenameEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3333">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files have been renamed.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like renaming a file from the
explorer, and from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api, but this event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> When renaming a folder with children only one event is fired.</p>
</div>
</div>

<a name="workspace.onWillCreateFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3328 data-target="#details-3328" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onWillCreateFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileWillCreateEvent">FileWillCreateEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3328">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files are being created.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like creating a file from the
explorer, or from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api. This event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> When this event is fired, edits to files that are are being created cannot be applied.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onWillDeleteFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3330 data-target="#details-3330" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onWillDeleteFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileWillDeleteEvent">FileWillDeleteEvent</a>&gt;</span>

<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files are being deleted.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like deleting a file from the
explorer, or from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api, but this event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> When deleting a folder with children only one event is fired.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onWillRenameFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3332 data-target="#details-3332" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onWillRenameFiles</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileWillRenameEvent">FileWillRenameEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3332">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when files are being renamed.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> This event is triggered by user gestures, like renaming a file from the
explorer, and from the <a href="#workspace.applyEdit">workspace.applyEdit</a>-api, but this event is <em>not</em> fired when
files change on disk, e.g triggered by another application, or when using the
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a>-api.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> When renaming a folder with children only one event is fired.</p>
</div>

<a name="workspace.onWillSaveNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3324 data-target="#details-3324" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onWillSaveNotebookDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent">NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3324">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook document</a> will be saved to disk.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> Subscribers can delay saving by registering asynchronous work. For the sake of data integrity the editor
might save without firing this event. For instance when shutting down with dirty files.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> Subscribers are called sequentially and they can <a href="#NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil">delay</a> saving
by registering asynchronous work. Protection against misbehaving listeners is implemented as such:</p>
<ul>
<li>there is an overall time budget that all listeners share and if that is exhausted no further listener is called</li>
<li>listeners that take a long time or produce errors frequently will not be called anymore</li>
</ul>
<p>The current thresholds are 1.5 seconds as overall time budget and a listener can misbehave 3 times before being ignored.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.onWillSaveTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3320 data-target="#details-3320" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onWillSaveTextDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocumentWillSaveEvent">TextDocumentWillSaveEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3320">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that is emitted when a <a href="#TextDocument">text document</a> will be saved to disk.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> Subscribers can delay saving by registering asynchronous work. For the sake of data integrity the editor
might save without firing this event. For instance when shutting down with dirty files.</p>
<p><em>Note 2:</em> Subscribers are called sequentially and they can <a href="#TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil">delay</a> saving
by registering asynchronous work. Protection against misbehaving listeners is implemented as such:</p>
<ul>
<li>there is an overall time budget that all listeners share and if that is exhausted no further listener is called</li>
<li>listeners that take a long time or produce errors frequently will not be called anymore</li>
</ul>
<p>The current thresholds are 1.5 seconds as overall time budget and a listener can misbehave 3 times before being ignored.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Functions



<a name="workspace.applyEdit"></a><span class="ts" id=3266 data-target="#details-3266" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">applyEdit</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">edit</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceEdit">WorkspaceEdit</a>, <span class="ident">metadata</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceEditMetadata">WorkspaceEditMetadata</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3266">
<div class="comment"><p>Make changes to one or many resources or create, delete, and rename resources as defined by the given
<a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>
<p>All changes of a workspace edit are applied in the same order in which they have been added. If
multiple textual inserts are made at the same position, these strings appear in the resulting text
in the order the &#39;inserts&#39; were made, unless that are interleaved with resource edits. Invalid sequences
like &#39;delete file a&#39; -&gt; &#39;insert text in file a&#39; cause failure of the operation.</p>
<p>When applying a workspace edit that consists only of text edits an &#39;all-or-nothing&#39;-strategy is used.
A workspace edit with resource creations or deletions aborts the operation, e.g. consecutive edits will
not be attempted, when a single edit fails.</p>
</div>
