<a name="workspace.createFileSystemWatcher"></a><span class="ts" id=3245 data-target="#details-3245" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">globPattern</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a>, <span class="ident">ignoreCreateEvents</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, <span class="ident">ignoreChangeEvents</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, <span class="ident">ignoreDeleteEvents</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FileSystemWatcher">FileSystemWatcher</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3245">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a file system watcher that is notified on file events (create, change, delete)
depending on the parameters provided.</p>
<p>By default, all opened <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace folders</a> will be watched
for file changes recursively.</p>
<p>Additional paths can be added for file watching by providing a <a href="#RelativePattern">RelativePattern</a> with
a <code>base</code> path to watch. If the <code>pattern</code> is complex (e.g. contains <code>**</code> or path segments),
the path will be watched recursively and otherwise will be watched non-recursively (i.e. only
changes to the first level of the path will be reported).</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that requests for recursive file watchers for a <code>base</code> path that is inside the opened
workspace are ignored given all opened <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace folders</a> are
watched for file changes recursively by default. Non-recursive file watchers however are always
supported, even inside the opened workspace because they allow to bypass the configured settings
for excludes (<code>files.watcherExclude</code>). If you need to watch in a location that is typically
excluded (for example <code>node_modules</code> or <code>.git</code> folder), then you can use a non-recursive watcher
in the workspace for this purpose.</p>
<p>If possible, keep the use of recursive watchers to a minimum because recursive file watching
is quite resource intense.</p>
<p>Providing a <code>string</code> as <code>globPattern</code> acts as convenience method for watching file events in
all opened workspace folders. It cannot be used to add more folders for file watching, nor will
it report any file events from folders that are not part of the opened workspace folders.</p>
<p>Optionally, flags to ignore certain kinds of events can be provided.</p>
<p>To stop listening to events the watcher must be disposed.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that file events from recursive file watchers may be excluded based on user configuration.
The setting <code>files.watcherExclude</code> helps to reduce the overhead of file events from folders
that are known to produce many file changes at once (such as <code>node_modules</code> folders). As such,
it is highly recommended to watch with simple patterns that do not require recursive watchers
where the exclude settings are ignored and you have full control over the events.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that symbolic links are not automatically followed for file watching unless the path to
watch itself is a symbolic link.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that file changes for the path to be watched may not be delivered when the path itself
changes. For example, when watching a path <code>/Users/somename/Desktop</code> and the path itself is
being deleted, the watcher may not report an event and may not work anymore from that moment on.
The underlying behaviour depends on the path that is provided for watching:</p>
<ul>
<li>if the path is within any of the workspace folders, deletions are tracked and reported unless
excluded via <code>files.watcherExclude</code> setting</li>
<li>if the path is equal to any of the workspace folders, deletions are not tracked</li>
<li>if the path is outside of any of the workspace folders, deletions are not tracked</li>
</ul>
<p>If you are interested in being notified when the watched path itself is being deleted, you have
to watch it&#39;s parent folder. Make sure to use a simple <code>pattern</code> (such as putting the name of the
folder) to not accidentally watch all sibling folders recursively.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that the file paths that are reported for having changed may have a different path casing
compared to the actual casing on disk on case-insensitive platforms (typically macOS and Windows
but not Linux). We allow a user to open a workspace folder with any desired path casing and try
to preserve that. This means:</p>
<ul>
<li>if the path is within any of the workspace folders, the path will match the casing of the
workspace folder up to that portion of the path and match the casing on disk for children</li>
<li>if the path is outside of any of the workspace folders, the casing will match the case of the
path that was provided for watching
In the same way, symbolic links are preserved, i.e. the file event will report the path of the
symbolic link as it was provided for watching and not the target.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="examples">Examples</h3>
<p>The basic anatomy of a file watcher is as follows:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">watcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;, &lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">pattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;));</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">watcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onDidChange</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// listen to files being changed</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">watcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onDidCreate</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// listen to files/folders being created</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">watcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onDidDelete</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// listen to files/folders getting deleted</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">watcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">dispose</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// dispose after usage</span></span></code></pre>
<h4 id="workspace-file-watching">Workspace file watching</h4>
<p>If you only care about file events in a specific workspace folder:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">[</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">], </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/*.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>If you want to monitor file events across all opened workspace folders:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/*.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p><em>Note:</em> the array of workspace folders can be empty if no workspace is opened (empty window).</p>
<h4 id="out-of-workspace-file-watching">Out of workspace file watching</h4>
<p>To watch a folder for changes to *.js files outside the workspace (non recursively), pass in a <code>Uri</code> to such
a folder:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">to</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">outside</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;), </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span></code></pre>
<p>And use a complex glob pattern to watch recursively:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">to</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">outside</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;), </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/*.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span></code></pre>
<p>Here is an example for watching the active editor for file changes:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createFileSystemWatcher</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">activeTextEditor</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">document</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

<a name="workspace.findFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=3251 data-target="#details-3251" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">findFiles</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">include</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a>, <span class="ident">exclude</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a>, <span class="ident">maxResults</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3251">
<div class="comment"><p>Find files across all <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace folders</a> in the workspace.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong></p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">findFiles</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/*.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/node_modules/**&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">10</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="include"></a><span class="ts" id=3252 data-target="#details-3252" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">include</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#GlobPattern">glob pattern</a> that defines the files to search for. The glob pattern
will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. Use a <a href="#RelativePattern">relative pattern</a>
to restrict the search results to a <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folder</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="exclude"></a><span class="ts" id=3253 data-target="#details-3253" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">exclude</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#GlobPattern">glob pattern</a> that defines files and folders to exclude. The glob pattern
will be matched against the file paths of resulting matches relative to their workspace. When <code>undefined</code>, default file-excludes (e.g. the <code>files.exclude</code>-setting
but not <code>search.exclude</code>) will apply. When <code>null</code>, no excludes will apply.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="maxResults"></a><span class="ts" id=3254 data-target="#details-3254" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">maxResults</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An upper-bound for the result.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=3255 data-target="#details-3255" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A token that can be used to signal cancellation to the underlying search engine.</p>
</div></td></tr>

<a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace folders</a> are opened.</p>
</div></td></tr>

<a name="workspace.getConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=3295 data-target="#details-3295" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">getConfiguration</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">section</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">scope</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ConfigurationScope">ConfigurationScope</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceConfiguration">WorkspaceConfiguration</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3295">
<div class="comment"><p>Get a workspace configuration object.</p>
<p>When a section-identifier is provided only that part of the configuration
is returned. Dots in the section-identifier are interpreted as child-access,
like <code>{ myExt: { setting: { doIt: true }}}</code> and <code>getConfiguration(&#39;myExt.setting&#39;).get(&#39;doIt&#39;) === true</code>.</p>
<p>When a scope is provided configuration confined to that scope is returned. Scope can be a resource or a language identifier or both.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="section"></a><span class="ts" id=3296 data-target="#details-3296" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">section</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A dot-separated identifier.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="scope"></a><span class="ts" id=3297 data-target="#details-3297" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">scope</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ConfigurationScope">ConfigurationScope</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A scope for which the configuration is asked for.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceConfiguration">WorkspaceConfiguration</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The full configuration or a subset.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.getWorkspaceFolder"></a><span class="ts" id=3230 data-target="#details-3230" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">getWorkspaceFolder</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3230">
<div class="comment"><p>Returns the <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folder</a> that contains a given uri.</p>
<ul>
<li>returns <code>undefined</code> when the given uri doesn&#39;t match any workspace folder</li>
<li>returns the <em>input</em> when the given uri is a workspace folder itself</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="uri"></a><span class="ts" id=3231 data-target="#details-3231" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An uri.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A workspace folder or <code>undefined</code></p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.openNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3284 data-target="#details-3284" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openNotebookDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3284">
<div class="comment"><p>Open a notebook. Will return early if this notebook is already <a href="#workspace.notebookDocuments">loaded</a>. Otherwise
the notebook is loaded and the <a href="#workspace.onDidOpenNotebookDocument">onDidOpenNotebookDocument</a>-event fires.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that the lifecycle of the returned notebook is owned by the editor and not by the extension. That means an
<a href="#workspace.onDidCloseNotebookDocument">onDidCloseNotebookDocument</a>-event can occur at any time after.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that opening a notebook does not show a notebook editor. This function only returns a notebook document which
can be shown in a notebook editor but it can also be used for other things.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="uri"></a><span class="ts" id=3285 data-target="#details-3285" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The resource to open.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves to a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a></p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.openNotebookDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3286 data-target="#details-3286" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openNotebookDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">notebookType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">content</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookData">NotebookData</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3286">
<div class="comment"><p>Open an untitled notebook. The editor will prompt the user for a file
path when the document is to be saved.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#workspace.openNotebookDocument">workspace.openNotebookDocument</a></p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="notebookType"></a><span class="ts" id=3287 data-target="#details-3287" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebookType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The notebook type that should be used.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="content"></a><span class="ts" id=3288 data-target="#details-3288" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">content</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookData">NotebookData</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The initial contents of the notebook.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves to a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.openTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3270 data-target="#details-3270" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openTextDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3270">
<div class="comment"><p>Opens a document. Will return early if this document is already open. Otherwise
the document is loaded and the <a href="#workspace.onDidOpenTextDocument">didOpen</a>-event fires.</p>
<p>The document is denoted by an <a href="#Uri">Uri</a>. Depending on the <a href="#Uri.scheme">scheme</a> the
following rules apply:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>file</code>-scheme: Open a file on disk (<code>openTextDocument(Uri.file(path))</code>). Will be rejected if the file
does not exist or cannot be loaded.</li>
<li><code>untitled</code>-scheme: Open a blank untitled file with associated path (<code>openTextDocument(Uri.file(path).with({ scheme: &#39;untitled&#39; }))</code>).
The language will be derived from the file name.</li>
<li>For all other schemes contributed <a href="#TextDocumentContentProvider">text document content providers</a> and
<a href="#FileSystemProvider">file system providers</a> are consulted.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Note</em> that the lifecycle of the returned document is owned by the editor and not by the extension. That means an
<a href="#workspace.onDidCloseTextDocument">onDidClose</a>-event can occur at any time after opening it.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="uri"></a><span class="ts" id=3271 data-target="#details-3271" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Identifies the resource to open.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves to a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.openTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3272 data-target="#details-3272" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openTextDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">path</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3272">
<div class="comment"><p>A short-hand for <code>openTextDocument(Uri.file(path))</code>.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#workspace.openTextDocument">workspace.openTextDocument</a></p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="path"></a><span class="ts" id=3273 data-target="#details-3273" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">path</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A path of a file on disk.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves to a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.openTextDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=3274 data-target="#details-3274" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openTextDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>{content: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, language: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3274">
<div class="comment"><p>Opens an untitled text document. The editor will prompt the user for a file
path when the document is to be saved. The <code>options</code> parameter allows to
specify the <em>language</em> and/or the <em>content</em> of the document.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="options"></a><span class="ts" id=3275 data-target="#details-3275" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>{content: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, language: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Options to control how the document will be created.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves to a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="workspace.registerFileSystemProvider"></a><span class="ts" id=3303 data-target="#details-3303" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerFileSystemProvider</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">scheme</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FileSystemProvider">FileSystemProvider</a>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>{isCaseSensitive: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, isReadonly: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="provider"></a><span class="ts" id=3305 data-target="#details-3305" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provider</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FileSystemProvider">FileSystemProvider</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The filesystem provider.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="options"></a><span class="ts" id=3306 data-target="#details-3306" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>{isCaseSensitive: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, isReadonly: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a>}</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Immutable metadata about the provider.</p>

<a name="workspace.registerNotebookSerializer"></a><span class="ts" id=3290 data-target="#details-3290" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">registerNotebookSerializer</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">notebookType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">serializer</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookSerializer">NotebookSerializer</a>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocumentContentOptions">NotebookDocumentContentOptions</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>

<a name="workspace.updateWorkspaceFolders"></a><span class="ts" id=3237 data-target="#details-3237" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">updateWorkspaceFolders</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, <span class="ident">deleteCount</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, <span>...</span><span class="ident">workspaceFoldersToAdd</span><span>: </span>Array&lt;{name: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, uri: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>}&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3237">
<div class="comment"><p>This method replaces <code>deleteCount</code> <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace folders</a> starting at index <code>start</code>
by an optional set of <code>workspaceFoldersToAdd</code> on the <code>vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders</code> array. This &quot;splice&quot;
behavior can be used to add, remove and change workspace folders in a single operation.</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> in some cases calling this method may result in the currently executing extensions (including the
one that called this method) to be terminated and restarted. For example when the first workspace folder is
added, removed or changed the (deprecated) <code>rootPath</code> property is updated to point to the first workspace
folder. Another case is when transitioning from an empty or single-folder workspace into a multi-folder
workspace (see also: <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces">https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/workspaces</a>).</p>
<p>Use the <a href="#workspace.onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders">onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders()</a> event to get notified when the
workspace folders have been updated.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> adding a new workspace folder at the end of workspace folders</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">updateWorkspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">?</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">length</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #569CD6">null</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span></code></pre>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> removing the first workspace folder</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">updateWorkspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> replacing an existing workspace folder with a new one</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">updateWorkspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span></code></pre>
<p>It is valid to remove an existing workspace folder and add it again with a different name
to rename that folder.</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> it is not valid to call <a href="#workspace.updateWorkspaceFolders">updateWorkspaceFolders()</a> multiple times
without waiting for the <a href="#workspace.onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders">onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders()</a> to fire.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="start"></a><span class="ts" id=3238 data-target="#details-3238" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>the zero-based location in the list of currently opened <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folders</a>
from which to start deleting workspace folders.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="deleteCount"></a><span class="ts" id=3239 data-target="#details-3239" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">deleteCount</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>the optional number of workspace folders to remove.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="workspaceFoldersToAdd"></a><span class="ts" id=3240 data-target="#details-3240" data-toggle="collapse"><span>...</span><span class="ident">workspaceFoldersToAdd</span><span>: </span>Array&lt;{name: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, uri: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>}&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>the optional variable set of workspace folders to add in place of the deleted ones.
Each workspace is identified with a mandatory URI and an optional name.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>true if the operation was successfully started and false otherwise if arguments were used that would result
in invalid workspace folder state (e.g. 2 folders with the same URI).</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="AccessibilityInformation"></a><span class="code-item" id=1829>AccessibilityInformation</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Accessibility information which controls screen reader behavior.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="AccessibilityInformation.label"></a><span class="ts" id=1830 data-target="#details-1830" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1830">
<div class="comment"><p>Label to be read out by a screen reader once the item has focus.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="AccessibilityInformation.role"></a><span class="ts" id=1831 data-target="#details-1831" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">role</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1831">
<div class="comment"><p>Role of the widget which defines how a screen reader interacts with it.
The role should be set in special cases when for example a tree-like element behaves like a checkbox.
If role is not specified the editor will pick the appropriate role automatically.
More about aria roles can be found here <a href="https://w3c.github.io/aria/#widget_roles">https://w3c.github.io/aria/#widget_roles</a></p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=4153>AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Optional options to be used when calling <a href="#authentication.getSession">authentication.getSession</a> with the flag <code>forceNewSession</code>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions.detail"></a><span class="ts" id=4154 data-target="#details-4154" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">detail</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4154">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional message that will be displayed to the user when we ask to re-authenticate. Providing additional context
as to why you are asking a user to re-authenticate can help increase the odds that they will accept.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="AuthenticationGetSessionOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=4155>AuthenticationGetSessionOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Options to be used when getting an <a href="#AuthenticationSession">AuthenticationSession</a> from an <a href="#AuthenticationProvider">AuthenticationProvider</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.clearSessionPreference"></a><span class="ts" id=4156 data-target="#details-4156" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">clearSessionPreference</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4156">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the existing session preference should be cleared.</p>
<p>For authentication providers that support being signed into multiple accounts at once, the user will be
prompted to select an account to use when <a href="#authentication.getSession">getSession</a> is called. This preference
is remembered until <a href="#authentication.getSession">getSession</a> is called with this flag.</p>
<p>Note:
The preference is extension specific. So if one extension calls <a href="#authentication.getSession">getSession</a>, it will not
affect the session preference for another extension calling <a href="#authentication.getSession">getSession</a>. Additionally,
the preference is set for the current workspace and also globally. This means that new workspaces will use the &quot;global&quot;
value at first and then when this flag is provided, a new value can be set for that workspace. This also means
that pre-existing workspaces will not lose their preference if a new workspace sets this flag.</p>
<p>Defaults to false.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.createIfNone"></a><span class="ts" id=4157 data-target="#details-4157" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createIfNone</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4157">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether login should be performed if there is no matching session.</p>
<p>If true, a modal dialog will be shown asking the user to sign in. If false, a numbered badge will be shown
on the accounts activity bar icon. An entry for the extension will be added under the menu to sign in. This
allows quietly prompting the user to sign in.</p>
<p>If there is a matching session but the extension has not been granted access to it, setting this to true
will also result in an immediate modal dialog, and false will add a numbered badge to the accounts icon.</p>
<p>Defaults to false.</p>
<p>Note: you cannot use this option with <a href="#AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.silent">silent</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.forceNewSession"></a><span class="ts" id=4158 data-target="#details-4158" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">forceNewSession</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions">AuthenticationForceNewSessionOptions</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4158">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether we should attempt to reauthenticate even if there is already a session available.</p>
<p>If true, a modal dialog will be shown asking the user to sign in again. This is mostly used for scenarios
where the token needs to be re minted because it has lost some authorization.</p>
<p>If there are no existing sessions and forceNewSession is true, it will behave identically to
<a href="#AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.createIfNone">createIfNone</a>.</p>
<p>This defaults to false.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.silent"></a><span class="ts" id=4159 data-target="#details-4159" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">silent</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4159">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether we should show the indication to sign in in the Accounts menu.</p>
<p>If false, the user will be shown a badge on the Accounts menu with an option to sign in for the extension.
If true, no indication will be shown.</p>
<p>Defaults to false.</p>
<p>Note: you cannot use this option with any other options that prompt the user like <a href="#AuthenticationGetSessionOptions.createIfNone">createIfNone</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="AuthenticationProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=4171>AuthenticationProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A provider for performing authentication to a service.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="AuthenticationProvider.onDidChangeSessions"></a><span class="ts" id=4172 data-target="#details-4172" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeSessions</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#AuthenticationProviderAuthenticationSessionsChangeEvent">AuthenticationProviderAuthenticationSessionsChangeEvent</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4172">
<div class="comment"><p>An <a href="#Event">Event</a> which fires when the array of sessions has changed, or data
within a session has changed.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="AuthenticationProvider.createSession"></a><span class="ts" id=4177 data-target="#details-4177" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createSession</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">scopes</span><span>: </span>readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#AuthenticationSession">AuthenticationSession</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4177">
<div class="comment"><p>Prompts a user to login.</p>
<p>If login is successful, the onDidChangeSessions event should be fired.</p>
<p>If login fails, a rejected promise should be returned.</p>
<p>If the provider has specified that it does not support multiple accounts,
then this should never be called if there is already an existing session matching these
scopes.</p>
</div>

<a name="AuthenticationProvider.removeSession"></a><span class="ts" id=4180 data-target="#details-4180" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">removeSession</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">sessionId</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>

### <a name="CallHierarchyProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1494>CallHierarchyProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The call hierarchy provider interface describes the contract between extensions
and the call hierarchy feature which allows to browse calls and caller of function,
methods, constructor etc.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="CallHierarchyProvider.prepareCallHierarchy"></a><span class="ts" id=1496 data-target="#details-1496" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">prepareCallHierarchy</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CallHierarchyItem">CallHierarchyItem</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#CallHierarchyItem">CallHierarchyItem</a>[]&gt;</span>

### <a name="CancellationToken"></a><span class="code-item" id=432>CancellationToken</span>

operation to request cancellation, like cancelling a request

<a href="#CancellationTokenSource">CancellationTokenSource</a>.</p>
</div>

### <a name="CodeAction"></a><span class="code-item" id=616>CodeAction</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A code action represents a change that can be performed in code, e.g. to fix a problem or
to refactor code.</p>
<p>A CodeAction must set either <a href="#CodeAction.edit">edit</a> and/or a <a href="#CodeAction.command">command</a>. If both are supplied, the <code>edit</code> is applied first, then the command is executed.</p>
</div>

</li>

<li><p>If the user has a <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/refactoring#_keybindings-for-code-actions">keybinding</a>
that auto applies a code action and only a disabled code actions are returned, the editor will show the user an
error message with <code>reason</code> in the editor.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

### <a name="CodeActionKind"></a><span class="code-item" id=584>CodeActionKind</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Kind of a code action.</p>
<p>Kinds are a hierarchical list of identifiers separated by <code>.</code>, e.g. <code>&quot;refactor.extract.function&quot;</code>.</p>
<p>Code action kinds are used by the editor for UI elements such as the refactoring context menu. Users
can also trigger code actions with a specific kind with the <code>editor.action.codeAction</code> command.</p>
</div>

#### Static



<a name="CodeActionKind.Empty"></a><span class="ts" id=585 data-target="#details-585" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Empty</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CodeActionKind">CodeActionKind</a></span>

</div>
</div>



<a name="CodeActionKind.Notebook"></a><span class="ts" id=595 data-target="#details-595" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Notebook</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CodeActionKind">CodeActionKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-595">
<div class="comment"><p>Base kind for all code actions applying to the enitre notebook&#39;s scope. CodeActionKinds using
this should always begin with <code>notebook.</code></p>
<p>This requires that new CodeActions be created for it and contributed via extensions.
Pre-existing kinds can not just have the new <code>notebook.</code> prefix added to them, as the functionality
is unique to the full-notebook scope.</p>
<p>Notebook CodeActionKinds can be initialized as either of the following (both resulting in <code>notebook.source.xyz</code>):</p>
<ul>
<li><code>const newKind =  CodeActionKind.Notebook.append(CodeActionKind.Source.append(&#39;xyz&#39;).value)</code></li>
<li><code>const newKind =  CodeActionKind.Notebook.append(&#39;source.xyz&#39;)</code></li>
</ul>
<p>Example Kinds/Actions:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>notebook.source.organizeImports</code> (might move all imports to a new top cell)</li>
<li><code>notebook.source.normalizeVariableNames</code> (might rename all variables to a standardized casing format)</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="CodeActionProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=630>CodeActionProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provides contextual actions for code. Code actions typically either fix problems or beautify/refactor code.</p>
<p>Code actions are surfaced to users in a few different ways:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_code-action">lightbulb</a> feature, which shows
a list of code actions at the current cursor position. The lightbulb&#39;s list of actions includes both quick fixes
and refactorings.</li>
<li>As commands that users can run, such as <code>Refactor</code>. Users can run these from the command palette or with keybindings.</li>
<li>As source actions, such <code>Organize Imports</code>.</li>
<li><a href="#CodeActionKind.QuickFix">Quick fixes</a> are shown in the problems view.</li>
<li>Change applied on save by the <code>editor.codeActionsOnSave</code> setting.</li>
</ul>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="CodeActionProvider.provideCodeActions"></a><span class="ts" id=632 data-target="#details-632" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideCodeActions</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">range</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Selection">Selection</a>, <span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CodeActionContext">CodeActionContext</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;Array&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-632">
<div class="comment"><p>Get code actions for a given range in a document.</p>
<p>Only return code actions that are relevant to user for the requested range. Also keep in mind how the
returned code actions will appear in the UI. The lightbulb widget and <code>Refactor</code> commands for instance show
returned code actions as a list, so do not return a large number of code actions that will overwhelm the user.</p>
</div>

This will always be a

You can use this
to see what specific type of code actions are being requested by the editor in order to return more relevant
actions and avoid returning irrelevant code actions that the editor will discard.</p>
</div></td></tr>

### <a name="CodeActionProviderMetadata"></a><span class="code-item" id=642>CodeActionProviderMetadata</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Metadata about the type of code actions that a <a href="#CodeActionProvider">CodeActionProvider</a> provides.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="CodeActionProviderMetadata.documentation"></a><span class="ts" id=644 data-target="#details-644" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">documentation</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>ReadonlyArray&lt;{command: <a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a>, kind: <a class="type-ref" href="#CodeActionKind">CodeActionKind</a>}&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-644">
<div class="comment"><p>Static documentation for a class of code actions.</p>
<p>Documentation from the provider is shown in the code actions menu if either:</p>
<ul>
<li><p>Code actions of <code>kind</code> are requested by the editor. In this case, the editor will show the documentation that
most closely matches the requested code action kind. For example, if a provider has documentation for
both <code>Refactor</code> and <code>RefactorExtract</code>, when the user requests code actions for <code>RefactorExtract</code>,
the editor will use the documentation for <code>RefactorExtract</code> instead of the documentation for <code>Refactor</code>.</p>
</li>
<li><p>Any code actions of <code>kind</code> are returned by the provider.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>At most one documentation entry will be shown per provider.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CodeActionProviderMetadata.providedCodeActionKinds"></a><span class="ts" id=643 data-target="#details-643" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">providedCodeActionKinds</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#CodeActionKind">CodeActionKind</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-643">
<div class="comment"><p>List of <a href="#CodeActionKind">CodeActionKinds</a> that a <a href="#CodeActionProvider">CodeActionProvider</a> may return.</p>
<p>This list is used to determine if a given <code>CodeActionProvider</code> should be invoked or not.
To avoid unnecessary computation, every <code>CodeActionProvider</code> should list use <code>providedCodeActionKinds</code>. The
list of kinds may either be generic, such as <code>[CodeActionKind.Refactor]</code>, or list out every kind provided,
such as <code>[CodeActionKind.Refactor.Extract.append(&#39;function&#39;), CodeActionKind.Refactor.Extract.append(&#39;constant&#39;), ...]</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="CodeLens"></a><span class="code-item" id=648>CodeLens</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A code lens represents a <a href="#Command">Command</a> that should be shown along with
source text, like the number of references, a way to run tests, etc.</p>
<p>A code lens is <em>unresolved</em> when no command is associated to it. For performance
reasons the creation of a code lens and resolving should be done to two stages.</p>
<p><em>See also</em></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#CodeLensProvider.provideCodeLenses">CodeLensProvider.provideCodeLenses</a></li>
<li><a href="#CodeLensProvider.resolveCodeLens">CodeLensProvider.resolveCodeLens</a></li>
</ul>
</div>

### <a name="CodeLensProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=656>CodeLensProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A code lens provider adds <a href="#Command">commands</a> to source text. The commands will be shown
as dedicated horizontal lines in between the source text.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="CodeLensProvider.onDidChangeCodeLenses"></a><span class="ts" id=657 data-target="#details-657" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeCodeLenses</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-657">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional event to signal that the code lenses from this provider have changed.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="CodeLensProvider.provideCodeLenses"></a><span class="ts" id=659 data-target="#details-659" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideCodeLenses</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-659">
<div class="comment"><p>Compute a list of <a href="#CodeLens">lenses</a>. This call should return as fast as possible and if
computing the commands is expensive implementors should only return code lens objects with the
range set and implement <a href="#CodeLensProvider.resolveCodeLens">resolve</a>.</p>
</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=661 data-target="#details-661" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>

signaled by returning <code>undefined</code>, <code>null</code>, or an empty array.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="ColorPresentation"></a><span class="code-item" id=1374>ColorPresentation</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A color presentation object describes how a <a href="#Color">Color</a> should be represented as text and what
edits are required to refer to it from source code.</p>
<p>For some languages one color can have multiple presentations, e.g. css can represent the color red with
the constant <code>Red</code>, the hex-value <code>#ff0000</code>, or in rgba and hsla forms. In csharp other representations
apply, e.g. <code>System.Drawing.Color.Red</code>.</p>
</div>

</div>

#### Properties

<a name="Comment.contextValue"></a><span class="ts" id=4108 data-target="#details-4108" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">contextValue</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4108">
<div class="comment"><p>Context value of the comment. This can be used to contribute comment specific actions.
For example, a comment is given a context value as <code>editable</code>. When contributing actions to <code>comments/comment/title</code>
using <code>menus</code> extension point, you can specify context value for key <code>comment</code> in <code>when</code> expression like <code>comment == editable</code>.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;menus&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">            </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;comments/comment/title&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">                {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">                    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.deleteComment&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">                    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;when&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;comment == editable&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">                }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">            ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    }</span></span></code></pre>
<p>This will show action <code>extension.deleteComment</code> only for comments with <code>contextValue</code> is <code>editable</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-4091">
<div class="comment"><p>Context value of the comment thread. This can be used to contribute thread specific actions.
For example, a comment thread is given a context value as <code>editable</code>. When contributing actions to <code>comments/commentThread/title</code>
using <code>menus</code> extension point, you can specify context value for key <code>commentThread</code> in <code>when</code> expression like <code>commentThread == editable</code>.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;menus&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;comments/commentThread/title&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.deleteCommentThread&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;when&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;commentThread == editable&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span></code></pre>
<p>This will show action <code>extension.deleteCommentThread</code> only for comment threads with <code>contextValue</code> is <code>editable</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CommentThread.label"></a><span class="ts" id=4092 data-target="#details-4092" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>

### <a name="CompletionItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=1256>CompletionItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A completion item represents a text snippet that is proposed to complete text that is being typed.</p>
<p>It is sufficient to create a completion item from just a <a href="#CompletionItem.label">label</a>. In that
case the completion item will replace the <a href="#TextDocument.getWordRangeAtPosition">word</a>
until the cursor with the given label or <a href="#CompletionItem.insertText">insertText</a>. Otherwise the
given <a href="#CompletionItem.textEdit">edit</a> is used.</p>
<p>When selecting a completion item in the editor its defined or synthesized text edit will be applied
to <em>all</em> cursors/selections whereas <a href="#CompletionItem.additionalTextEdits">additionalTextEdits</a> will be
applied as provided.</p>
<p><em>See also</em></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#CompletionItemProvider.provideCompletionItems">CompletionItemProvider.provideCompletionItems</a></li>
<li><a href="#CompletionItemProvider.resolveCompletionItem">CompletionItemProvider.resolveCompletionItem</a></li>
</ul>
</div>

#### Constructors

<div class="details collapse" id="details-1258">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a new completion item.</p>
<p>Completion items must have at least a <a href="#CompletionItem.label">label</a> which then
will be used as insert text as well as for sorting and filtering.</p>
</div>

<table class="table table-bordered">

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="kind"></a><span class="ts" id=1260 data-target="#details-1260" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItemKind">CompletionItemKind</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#CompletionItemKind">kind</a> of the completion.</p>

<a name="CompletionItem.command"></a><span class="ts" id=1278 data-target="#details-1278" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">command</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1278">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional <a href="#Command">Command</a> that is executed <em>after</em> inserting this completion. <em>Note</em> that
additional modifications to the current document should be described with the
<a href="#CompletionItem.additionalTextEdits">additionalTextEdits</a>-property.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.commitCharacters"></a><span class="ts" id=1274 data-target="#details-1274" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">commitCharacters</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1274">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional set of characters that when pressed while this completion is active will accept it first and
then type that character. <em>Note</em> that all commit characters should have <code>length=1</code> and that superfluous
characters will be ignored.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.detail"></a><span class="ts" id=1264 data-target="#details-1264" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">detail</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1264">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string with additional information
about this item, like type or symbol information.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.documentation"></a><span class="ts" id=1265 data-target="#details-1265" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">documentation</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1265">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string that represents a doc-comment.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.filterText"></a><span class="ts" id=1267 data-target="#details-1267" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">filterText</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1267">
<div class="comment"><p>A string that should be used when filtering a set of
completion items. When <code>falsy</code> the <a href="#CompletionItem.label">label</a>
is used.</p>
<p>Note that the filter text is matched against the leading word (prefix) which is defined
by the <a href="#CompletionItem.range">range</a>-property.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.insertText"></a><span class="ts" id=1269 data-target="#details-1269" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">insertText</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#SnippetString">SnippetString</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1269">
<div class="comment"><p>A string or snippet that should be inserted in a document when selecting
this completion. When <code>falsy</code> the <a href="#CompletionItem.label">label</a>
is used.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.keepWhitespace"></a><span class="ts" id=1275 data-target="#details-1275" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">keepWhitespace</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1275">
<div class="comment"><p>Keep whitespace of the <a href="#CompletionItem.insertText">insertText</a> as is. By default, the editor adjusts leading
whitespace of new lines so that they match the indentation of the line for which the item is accepted - setting
this to <code>true</code> will prevent that.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.kind"></a><span class="ts" id=1262 data-target="#details-1262" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItemKind">CompletionItemKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1262">
<div class="comment"><p>The kind of this completion item. Based on the kind
an icon is chosen by the editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.label"></a><span class="ts" id=1261 data-target="#details-1261" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionItemLabel">CompletionItemLabel</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1261">
<div class="comment"><p>The label of this completion item. By default
this is also the text that is inserted when selecting
this completion.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.preselect"></a><span class="ts" id=1268 data-target="#details-1268" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">preselect</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1268">
<div class="comment"><p>Select this item when showing. <em>Note</em> that only one completion item can be selected and
that the editor decides which item that is. The rule is that the <em>first</em> item of those
that match best is selected.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.range"></a><span class="ts" id=1270 data-target="#details-1270" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">range</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a> &#124; {inserting: <a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a>, replacing: <a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1270">
<div class="comment"><p>A range or a insert and replace range selecting the text that should be replaced by this completion item.</p>
<p>When omitted, the range of the <a href="#TextDocument.getWordRangeAtPosition">current word</a> is used as replace-range
and as insert-range the start of the <a href="#TextDocument.getWordRangeAtPosition">current word</a> to the
current position is used.</p>
<p><em>Note 1:</em> A range must be a <a href="#Range.isSingleLine">single line</a> and it must
<a href="#Range.contains">contain</a> the position at which completion has been <a href="#CompletionItemProvider.provideCompletionItems">requested</a>.
<em>Note 2:</em> A insert range must be a prefix of a replace range, that means it must be contained and starting at the same position.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.sortText"></a><span class="ts" id=1266 data-target="#details-1266" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">sortText</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1266">
<div class="comment"><p>A string that should be used when comparing this item
with other items. When <code>falsy</code> the <a href="#CompletionItem.label">label</a>
is used.</p>
<p>Note that <code>sortText</code> is only used for the initial ordering of completion
items. When having a leading word (prefix) ordering is based on how
well completions match that prefix and the initial ordering is only used
when completions match equally well. The prefix is defined by the
<a href="#CompletionItem.range">range</a>-property and can therefore be different
for each completion.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.tags"></a><span class="ts" id=1263 data-target="#details-1263" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">tags</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#Deprecated">Deprecated</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1263">
<div class="comment"><p>Tags for this completion item.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CompletionItem.textEdit"></a><span class="ts" id=1276 data-target="#details-1276" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">textEdit</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextEdit">TextEdit</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1276">
<div class="comment"><ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - Use <code>CompletionItem.insertText</code> and <code>CompletionItem.range</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
<p>An <a href="#TextEdit">edit</a> which is applied to a document when selecting
this completion. When an edit is provided the value of
<a href="#CompletionItem.insertText">insertText</a> is ignored.</p>
<p>The <a href="#Range">Range</a> of the edit must be single-line and on the same
line completions were <a href="#CompletionItemProvider.provideCompletionItems">requested</a> at.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="CompletionItemProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1295>CompletionItemProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The completion item provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
<a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/intellisense">IntelliSense</a>.</p>
<p>Providers can delay the computation of the <a href="#CompletionItem.detail">detail</a>
and <a href="#CompletionItem.documentation">documentation</a> properties by implementing the
<a href="#CompletionItemProvider.resolveCompletionItem">resolveCompletionItem</a>-function. However, properties that
are needed for the initial sorting and filtering, like <code>sortText</code>, <code>filterText</code>, <code>insertText</code>, and <code>range</code>, must
not be changed during resolve.</p>
<p>Providers are asked for completions either explicitly by a user gesture or -depending on the configuration-
implicitly when typing words or trigger characters.</p>
</div>

#### Methods

<div class="details collapse" id="details-1297">
<div class="comment"><p>Provide completion items for the given position and document.</p>
</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="position"></a><span class="ts" id=1299 data-target="#details-1299" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The position at which the command was invoked.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1300 data-target="#details-1300" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="context"></a><span class="ts" id=1301 data-target="#details-1301" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CompletionContext">CompletionContext</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>How the completion was triggered.</p>
</div></td></tr>

The lack of a result can be signaled by returning <code>undefined</code>, <code>null</code>, or an empty array.</p>
