<a name="CompletionItemProvider.resolveCompletionItem"></a><span class="ts" id=1303 data-target="#details-1303" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveCompletionItem</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">item</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1303">
<div class="comment"><p>Given a completion item fill in more data, like <a href="#CompletionItem.documentation">doc-comment</a>
or <a href="#CompletionItem.detail">details</a>.</p>
<p>The editor will only resolve a completion item once.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that this function is called when completion items are already showing in the UI or when an item has been
selected for insertion. Because of that, no property that changes the presentation (label, sorting, filtering etc)
or the (primary) insert behaviour (<a href="#CompletionItem.insertText">insertText</a>) can be changed.</p>
<p>This function may fill in <a href="#CompletionItem.additionalTextEdits">additionalTextEdits</a>. However, that means an item might be
inserted <em>before</em> resolving is done and in that case the editor will do a best effort to still apply those additional
text edits.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

### <a name="CustomEditorProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=2422>CustomEditorProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provider for editable custom editors that use a custom document model.</p>
<p>Custom editors use <a href="#CustomDocument">CustomDocument</a> as their document model instead of a <a href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>.
This gives extensions full control over actions such as edit, save, and backup.</p>
<p>You should use this type of custom editor when dealing with binary files or more complex scenarios. For simple
text based documents, use <a href="#CustomTextEditorProvider">CustomTextEditorProvider</a> instead.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="CustomEditorProvider.onDidChangeCustomDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=2423 data-target="#details-2423" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeCustomDocument</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentEditEvent">CustomDocumentEditEvent</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;&gt; &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentContentChangeEvent">CustomDocumentContentChangeEvent</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2423">
<div class="comment"><p>Signal that an edit has occurred inside a custom editor.</p>
<p>This event must be fired by your extension whenever an edit happens in a custom editor. An edit can be
anything from changing some text, to cropping an image, to reordering a list. Your extension is free to
define what an edit is and what data is stored on each edit.</p>
<p>Firing <code>onDidChange</code> causes the editors to be marked as being dirty. This is cleared when the user either
saves or reverts the file.</p>
<p>Editors that support undo/redo must fire a <code>CustomDocumentEditEvent</code> whenever an edit happens. This allows
users to undo and redo the edit using the editor&#39;s standard keyboard shortcuts. The editor will also mark
the editor as no longer being dirty if the user undoes all edits to the last saved state.</p>
<p>Editors that support editing but cannot use the editor&#39;s standard undo/redo mechanism must fire a <code>CustomDocumentContentChangeEvent</code>.
The only way for a user to clear the dirty state of an editor that does not support undo/redo is to either
<code>save</code> or <code>revert</code> the file.</p>
<p>An editor should only ever fire <code>CustomDocumentEditEvent</code> events, or only ever fire <code>CustomDocumentContentChangeEvent</code> events.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="CustomEditorProvider.backupCustomDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=2438 data-target="#details-2438" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">backupCustomDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentBackupContext">CustomDocumentBackupContext</a>, <span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentBackup">CustomDocumentBackup</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2438">
<div class="comment"><p>Back up a dirty custom document.</p>
<p>Backups are used for hot exit and to prevent data loss. Your <code>backup</code> method should persist the resource in
its current state, i.e. with the edits applied. Most commonly this means saving the resource to disk in
the <code>ExtensionContext.storagePath</code>. When the editor reloads and your custom editor is opened for a resource,
your extension should first check to see if any backups exist for the resource. If there is a backup, your
extension should load the file contents from there instead of from the resource in the workspace.</p>
<p><code>backup</code> is triggered approximately one second after the user stops editing the document. If the user
rapidly edits the document, <code>backup</code> will not be invoked until the editing stops.</p>
<p><code>backup</code> is not invoked when <code>auto save</code> is enabled (since auto save already persists the resource).</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="document"></a><span class="ts" id=2439 data-target="#details-2439" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Document to backup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="context"></a><span class="ts" id=2440 data-target="#details-2440" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentBackupContext">CustomDocumentBackupContext</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Information that can be used to backup the document.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="cancellation"></a><span class="ts" id=2441 data-target="#details-2441" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Token that signals the current backup since a new backup is coming in. It is up to your
extension to decided how to respond to cancellation. If for example your extension is backing up a large file
in an operation that takes time to complete, your extension may decide to finish the ongoing backup rather
than cancelling it to ensure that the editor has some valid backup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#CustomDocumentBackup">CustomDocumentBackup</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

document is then passed to <code>resolveCustomEditor</code> so that the editor can be shown to the user.</p>
<p>Already opened <code>CustomDocument</code> are re-used if the user opened additional editors. When all editors for a

trigger another call to <code>openCustomDocument</code>.</p>

<a name="CustomEditorProvider.revertCustomDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=2434 data-target="#details-2434" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">revertCustomDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2434">
<div class="comment"><p>Revert a custom document to its last saved state.</p>
<p>This method is invoked by the editor when the user triggers <code>File: Revert File</code> in a custom editor. (Note that
this is only used using the editor&#39;s <code>File: Revert File</code> command and not on a <code>git revert</code> of the file).</p>
<p>To implement <code>revert</code>, the implementer must make sure all editor instances (webviews) for <code>document</code>
are displaying the document in the same state is saved in. This usually means reloading the file from the
workspace.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="cancellation"></a><span class="ts" id=2436 data-target="#details-2436" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Token that signals the revert is no longer required.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Thenable signaling that the change has completed.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CustomEditorProvider.saveCustomDocument"></a><span class="ts" id=2425 data-target="#details-2425" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">saveCustomDocument</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2425">
<div class="comment"><p>Save a custom document.</p>
<p>This method is invoked by the editor when the user saves a custom editor. This can happen when the user
triggers save while the custom editor is active, by commands such as <code>save all</code>, or by auto save if enabled.</p>
<p>To implement <code>save</code>, the implementer must persist the custom editor. This usually means writing the
file data for the custom document to disk. After <code>save</code> completes, any associated editor instances will
no longer be marked as dirty.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="document"></a><span class="ts" id=2426 data-target="#details-2426" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Document to save.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="cancellation"></a><span class="ts" id=2427 data-target="#details-2427" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Token that signals the save is no longer required (for example, if another save was triggered).</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Thenable signaling that saving has completed.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="CustomEditorProvider.saveCustomDocumentAs"></a><span class="ts" id=2429 data-target="#details-2429" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">saveCustomDocumentAs</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">destination</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2429">
<div class="comment"><p>Save a custom document to a different location.</p>
<p>This method is invoked by the editor when the user triggers &#39;save as&#39; on a custom editor. The implementer must
persist the custom editor to <code>destination</code>.</p>
<p>When the user accepts save as, the current editor is be replaced by an non-dirty editor for the newly saved file.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="destination"></a><span class="ts" id=2431 data-target="#details-2431" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">destination</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Location to save to.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="cancellation"></a><span class="ts" id=2432 data-target="#details-2432" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cancellation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Token that signals the save is no longer required.</p>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>

### <a name="CustomExecution"></a><span class="code-item" id=2095>CustomExecution</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Class used to execute an extension callback as a task.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors



<a name="CustomExecution.new CustomExecution"></a><span class="ts" id=2097 data-target="#details-2097" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">new CustomExecution</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">callback</span><span>: </span>(resolvedDefinition: <a class="type-ref" href="#TaskDefinition">TaskDefinition</a>) =&gt; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Pseudoterminal">Pseudoterminal</a>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CustomExecution">CustomExecution</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2097">
<div class="comment"><p>Constructs a CustomExecution task object. The callback will be executed when the task is run, at which point the
extension should return the Pseudoterminal it will &quot;run in&quot;. The task should wait to do further execution until
<a href="#Pseudoterminal.open">Pseudoterminal.open</a> is called. Task cancellation should be handled using
<a href="#Pseudoterminal.close">Pseudoterminal.close</a>. When the task is complete fire
<a href="#Pseudoterminal.onDidClose">Pseudoterminal.onDidClose</a>.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

Any ${} style variables that
were in the task definition will be resolved and passed into the callback as <code>resolvedDefinition</code>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#CustomExecution">CustomExecution</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="CustomReadonlyEditorProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=2410>CustomReadonlyEditorProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provider for readonly custom editors that use a custom document model.</p>
<p>Custom editors use <a href="#CustomDocument">CustomDocument</a> as their document model instead of a <a href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>.</p>
<p>You should use this type of custom editor when dealing with binary files or more complex scenarios. For simple

### <a name="CustomTextEditorProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=2380>CustomTextEditorProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provider for text based custom editors.</p>
<p>Text based custom editors use a <a href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a> as their data model. This considerably simplifies
implementing a custom editor as it allows the editor to handle many common operations such as
undo and backup. The provider is responsible for synchronizing text changes between the webview and the <code>TextDocument</code>.</p>
</div>

### <a name="DataTransfer"></a><span class="code-item" id=2808>DataTransfer</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A map containing a mapping of the mime type of the corresponding transferred data.</p>

### <a name="DebugAdapterDescriptorFactory"></a><span class="code-item" id=3935>DebugAdapterDescriptorFactory</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A debug adaper factory that creates <a href="#DebugAdapterDescriptor">debug adapter descriptors</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="DebugAdapterDescriptorFactory.createDebugAdapterDescriptor"></a><span class="ts" id=3937 data-target="#details-3937" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createDebugAdapterDescriptor</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">session</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a>, <span class="ident">executable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugAdapterExecutable">DebugAdapterExecutable</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugAdapterDescriptor">DebugAdapterDescriptor</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3937">
<div class="comment"><p>&#39;createDebugAdapterDescriptor&#39; is called at the start of a debug session to provide details about the debug adapter to use.
These details must be returned as objects of type <a href="#DebugAdapterDescriptor">DebugAdapterDescriptor</a>.
Currently two types of debug adapters are supported:</p>
<ul>
<li>a debug adapter executable is specified as a command path and arguments (see <a href="#DebugAdapterExecutable">DebugAdapterExecutable</a>),</li>
<li>a debug adapter server reachable via a communication port (see <a href="#DebugAdapterServer">DebugAdapterServer</a>).
If the method is not implemented the default behavior is this:
createDebugAdapter(session: DebugSession, executable: DebugAdapterExecutable) {
   if (typeof session.configuration.debugServer === &#39;number&#39;) {
  return new DebugAdapterServer(session.configuration.debugServer);
   }
   return executable;
}</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="session"></a><span class="ts" id=3938 data-target="#details-3938" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">session</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#DebugSession">debug session</a> for which the debug adapter will be used.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="executable"></a><span class="ts" id=3939 data-target="#details-3939" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">executable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugAdapterExecutable">DebugAdapterExecutable</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The debug adapter&#39;s executable information as specified in the package.json (or undefined if no such information exists).</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugAdapterDescriptor">DebugAdapterDescriptor</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>a <a href="#DebugAdapterDescriptor">debug adapter descriptor</a> or undefined.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DebugConfigurationProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=3881>DebugConfigurationProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A debug configuration provider allows to add debug configurations to the debug service
and to resolve launch configurations before they are used to start a debug session.
A debug configuration provider is registered via <a href="#debug.registerDebugConfigurationProvider">debug.registerDebugConfigurationProvider</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="DebugConfigurationProvider.provideDebugConfigurations"></a><span class="ts" id=3883 data-target="#details-3883" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideDebugConfigurations</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3883">
<div class="comment"><p>Provides <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configuration</a> to the debug service. If more than one debug configuration provider is
registered for the same type, debug configurations are concatenated in arbitrary order.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="folder"></a><span class="ts" id=3884 data-target="#details-3884" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The workspace folder for which the configurations are used or <code>undefined</code> for a folderless setup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=3885 data-target="#details-3885" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>[]&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An array of <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configurations</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugConfigurationProvider.resolveDebugConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=3887 data-target="#details-3887" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveDebugConfiguration</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>, <span class="ident">debugConfiguration</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3887">
<div class="comment"><p>Resolves a <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configuration</a> by filling in missing values or by adding/changing/removing attributes.
If more than one debug configuration provider is registered for the same type, the resolveDebugConfiguration calls are chained
in arbitrary order and the initial debug configuration is piped through the chain.
Returning the value &#39;undefined&#39; prevents the debug session from starting.
Returning the value &#39;null&#39; prevents the debug session from starting and opens the underlying debug configuration instead.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="folder"></a><span class="ts" id=3888 data-target="#details-3888" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The workspace folder from which the configuration originates from or <code>undefined</code> for a folderless setup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="debugConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=3889 data-target="#details-3889" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">debugConfiguration</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configuration</a> to resolve.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=3890 data-target="#details-3890" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The resolved debug configuration or undefined or null.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugConfigurationProvider.resolveDebugConfigurationWithSubstitutedVariables"></a><span class="ts" id=3892 data-target="#details-3892" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveDebugConfigurationWithSubstitutedVariables</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>, <span class="ident">debugConfiguration</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3892">
<div class="comment"><p>This hook is directly called after &#39;resolveDebugConfiguration&#39; but with all variables substituted.
It can be used to resolve or verify a <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configuration</a> by filling in missing values or by adding/changing/removing attributes.
If more than one debug configuration provider is registered for the same type, the &#39;resolveDebugConfigurationWithSubstitutedVariables&#39; calls are chained
in arbitrary order and the initial debug configuration is piped through the chain.
Returning the value &#39;undefined&#39; prevents the debug session from starting.
Returning the value &#39;null&#39; prevents the debug session from starting and opens the underlying debug configuration instead.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="folder"></a><span class="ts" id=3893 data-target="#details-3893" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">folder</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The workspace folder from which the configuration originates from or <code>undefined</code> for a folderless setup.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="debugConfiguration"></a><span class="ts" id=3894 data-target="#details-3894" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">debugConfiguration</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#DebugConfiguration">debug configuration</a> to resolve.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=3895 data-target="#details-3895" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConfiguration">DebugConfiguration</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The resolved debug configuration or undefined or null.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind"></a><span class="code-item" id=4026>DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind specifies when the <code>provideDebugConfigurations</code> method of a <code>DebugConfigurationProvider</code> is triggered.
Currently there are two situations: to provide the initial debug configurations for a newly created launch.json or
to provide dynamically generated debug configurations when the user asks for them through the UI (e.g. via the &quot;Select and Start Debugging&quot; command).
A trigger kind is used when registering a <code>DebugConfigurationProvider</code> with <a href="#debug.registerDebugConfigurationProvider">debug.registerDebugConfigurationProvider</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind.Initial"></a><span class="ts" id=4027 data-target="#details-4027" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Initial</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4027">
<div class="comment"><p><code>DebugConfigurationProvider.provideDebugConfigurations</code> is called to provide the initial debug configurations for a newly created launch.json.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugConfigurationProviderTriggerKind.Dynamic"></a><span class="ts" id=4028 data-target="#details-4028" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Dynamic</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">2</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4028">
<div class="comment"><p><code>DebugConfigurationProvider.provideDebugConfigurations</code> is called to provide dynamically generated debug configurations when the user asks for them through the UI (e.g. via the &quot;Select and Start Debugging&quot; command).</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DebugSessionOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=4016>DebugSessionOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Options for <a href="#debug.startDebugging">starting a debug session</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.compact"></a><span class="ts" id=4021 data-target="#details-4021" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">compact</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4021">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if the debug session&#39;s parent session is shown in the CALL STACK view even if it has only a single child.
By default, the debug session will never hide its parent.
If compact is true, debug sessions with a single child are hidden in the CALL STACK view to make the tree more compact.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.consoleMode"></a><span class="ts" id=4019 data-target="#details-4019" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">consoleMode</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugConsoleMode">DebugConsoleMode</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4019">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether this session should have a separate debug console or share it
with the parent session. Has no effect for sessions which do not have a parent session.
Defaults to Separate.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.lifecycleManagedByParent"></a><span class="ts" id=4018 data-target="#details-4018" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">lifecycleManagedByParent</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4018">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether lifecycle requests like &#39;restart&#39; are sent to the newly created session or its parent session.
By default (if the property is false or missing), lifecycle requests are sent to the new session.
This property is ignored if the session has no parent session.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.noDebug"></a><span class="ts" id=4020 data-target="#details-4020" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">noDebug</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4020">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether this session should run without debugging, thus ignoring breakpoints.
When this property is not specified, the value from the parent session (if there is one) is used.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.parentSession"></a><span class="ts" id=4017 data-target="#details-4017" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">parentSession</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DebugSession">DebugSession</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4017">
<div class="comment"><p>When specified the newly created debug session is registered as a &quot;child&quot; session of this
&quot;parent&quot; debug session.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.suppressDebugStatusbar"></a><span class="ts" id=4024 data-target="#details-4024" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">suppressDebugStatusbar</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4024">
<div class="comment"><p>When true, the window statusbar color will not be changed for this session.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.suppressDebugToolbar"></a><span class="ts" id=4023 data-target="#details-4023" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">suppressDebugToolbar</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4023">
<div class="comment"><p>When true, the debug toolbar will not be shown for this session.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.suppressDebugView"></a><span class="ts" id=4025 data-target="#details-4025" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">suppressDebugView</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4025">
<div class="comment"><p>When true, the debug viewlet will not be automatically revealed for this session.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DebugSessionOptions.suppressSaveBeforeStart"></a><span class="ts" id=4022 data-target="#details-4022" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">suppressSaveBeforeStart</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4022">
<div class="comment"><p>When true, a save will not be triggered for open editors when starting a debug session, regardless of the value of the <code>debug.saveBeforeStart</code> setting.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DiagnosticCollection"></a><span class="code-item" id=1703>DiagnosticCollection</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A diagnostics collection is a container that manages a set of
<a href="#Diagnostic">diagnostics</a>. Diagnostics are always scopes to a
diagnostics collection and a resource.</p>
<p>To get an instance of a <code>DiagnosticCollection</code> use
<a href="#languages.createDiagnosticCollection">createDiagnosticCollection</a>.</p>
</div>

from this collection will be associated with this name. Also, the task framework uses this
name when defining <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_defining-a-problem-matcher">problem matchers</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DiagnosticTag"></a><span class="code-item" id=1684>DiagnosticTag</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Additional metadata about the type of a diagnostic.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="DiagnosticTag.Unnecessary"></a><span class="ts" id=1685 data-target="#details-1685" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Unnecessary</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1685">
<div class="comment"><p>Unused or unnecessary code.</p>
<p>Diagnostics with this tag are rendered faded out. The amount of fading
is controlled by the <code>&quot;editorUnnecessaryCode.opacity&quot;</code> theme color. For
example, <code>&quot;editorUnnecessaryCode.opacity&quot;: &quot;#000000c0&quot;</code> will render the
code with 75% opacity. For high contrast themes, use the
<code>&quot;editorUnnecessaryCode.border&quot;</code> theme color to underline unnecessary code
instead of fading it out.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DiagnosticTag.Deprecated"></a><span class="ts" id=1686 data-target="#details-1686" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Deprecated</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">2</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1686">
<div class="comment"><p>Deprecated or obsolete code.</p>
<p>Diagnostics with this tag are rendered with a strike through.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DocumentDropEditProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1557>DocumentDropEditProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provider which handles dropping of resources into a text editor.</p>
<p>This allows users to drag and drop resources (including resources from external apps) into the editor. While dragging
and dropping files, users can hold down <code>shift</code> to drop the file into the editor instead of opening it.
Requires <code>editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled</code> to be on.</p>
</div>

The lack of a result can be
signaled by returning <code>undefined</code> or <code>null</code>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DocumentFilter"></a><span class="code-item" id=576>DocumentFilter</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A document filter denotes a document by different properties like
the <a href="#TextDocument.languageId">language</a>, the <a href="#Uri.scheme">scheme</a> of
its resource, or a glob-pattern that is applied to the <a href="#TextDocument.fileName">path</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong>
A language filter that applies to typescript files on disk</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">{ </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">language</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;typescript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">scheme</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }</span></span></code></pre>
<p><strong>Example</strong>
A language filter that applies to all package.json paths</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">{ </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">language</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;json&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">pattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;**/package.json&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }</span></span></code></pre>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="DocumentFilter.language"></a><span class="ts" id=577 data-target="#details-577" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">language</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-577">
<div class="comment"><p>A language id, like <code>typescript</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DocumentFilter.notebookType"></a><span class="ts" id=578 data-target="#details-578" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebookType</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-578">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#NotebookDocument.notebookType">type</a> of a notebook, like <code>jupyter-notebook</code>. This allows
to narrow down on the type of a notebook that a <a href="#NotebookCell.document">cell document</a> belongs to.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that setting the <code>notebookType</code>-property changes how <code>scheme</code> and <code>pattern</code> are interpreted. When set
they are evaluated against the <a href="#NotebookDocument.uri">notebook uri</a>, not the document uri.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong>
Match python document inside jupyter notebook that aren&#39;t stored yet (<code>untitled</code>)</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">{ </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">language</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;python&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">notebookType</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;jupyter-notebook&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #C8C8C8">scheme</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;untitled&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> }</span></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DocumentFilter.pattern"></a><span class="ts" id=580 data-target="#details-580" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">pattern</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobPattern">GlobPattern</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-580">
<div class="comment"><p>A <a href="#GlobPattern">glob pattern</a> that is matched on the absolute path of the document. Use a <a href="#RelativePattern">relative pattern</a>
to filter documents to a <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folder</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DocumentFilter.scheme"></a><span class="ts" id=579 data-target="#details-579" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">scheme</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-579">
<div class="comment"><p>A Uri <a href="#Uri.scheme">scheme</a>, like <code>file</code> or <code>untitled</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<a name="DocumentRangeFormattingEditProvider.provideDocumentRangesFormattingEdits"></a><span class="ts" id=1168 data-target="#details-1168" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideDocumentRangesFormattingEdits</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">ranges</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a>[], <span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FormattingOptions">FormattingOptions</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TextEdit">TextEdit</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1168">
<div class="comment"><p>Provide formatting edits for multiple ranges in a document.</p>
<p>This function is optional but allows a formatter to perform faster when formatting only modified ranges or when
formatting a large number of selections.</p>
<p>The given ranges are hints and providers can decide to format a smaller
or larger range. Often this is done by adjusting the start and end
of the range to full syntax nodes.</p>
</div>

### <a name="DocumentSelector"></a><span class="code-item" id=581>DocumentSelector</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A language selector is the combination of one or many language identifiers
and <a href="#DocumentFilter">language filters</a>.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that a document selector that is just a language identifier selects <em>all</em>
documents, even those that are not saved on disk. Only use such selectors when
a feature works without further context, e.g. without the need to resolve related
&#39;files&#39;.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong></p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">sel</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">DocumentSelector</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">scheme:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">language:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;typescript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>

### <a name="DocumentSemanticTokensProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1132>DocumentSemanticTokensProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The document semantic tokens provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
semantic tokens.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="DocumentSemanticTokensProvider.onDidChangeSemanticTokens"></a><span class="ts" id=1133 data-target="#details-1133" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeSemanticTokens</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1133">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional event to signal that the semantic tokens from this provider have changed.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="DocumentSemanticTokensProvider.provideDocumentSemanticTokens"></a><span class="ts" id=1135 data-target="#details-1135" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideDocumentSemanticTokens</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokens">SemanticTokens</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1135">
<div class="comment"><p>Tokens in a file are represented as an array of integers. The position of each token is expressed relative to
the token before it, because most tokens remain stable relative to each other when edits are made in a file.</p>
<hr>
<p>In short, each token takes 5 integers to represent, so a specific token <code>i</code> in the file consists of the following array indices:</p>
<ul>
<li>at index <code>5*i</code>   - <code>deltaLine</code>: token line number, relative to the previous token</li>
<li>at index <code>5*i+1</code> - <code>deltaStart</code>: token start character, relative to the previous token (relative to 0 or the previous token&#39;s start if they are on the same line)</li>
<li>at index <code>5*i+2</code> - <code>length</code>: the length of the token. A token cannot be multiline.</li>
<li>at index <code>5*i+3</code> - <code>tokenType</code>: will be looked up in <code>SemanticTokensLegend.tokenTypes</code>. We currently ask that <code>tokenType</code> &lt; 65536.</li>
<li>at index <code>5*i+4</code> - <code>tokenModifiers</code>: each set bit will be looked up in <code>SemanticTokensLegend.tokenModifiers</code></li>
</ul>
<hr>
<h3 id="how-to-encode-tokens">How to encode tokens</h3>
<p>Here is an example for encoding a file with 3 tokens in a uint32 array:</p>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   { line: 2, startChar:  5, length: 3, tokenType: "property",  tokenModifiers: ["private", "static"] },
   { line: 2, startChar: 10, length: 4, tokenType: "type",      tokenModifiers: [] },
   { line: 5, startChar:  2, length: 7, tokenType: "class",     tokenModifiers: [] }</code></pre>
<ol>
<li>First of all, a legend must be devised. This legend must be provided up-front and capture all possible token types.
For this example, we will choose the following legend which must be passed in when registering the provider:</li>
</ol>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   tokenTypes: ['property', 'type', 'class'],
   tokenModifiers: ['private', 'static']</code></pre>
<ol start="2">
<li>The first transformation step is to encode <code>tokenType</code> and <code>tokenModifiers</code> as integers using the legend. Token types are looked
up by index, so a <code>tokenType</code> value of <code>1</code> means <code>tokenTypes[1]</code>. Multiple token modifiers can be set by using bit flags,
so a <code>tokenModifier</code> value of <code>3</code> is first viewed as binary <code>0b00000011</code>, which means <code>[tokenModifiers[0], tokenModifiers[1]]</code> because
bits 0 and 1 are set. Using this legend, the tokens now are:</li>
</ol>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   { line: 2, startChar:  5, length: 3, tokenType: 0, tokenModifiers: 3 },
   { line: 2, startChar: 10, length: 4, tokenType: 1, tokenModifiers: 0 },
   { line: 5, startChar:  2, length: 7, tokenType: 2, tokenModifiers: 0 }</code></pre>
<ol start="3">
<li>The next step is to represent each token relative to the previous token in the file. In this case, the second token
is on the same line as the first token, so the <code>startChar</code> of the second token is made relative to the <code>startChar</code>
of the first token, so it will be <code>10 - 5</code>. The third token is on a different line than the second token, so the
<code>startChar</code> of the third token will not be altered:</li>
</ol>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   { deltaLine: 2, deltaStartChar: 5, length: 3, tokenType: 0, tokenModifiers: 3 },
   { deltaLine: 0, deltaStartChar: 5, length: 4, tokenType: 1, tokenModifiers: 0 },
   { deltaLine: 3, deltaStartChar: 2, length: 7, tokenType: 2, tokenModifiers: 0 }</code></pre>
<ol start="4">
<li>Finally, the last step is to inline each of the 5 fields for a token in a single array, which is a memory friendly representation:</li>
</ol>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   // 1st token,  2nd token,  3rd token
   [  2,5,3,0,3,  0,5,4,1,0,  3,2,7,2,0 ]</code></pre>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#SemanticTokensBuilder">SemanticTokensBuilder</a> for a helper to encode tokens as integers.
<em>NOTE</em>: When doing edits, it is possible that multiple edits occur until the editor decides to invoke the semantic tokens provider.
<em>NOTE</em>: If the provider cannot temporarily compute semantic tokens, it can indicate this by throwing an error with the message &#39;Busy&#39;.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="document"></a><span class="ts" id=1136 data-target="#details-1136" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1137 data-target="#details-1137" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokens">SemanticTokens</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="DocumentSemanticTokensProvider.provideDocumentSemanticTokensEdits"></a><span class="ts" id=1139 data-target="#details-1139" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideDocumentSemanticTokensEdits</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">previousResultId</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokens">SemanticTokens</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokensEdits">SemanticTokensEdits</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1139">
<div class="comment"><p>Instead of always returning all the tokens in a file, it is possible for a <code>DocumentSemanticTokensProvider</code> to implement
this method (<code>provideDocumentSemanticTokensEdits</code>) and then return incremental updates to the previously provided semantic tokens.</p>
<hr>
<h3 id="how-tokens-change-when-the-document-changes">How tokens change when the document changes</h3>
<p>Suppose that <code>provideDocumentSemanticTokens</code> has previously returned the following semantic tokens:</p>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   // 1st token,  2nd token,  3rd token
   [  2,5,3,0,3,  0,5,4,1,0,  3,2,7,2,0 ]</code></pre>
<p>Also suppose that after some edits, the new semantic tokens in a file are:</p>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   // 1st token,  2nd token,  3rd token
   [  3,5,3,0,3,  0,5,4,1,0,  3,2,7,2,0 ]</code></pre>
<p>It is possible to express these new tokens in terms of an edit applied to the previous tokens:</p>
<pre class="shiki"><code>   [  2,5,3,0,3,  0,5,4,1,0,  3,2,7,2,0 ] // old tokens
   [  3,5,3,0,3,  0,5,4,1,0,  3,2,7,2,0 ] // new tokens

   edit: { start:  0, deleteCount: 1, data: [3] } // replace integer at offset 0 with 3</code></pre>
<p><em>NOTE</em>: If the provider cannot compute <code>SemanticTokensEdits</code>, it can &quot;give up&quot; and return all the tokens in the document again.
<em>NOTE</em>: All edits in <code>SemanticTokensEdits</code> contain indices in the old integers array, so they all refer to the previous result state.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="document"></a><span class="ts" id=1140 data-target="#details-1140" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="previousResultId"></a><span class="ts" id=1141 data-target="#details-1141" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">previousResultId</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1142 data-target="#details-1142" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokens">SemanticTokens</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#SemanticTokensEdits">SemanticTokensEdits</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="DocumentSymbol"></a><span class="code-item" id=845>DocumentSymbol</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents programming constructs like variables, classes, interfaces etc. that appear in a document. Document
symbols can be hierarchical and they have two ranges: one that encloses its definition and one that points to
its most interesting range, e.g. the range of an identifier.</p>
</div>

### <a name="EvaluatableExpression"></a><span class="code-item" id=733>EvaluatableExpression</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An EvaluatableExpression represents an expression in a document that can be evaluated by an active debugger or runtime.
The result of this evaluation is shown in a tooltip-like widget.
If only a range is specified, the expression will be extracted from the underlying document.
An optional expression can be used to override the extracted expression.
In this case the range is still used to highlight the range in the document.</p>
</div>

### <a name="EvaluatableExpressionProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=740>EvaluatableExpressionProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The evaluatable expression provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
the debug hover. In this contract the provider returns an evaluatable expression for a given position
in a document and the editor evaluates this expression in the active debug session and shows the result in a debug hover.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="EvaluatableExpressionProvider.provideEvaluatableExpression"></a><span class="ts" id=742 data-target="#details-742" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideEvaluatableExpression</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#EvaluatableExpression">EvaluatableExpression</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-742">
<div class="comment"><p>Provide an evaluatable expression for the given document and position.
The editor will evaluate this expression in the active debug session and will show the result in the debug hover.
The expression can be implicitly specified by the range in the underlying document or by explicitly returning an expression.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

### <a name="Event"></a><span class="code-item" id=461>Event&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a typed event.</p>
<p>A function that represents an event to which you subscribe by calling it with
a listener function as argument.</p>
<p><strong>Example</strong></p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">item</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onDidChange</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">function</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">console</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">log</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Event happened: &#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>



<a name="Event"></a><span class="ts" id=463 data-target="#details-463" data-toggle="collapse"><span>(</span><span class="ident">listener</span><span>: </span>(e: <a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>, <span class="ident">thisArgs</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>, <span class="ident">disposables</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-463">
<div class="comment"><p>A function that represents an event to which you subscribe by calling it with
a listener function as argument.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">

<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="thisArgs"></a><span class="ts" id=468 data-target="#details-468" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">thisArgs</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The <code>this</code>-argument which will be used when calling the event listener.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="disposables"></a><span class="ts" id=469 data-target="#details-469" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">disposables</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An array to which a <a href="#Disposable">Disposable</a> will be added.</p>
</div></td></tr>

### <a name="EventEmitter"></a><span class="code-item" id=470>EventEmitter&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event emitter can be used to create and manage an <a href="#Event">Event</a> for others
to subscribe to. One emitter always owns one event.</p>
<p>Use this class if you want to provide event from within your extension, for instance
inside a <a href="#TextDocumentContentProvider">TextDocumentContentProvider</a> or when providing
API to other extensions.</p>
</div>

### <a name="Extension"></a><span class="code-item" id=1933>Extension&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents an extension.</p>
<p>To get an instance of an <code>Extension</code> use <a href="#extensions.getExtension">getExtension</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="Extension.exports"></a><span class="ts" id=1940 data-target="#details-1940" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">exports</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1940">
<div class="comment"><p>The public API exported by this extension (return value of <code>activate</code>).
It is an invalid action to access this field before this extension has been activated.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.extensionKind"></a><span class="ts" id=1939 data-target="#details-1939" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionKind</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ExtensionKind">ExtensionKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1939">
<div class="comment"><p>The extension kind describes if an extension runs where the UI runs
or if an extension runs where the remote extension host runs. The extension kind
is defined in the <code>package.json</code>-file of extensions but can also be refined
via the <code>remote.extensionKind</code>-setting. When no remote extension host exists,
the value is <a href="#ExtensionKind.UI">ExtensionKind.UI</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.extensionPath"></a><span class="ts" id=1936 data-target="#details-1936" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionPath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>

<div class="comment"><p>The absolute file path of the directory containing this extension. Shorthand
notation for <a href="#Extension.extensionUri">Extension.extensionUri.fsPath</a> (independent of the uri scheme).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.extensionUri"></a><span class="ts" id=1935 data-target="#details-1935" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionUri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1935">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of the directory containing the extension.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.id"></a><span class="ts" id=1934 data-target="#details-1934" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">id</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1934">
<div class="comment"><p>The canonical extension identifier in the form of: <code>publisher.name</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.isActive"></a><span class="ts" id=1937 data-target="#details-1937" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isActive</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1937">

</div>
</div>



<a name="Extension.packageJSON"></a><span class="ts" id=1938 data-target="#details-1938" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">packageJSON</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span></span>

</div>

### <a name="ExtensionContext"></a><span class="code-item" id=1948>ExtensionContext</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An extension context is a collection of utilities private to an
extension.</p>
<p>An instance of an <code>ExtensionContext</code> is provided as the first
parameter to the <code>activate</code>-call of an extension.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="ExtensionContext.environmentVariableCollection"></a><span class="ts" id=1962 data-target="#details-1962" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">environmentVariableCollection</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#GlobalEnvironmentVariableCollection">GlobalEnvironmentVariableCollection</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1962">
<div class="comment"><p>Gets the extension&#39;s global environment variable collection for this workspace, enabling changes to be
applied to terminal environment variables.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.extension"></a><span class="ts" id=1973 data-target="#details-1973" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extension</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Extension">Extension</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;</span>

<div class="comment"><p>The current <code>Extension</code> instance.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.extensionMode"></a><span class="ts" id=1972 data-target="#details-1972" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionMode</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ExtensionMode">ExtensionMode</a></span>

for possible values and scenarios.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.extensionPath"></a><span class="ts" id=1961 data-target="#details-1961" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionPath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1961">
<div class="comment"><p>The absolute file path of the directory containing the extension. Shorthand
notation for <a href="#TextDocument.uri">ExtensionContext.extensionUri.fsPath</a> (independent of the uri scheme).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.extensionUri"></a><span class="ts" id=1960 data-target="#details-1960" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">extensionUri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1960">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of the directory containing the extension.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.globalState"></a><span class="ts" id=1954 data-target="#details-1954" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">globalState</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Memento">Memento</a> &#38; {setKeysForSync}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1954">
<div class="comment"><p>A memento object that stores state independent
of the current opened <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.globalStoragePath"></a><span class="ts" id=1969 data-target="#details-1969" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">globalStoragePath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1969">
<div class="comment"><p>An absolute file path in which the extension can store global state.
The directory might not exist on disk and creation is
up to the extension. However, the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.</p>
<p>Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.globalState">globalState</a> to store key value data.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.globalStorageUri">globalStorageUri</a> instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.globalStorageUri"></a><span class="ts" id=1968 data-target="#details-1968" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">globalStorageUri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1968">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of a directory in which the extension can store global state.
The directory might not exist on disk and creation is
up to the extension. However, the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.</p>
<p>Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.globalState">globalState</a> to store key value data.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a> for how to read and write files and folders from
 an uri.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.logPath"></a><span class="ts" id=1971 data-target="#details-1971" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">logPath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1971">
<div class="comment"><p>An absolute file path of a directory in which the extension can create log files.
The directory might not exist on disk and creation is up to the extension. However,
the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.logUri">logUri</a> instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.logUri"></a><span class="ts" id=1970 data-target="#details-1970" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">logUri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1970">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of a directory in which the extension can create log files.
The directory might not exist on disk and creation is up to the extension. However,
the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a> for how to read and write files and folders from
 an uri.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.secrets"></a><span class="ts" id=1959 data-target="#details-1959" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">secrets</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#SecretStorage">SecretStorage</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1959">
<div class="comment"><p>A storage utility for secrets. Secrets are persisted across reloads and are independent of the
current opened <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.storagePath"></a><span class="ts" id=1967 data-target="#details-1967" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">storagePath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1967">
<div class="comment"><p>An absolute file path of a workspace specific directory in which the extension
can store private state. The directory might not exist on disk and creation is
up to the extension. However, the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.</p>
<p>Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.workspaceState">workspaceState</a> or
<a href="#ExtensionContext.globalState">globalState</a> to store key value data.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.storageUri">storageUri</a> instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.storageUri"></a><span class="ts" id=1966 data-target="#details-1966" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">storageUri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1966">
<div class="comment"><p>The uri of a workspace specific directory in which the extension
can store private state. The directory might not exist and creation is
up to the extension. However, the parent directory is guaranteed to be existent.
The value is <code>undefined</code> when no workspace nor folder has been opened.</p>
<p>Use <a href="#ExtensionContext.workspaceState">workspaceState</a> or
<a href="#ExtensionContext.globalState">globalState</a> to store key value data.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#FileSystem">workspace.fs</a> for how to read and write files and folders from
 an uri.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.subscriptions"></a><span class="ts" id=1949 data-target="#details-1949" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">subscriptions</span><span>: </span>Array&lt;{dispose}&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1949">
<div class="comment"><p>An array to which disposables can be added. When this
extension is deactivated the disposables will be disposed.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that asynchronous dispose-functions aren&#39;t awaited.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ExtensionContext.workspaceState"></a><span class="ts" id=1953 data-target="#details-1953" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">workspaceState</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Memento">Memento</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1953">
<div class="comment"><p>A memento object that stores state in the context
of the currently opened <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">workspace</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods

<div class="comment"><p>The ExtensionMode is provided on the <code>ExtensionContext</code> and indicates the

### <a name="FileDecorationProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1924>FileDecorationProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The decoration provider interfaces defines the contract between extensions and
file decorations.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="FileDecorationProvider.onDidChangeFileDecorations"></a><span class="ts" id=1925 data-target="#details-1925" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeFileDecorations</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1925">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional event to signal that decorations for one or many files have changed.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that this event should be used to propagate information about children.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#EventEmitter">EventEmitter</a></p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="FileDecorationProvider.provideFileDecoration"></a><span class="ts" id=1927 data-target="#details-1927" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideFileDecoration</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileDecoration">FileDecoration</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1927">
<div class="comment"><p>Provide decorations for a given uri.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that this function is only called when a file gets rendered in the UI.
This means a decoration from a descendent that propagates upwards must be signaled
to the editor via the <a href="#FileDecorationProvider.onDidChangeFileDecorations">onDidChangeFileDecorations</a>-event.</p>
</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1929 data-target="#details-1929" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="FilePermission"></a><span class="code-item" id=2180>FilePermission</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Permissions of a file.</p>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="FilePermission.Readonly"></a><span class="ts" id=2181 data-target="#details-2181" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Readonly</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2181">
<div class="comment"><p>The file is readonly.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> All <code>FileStat</code> from a <code>FileSystemProvider</code> that is registered with
the option <code>isReadonly: true</code> will be implicitly handled as if <code>FilePermission.Readonly</code>
is set. As a consequence, it is not possible to have a readonly file system provider
registered where some <code>FileStat</code> are not readonly.</p>
</div>
