### <a name="FileStat"></a><span class="code-item" id=2182>FileStat</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The <code>FileStat</code>-type represents metadata about a file</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="FileStat.ctime"></a><span class="ts" id=2184 data-target="#details-2184" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">ctime</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2184">
<div class="comment"><p>The creation timestamp in milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FileStat.mtime"></a><span class="ts" id=2185 data-target="#details-2185" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">mtime</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2185">
<div class="comment"><p>The modification timestamp in milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> If the file changed, it is important to provide an updated <code>mtime</code> that advanced
from the previous value. Otherwise there may be optimizations in place that will not show
the updated file contents in an editor for example.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FileStat.permissions"></a><span class="ts" id=2187 data-target="#details-2187" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">permissions</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Readonly">Readonly</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2187">
<div class="comment"><p>The permissions of the file, e.g. whether the file is readonly.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This value might be a bitmask, e.g. <code>FilePermission.Readonly | FilePermission.Other</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FileStat.size"></a><span class="ts" id=2186 data-target="#details-2186" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">size</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2186">
<div class="comment"><p>The size in bytes.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> If the file changed, it is important to provide an updated <code>size</code>. Otherwise there
may be optimizations in place that will not show the updated file contents in an editor for
example.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FileStat.type"></a><span class="ts" id=2183 data-target="#details-2183" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">type</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FileType">FileType</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2183">
<div class="comment"><p>The type of the file, e.g. is a regular file, a directory, or symbolic link
to a file.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This value might be a bitmask, e.g. <code>FileType.File | FileType.SymbolicLink</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="FileSystem"></a><span class="code-item" id=2267>FileSystem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The file system interface exposes the editor&#39;s built-in and contributed
<a href="#FileSystemProvider">file system providers</a>. It allows extensions to work
with files from the local disk as well as files from remote places, like the
remote extension host or ftp-servers.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that an instance of this interface is available as <a href="#workspace.fs">workspace.fs</a>.</p>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-2306">
<div class="comment"><p>Check if a given file system supports writing files.</p>
<p>Keep in mind that just because a file system supports writing, that does
not mean that writes will always succeed. There may be permissions issues
or other errors that prevent writing a file.</p>

### <a name="FileSystemError"></a><span class="code-item" id=2188>FileSystemError</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A type that filesystem providers should use to signal errors.</p>
<p>This class has factory methods for common error-cases, like <code>FileNotFound</code> when
a file or folder doesn&#39;t exist, use them like so: <code>throw vscode.FileSystemError.FileNotFound(someUri);</code></p>
</div>

### <a name="FileSystemProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=2218>FileSystemProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The filesystem provider defines what the editor needs to read, write, discover,
and to manage files and folders. It allows extensions to serve files from remote places,
like ftp-servers, and to seamlessly integrate those into the editor.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Note 1:</em> The filesystem provider API works with <a href="#Uri">uris</a> and assumes hierarchical
paths, e.g. <code>foo:/my/path</code> is a child of <code>foo:/my/</code> and a parent of <code>foo:/my/path/deeper</code>.</li>
<li><em>Note 2:</em> There is an activation event <code>onFileSystem:&lt;scheme&gt;</code> that fires when a file
or folder is being accessed.</li>
<li><em>Note 3:</em> The word &#39;file&#39; is often used to denote all <a href="#FileType">kinds</a> of files, e.g.
folders, symbolic links, and regular files.</li>
</ul>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="FileSystemProvider.onDidChangeFile"></a><span class="ts" id=2219 data-target="#details-2219" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeFile</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#FileChangeEvent">FileChangeEvent</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2219">
<div class="comment"><p>An event to signal that a resource has been created, changed, or deleted. This
event should fire for resources that are being <a href="#FileSystemProvider.watch">watched</a>
by clients of this provider.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> It is important that the metadata of the file that changed provides an
updated <code>mtime</code> that advanced from the previous value in the <a href="#FileStat">stat</a> and a
correct <code>size</code> value. Otherwise there may be optimizations in place that will not show
the change in an editor for example.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="FileSystemProvider.copy"></a><span class="ts" id=2261 data-target="#details-2261" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">copy</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">source</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">destination</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span>{overwrite: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2261">
<div class="comment"><p>Copy files or folders. Implementing this function is optional but it will speedup
the copy operation.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileNotFound">FileNotFound</a> when <code>source</code> doesn&#39;t exist.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileNotFound">FileNotFound</a> when parent of <code>destination</code> doesn&#39;t exist, e.g. no mkdirp-logic required.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileExists">FileExists</a> when <code>destination</code> exists and when the <code>overwrite</code> option is not <code>true</code>.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.NoPermissions">NoPermissions</a> when permissions aren&#39;t sufficient.</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div></td></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>

<a name="FileSystemProvider.createDirectory"></a><span class="ts" id=2234 data-target="#details-2234" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createDirectory</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>

<a name="FileSystemProvider.watch"></a><span class="ts" id=2221 data-target="#details-2221" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">watch</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span>{excludes: readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[], recursive: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2221">
<div class="comment"><p>Subscribes to file change events in the file or folder denoted by <code>uri</code>. For folders,
the option <code>recursive</code> indicates whether subfolders, sub-subfolders, etc. should
be watched for file changes as well. With <code>recursive: false</code>, only changes to the
files that are direct children of the folder should trigger an event.</p>
<p>The <code>excludes</code> array is used to indicate paths that should be excluded from file
watching. It is typically derived from the <code>files.watcherExclude</code> setting that
is configurable by the user. Each entry can be be:</p>
<ul>
<li>the absolute path to exclude</li>
<li>a relative path to exclude (for example <code>build/output</code>)</li>
<li>a simple glob pattern (for example <code>**/build</code>, <code>output/**</code>)</li>
</ul>
<p>It is the file system provider&#39;s job to call <a href="#FileSystemProvider.onDidChangeFile">onDidChangeFile</a>
for every change given these rules. No event should be emitted for files that match any of the provided
excludes.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="uri"></a><span class="ts" id=2222 data-target="#details-2222" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The uri of the file or folder to be watched.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="options"></a><span class="ts" id=2223 data-target="#details-2223" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span>{excludes: readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[], recursive: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Configures the watch.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Disposable">Disposable</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A disposable that tells the provider to stop watching the <code>uri</code>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FileSystemProvider.writeFile"></a><span class="ts" id=2240 data-target="#details-2240" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">writeFile</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">content</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Uint8Array</span>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span>{create: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, overwrite: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2240">
<div class="comment"><p>Write data to a file, replacing its entire contents.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileNotFound">FileNotFound</a> when <code>uri</code> doesn&#39;t exist and <code>create</code> is not set.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileNotFound">FileNotFound</a> when the parent of <code>uri</code> doesn&#39;t exist and <code>create</code> is set, e.g. no mkdirp-logic required.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.FileExists">FileExists</a> when <code>uri</code> already exists, <code>create</code> is set but <code>overwrite</code> is not set.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><em>throws</em> - <a href="#FileSystemError.NoPermissions">NoPermissions</a> when permissions aren&#39;t sufficient.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="uri"></a><span class="ts" id=2241 data-target="#details-2241" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The uri of the file.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="content"></a><span class="ts" id=2242 data-target="#details-2242" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">content</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Uint8Array</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The new content of the file.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="options"></a><span class="ts" id=2243 data-target="#details-2243" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span>{create: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, overwrite: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Defines if missing files should or must be created.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>

### <a name="FileSystemWatcher"></a><span class="code-item" id=481>FileSystemWatcher</span>

on disk or from other <a href="#FileSystemProvider">FileSystemProviders</a>.</p>
<p>To get an instance of a <code>FileSystemWatcher</code> use
<a href="#workspace.createFileSystemWatcher">createFileSystemWatcher</a>.</p>
</div>

### <a name="FileWillCreateEvent"></a><span class="code-item" id=3185>FileWillCreateEvent</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event that is fired when files are going to be created.</p>
<p>To make modifications to the workspace before the files are created,
call the <a href="#FileWillCreateEvent.waitUntil">waitUntil</a>-function with a
thenable that resolves to a <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>
</div>

</div>

<a name="FileWillCreateEvent.waitUntil"></a><span class="ts" id=3189 data-target="#details-3189" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">waitUntil</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceEdit">WorkspaceEdit</a>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3189">
<div class="comment"><p>Allows to pause the event and to apply a <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This function can only be called during event dispatch and not
in an asynchronous manner:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onWillCreateFiles</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// async, will *throw* an error</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">setTimeout</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(() </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// sync, OK</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>

### <a name="FileWillDeleteEvent"></a><span class="code-item" id=3195>FileWillDeleteEvent</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event that is fired when files are going to be deleted.</p>

thenable that resolves to a <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>

### <a name="FoldingRange"></a><span class="code-item" id=1430>FoldingRange</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A line based folding range. To be valid, start and end line must be bigger than zero and smaller than the number of lines in the document.
Invalid ranges will be ignored.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors



<a name="FoldingRange.new FoldingRange"></a><span class="ts" id=1432 data-target="#details-1432" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">new FoldingRange</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, <span class="ident">end</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span>, <span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FoldingRangeKind">FoldingRangeKind</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FoldingRange">FoldingRange</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1432">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a new folding range.</p>
</div>

<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="start"></a><span class="ts" id=1433 data-target="#details-1433" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The start line of the folded range.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="end"></a><span class="ts" id=1434 data-target="#details-1434" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">end</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The end line of the folded range.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="kind"></a><span class="ts" id=1435 data-target="#details-1435" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FoldingRangeKind">FoldingRangeKind</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The kind of the folding range.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#FoldingRange">FoldingRange</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="FoldingRange.end"></a><span class="ts" id=1437 data-target="#details-1437" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">end</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1437">
<div class="comment"><p>The zero-based end line of the range to fold. The folded area ends with the line&#39;s last character.
To be valid, the end must be zero or larger and smaller than the number of lines in the document.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FoldingRange.kind"></a><span class="ts" id=1438 data-target="#details-1438" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#FoldingRangeKind">FoldingRangeKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1438">
<div class="comment"><p>Describes the <a href="#FoldingRangeKind">Kind</a> of the folding range such as <a href="#FoldingRangeKind.Comment">Comment</a> or
<a href="#FoldingRangeKind.Region">Region</a>. The kind is used to categorize folding ranges and used by commands
like &#39;Fold all comments&#39;. See
<a href="#FoldingRangeKind">FoldingRangeKind</a> for an enumeration of all kinds.
If not set, the range is originated from a syntax element.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="FoldingRange.start"></a><span class="ts" id=1436 data-target="#details-1436" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1436">
<div class="comment"><p>The zero-based start line of the range to fold. The folded area starts after the line&#39;s last character.
To be valid, the end must be zero or larger and smaller than the number of lines in the document.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="FoldingRangeKind"></a><span class="code-item" id=1439>FoldingRangeKind</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An enumeration of specific folding range kinds. The kind is an optional field of a <a href="#FoldingRange">FoldingRange</a>
and is used to distinguish specific folding ranges such as ranges originated from comments. The kind is used by commands like
<code>Fold all comments</code> or <code>Fold all regions</code>.
If the kind is not set on the range, the range originated from a syntax element other than comments, imports or region markers.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members

<div class="details collapse" id="details-1440">
<div class="comment"><p>Kind for folding range representing a comment.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-1441">
<div class="comment"><p>Kind for folding range representing a import.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-1442">
<div class="comment"><p>Kind for folding range representing regions originating from folding markers like <code>#region</code> and <code>#endregion</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="GlobalEnvironmentVariableCollection"></a><span class="code-item" id=3028>GlobalEnvironmentVariableCollection</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A collection of mutations that an extension can apply to a process environment. Applies to all scopes.</p>
</div>

#### Properties

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3033">
<div class="comment"><p>A description for the environment variable collection, this will be used to describe the
changes in the UI.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="GlobalEnvironmentVariableCollection.persistent"></a><span class="ts" id=3032 data-target="#details-3032" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">persistent</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3032">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the collection should be cached for the workspace and applied to the terminal
across window reloads. When true the collection will be active immediately such when the
window reloads. Additionally, this API will return the cached version if it exists. The
collection will be invalidated when the extension is uninstalled or when the collection
is cleared. Defaults to true.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="GlobPattern"></a><span class="code-item" id=575>GlobPattern</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A file glob pattern to match file paths against. This can either be a glob pattern string
(like <code>**/*.{ts,js}</code> or <code>*.{ts,js}</code>) or a <a href="#RelativePattern">relative pattern</a>.</p>
<p>Glob patterns can have the following syntax:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>*</code> to match zero or more characters in a path segment</li>
<li><code>?</code> to match on one character in a path segment</li>
<li><code>**</code> to match any number of path segments, including none</li>
<li><code>{}</code> to group conditions (e.g. <code>**/*.{ts,js}</code> matches all TypeScript and JavaScript files)</li>
<li><code>[]</code> to declare a range of characters to match in a path segment (e.g., <code>example.[0-9]</code> to match on <code>example.0</code>, <code>example.1</code>, â€¦)</li>
<li><code>[!...]</code> to negate a range of characters to match in a path segment (e.g., <code>example.[!0-9]</code> to match on <code>example.a</code>, <code>example.b</code>, but not <code>example.0</code>)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note: a backslash (``) is not valid within a glob pattern. If you have an existing file
path to match against, consider to use the <a href="#RelativePattern">relative pattern</a> support
that takes care of converting any backslash into slash. Otherwise, make sure to convert
any backslash to slash when creating the glob pattern.</p>
</div>

### <a name="IndentAction"></a><span class="code-item" id=1573>IndentAction</span>

<a name="IndentAction.None"></a><span class="ts" id=1574 data-target="#details-1574" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">None</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">0</a></span>

</div>



<a name="IndentAction.Indent"></a><span class="ts" id=1575 data-target="#details-1575" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Indent</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>

</div>



<a name="IndentAction.IndentOutdent"></a><span class="ts" id=1576 data-target="#details-1576" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">IndentOutdent</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">2</a></span>

### <a name="IndentationRule"></a><span class="code-item" id=1568>IndentationRule</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Describes indentation rules for a language.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="IndentationRule.decreaseIndentPattern"></a><span class="ts" id=1569 data-target="#details-1569" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">decreaseIndentPattern</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1569">
<div class="comment"><p>If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be unindented once (until another rule matches).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="IndentationRule.increaseIndentPattern"></a><span class="ts" id=1570 data-target="#details-1570" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">increaseIndentPattern</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1570">
<div class="comment"><p>If a line matches this pattern, then all the lines after it should be indented once (until another rule matches).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="IndentationRule.indentNextLinePattern"></a><span class="ts" id=1571 data-target="#details-1571" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">indentNextLinePattern</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1571">
<div class="comment"><p>If a line matches this pattern, then <strong>only the next line</strong> after it should be indented once.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="IndentationRule.unIndentedLinePattern"></a><span class="ts" id=1572 data-target="#details-1572" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">unIndentedLinePattern</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1572">
<div class="comment"><p>If a line matches this pattern, then its indentation should not be changed and it should not be evaluated against the other rules.</p>
</div>
</div>

align/separate an inlay hint.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="InlineCompletionContext"></a><span class="code-item" id=1319>InlineCompletionContext</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provides information about the context in which an inline completion was requested.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="InlineCompletionContext.selectedCompletionInfo"></a><span class="ts" id=1321 data-target="#details-1321" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">selectedCompletionInfo</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#SelectedCompletionInfo">SelectedCompletionInfo</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1321">
<div class="comment"><p>Provides information about the currently selected item in the autocomplete widget if it is visible.</p>
<p>If set, provided inline completions must extend the text of the selected item
and use the same range, otherwise they are not shown as preview.
As an example, if the document text is <code>console.</code> and the selected item is <code>.log</code> replacing the <code>.</code> in the document,
the inline completion must also replace <code>.</code> and start with <code>.log</code>, for example <code>.log()</code>.</p>
<p>Inline completion providers are requested again whenever the selected item changes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="InlineCompletionContext.triggerKind"></a><span class="ts" id=1320 data-target="#details-1320" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">triggerKind</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionTriggerKind">InlineCompletionTriggerKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1320">
<div class="comment"><p>Describes how the inline completion was triggered.</p>
</div>

### <a name="InlineCompletionItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=1328>InlineCompletionItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An inline completion item represents a text snippet that is proposed inline to complete text that is being typed.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#InlineCompletionItemProvider.provideInlineCompletionItems">InlineCompletionItemProvider.provideInlineCompletionItems</a></p>
</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="range"></a><span class="ts" id=1332 data-target="#details-1332" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">range</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The range to replace. </div>
</div>

</div>

### <a name="InlineCompletionItemProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1307>InlineCompletionItemProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The inline completion item provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
the inline completion feature.</p>
<p>Providers are asked for completions either explicitly by a user gesture or implicitly when typing.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="InlineCompletionItemProvider.provideInlineCompletionItems"></a><span class="ts" id=1309 data-target="#details-1309" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideInlineCompletionItems</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionContext">InlineCompletionContext</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionList">InlineCompletionList</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionItem">InlineCompletionItem</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1309">
<div class="comment"><p>Provides inline completion items for the given position and document.
If inline completions are enabled, this method will be called whenever the user stopped typing.
It will also be called when the user explicitly triggers inline completions or explicitly asks for the next or previous inline completion.
In that case, all available inline completions should be returned.
<code>context.triggerKind</code> can be used to distinguish between these scenarios.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="position"></a><span class="ts" id=1311 data-target="#details-1311" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The position inline completions are requested for.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="context"></a><span class="ts" id=1312 data-target="#details-1312" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">context</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionContext">InlineCompletionContext</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A context object with additional information.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1313 data-target="#details-1313" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionList">InlineCompletionList</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#InlineCompletionItem">InlineCompletionItem</a>[]&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An array of completion items or a thenable that resolves to an array of completion items.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="InlineValue"></a><span class="code-item" id=769>InlineValue</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Inline value information can be provided by different means:</p>
<ul>
<li>directly as a text value (class InlineValueText).</li>
<li>as a name to use for a variable lookup (class InlineValueVariableLookup)</li>
<li>as an evaluatable expression (class InlineValueEvaluatableExpression)
The InlineValue types combines all inline value types into one type.</li>
</ul>
</div>



<a name="InlineValue"></a><span class="ts" id=769 data-target="#details-769" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">InlineValue</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#InlineValueText">InlineValueText</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#InlineValueVariableLookup">InlineValueVariableLookup</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#InlineValueEvaluatableExpression">InlineValueEvaluatableExpression</a></span>

### <a name="InlineValuesProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=773>InlineValuesProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The inline values provider interface defines the contract between extensions and the editor&#39;s debugger inline values feature.
In this contract the provider returns inline value information for a given document range
and the editor shows this information in the editor at the end of lines.</p>
</div>

<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#EventEmitter">EventEmitter</a></p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="InputBox"></a><span class="code-item" id=3123>InputBox</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A concrete <a href="#QuickInput">QuickInput</a> to let the user input a text value.</p>
<p>Note that in many cases the more convenient <a href="#window.showInputBox">window.showInputBox</a>
is easier to use. <a href="#window.createInputBox">window.createInputBox</a> should be used
when <a href="#window.showInputBox">window.showInputBox</a> does not offer the required flexibility.</p>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3133">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional validation message indicating a problem with the current input value.
By returning a string, the InputBox will use a default <a href="#InputBoxValidationSeverity">InputBoxValidationSeverity</a> of Error.
Returning undefined clears the validation message.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3125">
<div class="comment"><p>Selection range in the input value. Defined as tuple of two number where the
first is the inclusive start index and the second the exclusive end index. When <code>undefined</code> the whole
pre-filled value will be selected, when empty (start equals end) only the cursor will be set,
otherwise the defined range will be selected.</p>
<p>This property does not get updated when the user types or makes a selection,
but it can be updated by the extension.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="comment"><p>Options to configure the behavior of the input box UI.</p>

### <a name="LinkedEditingRangeProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1545>LinkedEditingRangeProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The linked editing range provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
the linked editing feature.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="LinkedEditingRangeProvider.provideLinkedEditingRanges"></a><span class="ts" id=1547 data-target="#details-1547" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideLinkedEditingRanges</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#LinkedEditingRanges">LinkedEditingRanges</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1547">
<div class="comment"><p>For a given position in a document, returns the range of the symbol at the position and all ranges
that have the same content. A change to one of the ranges can be applied to all other ranges if the new content
is valid. An optional word pattern can be returned with the result to describe valid contents.
If no result-specific word pattern is provided, the word pattern from the language configuration is used.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="document"></a><span class="ts" id=1548 data-target="#details-1548" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The document in which the provider was invoked.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="position"></a><span class="ts" id=1549 data-target="#details-1549" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The position at which the provider was invoked.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=1550 data-target="#details-1550" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#LinkedEditingRanges">LinkedEditingRanges</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A list of ranges that can be edited together</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="wordPattern"></a><span class="ts" id=1542 data-target="#details-1542" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">wordPattern</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An optional word pattern that describes valid contents for the given ranges</p>

### <a name="MarkdownString"></a><span class="code-item" id=694>MarkdownString</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Human-readable text that supports formatting via the <a href="https://commonmark.org">markdown syntax</a>.</p>
<p>Rendering of <a href="#ThemeIcon">theme icons</a> via the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax is supported
when the <a href="#MarkdownString.supportThemeIcons">supportThemeIcons</a> is set to <code>true</code>.</p>
<p>Rendering of embedded html is supported when <a href="#MarkdownString.supportHtml">supportHtml</a> is set to <code>true</code>.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors



<a name="MarkdownString.new MarkdownString"></a><span class="ts" id=696 data-target="#details-696" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">new MarkdownString</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">value</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">supportThemeIcons</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-696">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a new markdown string with the given value.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>

</div></td></tr>

#### Properties



<a name="MarkdownString.baseUri"></a><span class="ts" id=705 data-target="#details-705" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">baseUri</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-705">
<div class="comment"><p>Uri that relative paths are resolved relative to.</p>
<p>If the <code>baseUri</code> ends with <code>/</code>, it is considered a directory and relative paths in the markdown are resolved relative to that directory:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">md</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">MarkdownString</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">`[link](./file.js)`</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">md</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">baseUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/path/to/dir/&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Here &#39;link&#39; in the rendered markdown resolves to &#39;/path/to/dir/file.js&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>If the <code>baseUri</code> is a file, relative paths in the markdown are resolved relative to the parent dir of that file:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">md</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">MarkdownString</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">`[link](./file.js)`</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">md</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">baseUri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/path/to/otherFile.js&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Here &#39;link&#39; in the rendered markdown resolves to &#39;/path/to/file.js&#39;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="MarkdownString.isTrusted"></a><span class="ts" id=700 data-target="#details-700" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isTrusted</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span> &#124; {enabledCommands: readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-700">
<div class="comment"><p>Indicates that this markdown string is from a trusted source. Only <em>trusted</em>
markdown supports links that execute commands, e.g. <code>[Run it](command:myCommandId)</code>.</p>
<p>Defaults to <code>false</code> (commands are disabled).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="MarkdownString.supportHtml"></a><span class="ts" id=704 data-target="#details-704" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">supportHtml</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-704">
<div class="comment"><p>Indicates that this markdown string can contain raw html tags. Defaults to <code>false</code>.</p>
<p>When <code>supportHtml</code> is false, the markdown renderer will strip out any raw html tags
that appear in the markdown text. This means you can only use markdown syntax for rendering.</p>
<p>When <code>supportHtml</code> is true, the markdown render will also allow a safe subset of html tags
and attributes to be rendered. See <a href="https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6d2920473c6f13759c978dd89104c4270a83422d/src/vs/base/browser/markdownRenderer.ts#L296">https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6d2920473c6f13759c978dd89104c4270a83422d/src/vs/base/browser/markdownRenderer.ts#L296</a>
for a list of all supported tags and attributes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="MarkdownString.supportThemeIcons"></a><span class="ts" id=703 data-target="#details-703" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">supportThemeIcons</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-703">
<div class="comment"><p>Indicates that this markdown string can contain <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcons</a>, e.g. <code>$(zap)</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-699">
<div class="comment"><p>The markdown string.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="MarkedString"></a><span class="code-item" id=716>MarkedString</span>



<div class="comment"><p>MarkedString can be used to render human-readable text. It is either a markdown string
or a code-block that provides a language and a code snippet. Note that
markdown strings will be sanitized - that means html will be escaped.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>deprecated</em> - This type is deprecated, please use <a href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a> instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>

### <a name="Memento"></a><span class="code-item" id=1974>Memento</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A memento represents a storage utility. It can store and retrieve
values.</p>

### <a name="MessageItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=543>MessageItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents an action that is shown with an information, warning, or
error message.</p>
<p><em>See also</em></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#window.showInformationMessage">showInformationMessage</a></li>
<li><a href="#window.showWarningMessage">showWarningMessage</a></li>
<li><a href="#window.showErrorMessage">showErrorMessage</a></li>
</ul>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="MessageItem.isCloseAffordance"></a><span class="ts" id=545 data-target="#details-545" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isCloseAffordance</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-545">
<div class="comment"><p>A hint for modal dialogs that the item should be triggered
when the user cancels the dialog (e.g. by pressing the ESC
key).</p>
<p>Note: this option is ignored for non-modal messages.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="MessageItem.title"></a><span class="ts" id=544 data-target="#details-544" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">title</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>

</div>
</div>

### <a name="MessageOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=546>MessageOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Options to configure the behavior of the message.</p>
<p><em>See also</em></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#window.showInformationMessage">showInformationMessage</a></li>
<li><a href="#window.showWarningMessage">showWarningMessage</a></li>
<li><a href="#window.showErrorMessage">showErrorMessage</a></li>
</ul>
</div>

is only shown for <a href="#MessageOptions.modal">modal</a> messages.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookCell"></a><span class="code-item" id=3535>NotebookCell</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a cell of a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a>, either a <a href="#NotebookCellKind.Code">code</a>-cell
or <a href="#NotebookCellKind.Markup">markup</a>-cell.</p>
<p>NotebookCell instances are immutable and are kept in sync for as long as they are part of their notebook.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookCell.document"></a><span class="ts" id=3539 data-target="#details-3539" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span>

<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#TextDocument">text</a> of this cell, represented as text document.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3536">
<div class="comment"><p>The index of this cell in its <a href="#NotebookDocument.cellAt">containing notebook</a>. The
index is updated when a cell is moved within its notebook. The index is <code>-1</code>
when the cell has been removed from its notebook.</p>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3540">
<div class="comment"><p>The metadata of this cell. Can be anything but must be JSON-stringifyable.</p>

</div>

</div>

### <a name="NotebookCellExecution"></a><span class="code-item" id=3731>NotebookCellExecution</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A NotebookCellExecution is how <a href="#NotebookController">notebook controller</a> modify a notebook cell as
it is executing.</p>
<p>When a cell execution object is created, the cell enters the [NotebookCellExecutionState.Pending Pending](#NotebookCellExecutionState.Pending Pending) state.
When <a href="#NotebookCellExecution.start">start(...)</a> is called on the execution task, it enters the [NotebookCellExecutionState.Executing Executing](#NotebookCellExecutionState.Executing Executing) state. When
<a href="#NotebookCellExecution.end">end(...)</a> is called, it enters the [NotebookCellExecutionState.Idle Idle](#NotebookCellExecutionState.Idle Idle) state.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookCellExecution.cell"></a><span class="ts" id=3732 data-target="#details-3732" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cell</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCell">NotebookCell</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3732">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#NotebookCell">cell</a> for which this execution has been created.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookCellExecution.executionOrder"></a><span class="ts" id=3734 data-target="#details-3734" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">executionOrder</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3734">
<div class="comment"><p>Set and unset the order of this cell execution.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookCellExecution.token"></a><span class="ts" id=3733 data-target="#details-3733" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3733">
<div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token which will be triggered when the cell execution is canceled
from the UI.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that the cancellation token will not be triggered when the <a href="#NotebookController">controller</a>
that created this execution uses an <a href="#NotebookController.interruptHandler">interrupt-handler</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3649">
<div class="comment"><p>The output items of this output. Each item must represent the same result. <em>Note</em> that repeated

<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">NotebookCellOutputItem</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">text</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Hello&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;text/plain&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">NotebookCellOutputItem</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">text</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;&lt;i&gt;Hello&lt;/i&gt;&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;text/html&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">NotebookCellOutputItem</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">text</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;_Hello_&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;text/markdown&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">NotebookCellOutputItem</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">text</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Hey&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;text/plain&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// INVALID: repeated type, editor will pick just one</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">]);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookController"></a><span class="code-item" id=3700>NotebookController</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A notebook controller represents an entity that can execute notebook cells. This is often referred to as a kernel.</p>
<p>There can be multiple controllers and the editor will let users choose which controller to use for a certain notebook. The
<a href="#NotebookController.notebookType">notebookType</a>-property defines for what kind of notebooks a controller is for and
the <a href="#NotebookController.updateNotebookAffinity">updateNotebookAffinity</a>-function allows controllers to set a preference
for specific notebook documents. When a controller has been selected its
<a href="#NotebookController.onDidChangeSelectedNotebooks">onDidChangeSelectedNotebooks</a>-event fires.</p>
<p>When a cell is being run the editor will invoke the <a href="#NotebookController.executeHandler">executeHandler</a> and a controller
is expected to create and finalize a <a href="#NotebookCellExecution">notebook cell execution</a>. However, controllers are also free
to create executions by themselves.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="NotebookController.onDidChangeSelectedNotebooks"></a><span class="ts" id=3721 data-target="#details-3721" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeSelectedNotebooks</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;{notebook: <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>, selected: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3721">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that fires whenever a controller has been selected or un-selected for a notebook document.</p>
<p>There can be multiple controllers for a notebook and in that case a controllers needs to be <em>selected</em>. This is a user gesture
and happens either explicitly or implicitly when interacting with a notebook for which a controller was <em>suggested</em>. When possible,
the editor <em>suggests</em> a controller that is most likely to be <em>selected</em>.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that controller selection is persisted (by the controllers <a href="#NotebookController.id">id</a>) and restored as soon as a
controller is re-created or as a notebook is <a href="#workspace.onDidOpenNotebookDocument">opened</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>

stable identifiers across sessions.</p>

<a name="NotebookController.interruptHandler"></a><span class="ts" id=3717 data-target="#details-3717" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">interruptHandler</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>(notebook: <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a>) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3717">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional interrupt handler.</p>
<p>By default cell execution is canceled via <a href="#NotebookCellExecution.token">tokens</a>. Cancellation
tokens require that a controller can keep track of its execution so that it can cancel a specific execution at a later
point. Not all scenarios allow for that, eg. REPL-style controllers often work by interrupting whatever is currently
running. For those cases the interrupt handler exists - it can be thought of as the equivalent of <code>SIGINT</code>
or <code>Control+C</code> in terminals.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that supporting <a href="#NotebookCellExecution.token">cancellation tokens</a> is preferred and that interrupt handlers should
only be used when tokens cannot be supported.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature variable-declaration-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="notebook"></a><span class="ts" id=3720 data-target="#details-3720" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebook</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="NotebookController.supportedLanguages"></a><span class="ts" id=3703 data-target="#details-3703" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">supportedLanguages</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3703">
<div class="comment"><p>An array of language identifiers that are supported by this
controller. Any language identifier from <a href="#languages.getLanguages">getLanguages</a>
is possible. When falsy all languages are supported.</p>
<p>Samples:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// support JavaScript and TypeScript</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">myController</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">supportedLanguages</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> [</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;javascript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;typescript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">];</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// support all languages</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">myController</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">supportedLanguages</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">undefined</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// falsy</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">myController</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">supportedLanguages</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> []; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// falsy</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocument"></a><span class="code-item" id=3546>NotebookDocument</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a notebook which itself is a sequence of <a href="#NotebookCell">code or markup cells</a>. Notebook documents are
created from <a href="#NotebookData">notebook data</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocument.cellCount"></a><span class="ts" id=3557 data-target="#details-3557" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cellCount</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3557">
<div class="comment"><p>The number of cells in the notebook.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.isClosed"></a><span class="ts" id=3552 data-target="#details-3552" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isClosed</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3552">
<div class="comment"><p><code>true</code> if the notebook has been closed. A closed notebook isn&#39;t synchronized anymore
and won&#39;t be re-used when the same resource is opened again.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.isDirty"></a><span class="ts" id=3550 data-target="#details-3550" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isDirty</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3550">
<div class="comment"><p><code>true</code> if there are unpersisted changes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.isUntitled"></a><span class="ts" id=3551 data-target="#details-3551" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isUntitled</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3551">
<div class="comment"><p>Is this notebook representing an untitled file which has not been saved yet.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.metadata"></a><span class="ts" id=3553 data-target="#details-3553" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">metadata</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3553">
<div class="comment"><p>Arbitrary metadata for this notebook. Can be anything but must be JSON-stringifyable.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.notebookType"></a><span class="ts" id=3548 data-target="#details-3548" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebookType</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3548">
<div class="comment"><p>The type of notebook.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.uri"></a><span class="ts" id=3547 data-target="#details-3547" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3547">
<div class="comment"><p>The associated uri for this notebook.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that most notebooks use the <code>file</code>-scheme, which means they are files on disk. However, <strong>not</strong> all notebooks are
saved on disk and therefore the <code>scheme</code> must be checked before trying to access the underlying file or siblings on disk.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#FileSystemProvider">FileSystemProvider</a></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocument.version"></a><span class="ts" id=3549 data-target="#details-3549" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">version</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3549">
<div class="comment"><p>The version number of this notebook (it will strictly increase after each
change, including undo/redo).</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange"></a><span class="code-item" id=3566>NotebookDocumentCellChange</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Describes a change to a notebook cell.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#NotebookDocumentChangeEvent">NotebookDocumentChangeEvent</a></p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange.cell"></a><span class="ts" id=3567 data-target="#details-3567" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cell</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCell">NotebookCell</a></span>

<div class="comment"><p>The affected cell.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange.document"></a><span class="ts" id=3568 data-target="#details-3568" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3568">
<div class="comment"><p>The document of the cell or <code>undefined</code> when it did not change.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that you should use the <a href="#workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument">onDidChangeTextDocument</a>-event
for detailed change information, like what edits have been performed.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange.executionSummary"></a><span class="ts" id=3574 data-target="#details-3574" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">executionSummary</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCellExecutionSummary">NotebookCellExecutionSummary</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3574">
<div class="comment"><p>The new execution summary of the cell or <code>undefined</code> when it did not change.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange.metadata"></a><span class="ts" id=3569 data-target="#details-3569" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">metadata</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3569">
<div class="comment"><p>The new metadata of the cell or <code>undefined</code> when it did not change.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentCellChange.outputs"></a><span class="ts" id=3573 data-target="#details-3573" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">outputs</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCellOutput">NotebookCellOutput</a>[]</span>

</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentChangeEvent"></a><span class="code-item" id=3579>NotebookDocumentChangeEvent</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event describing a transactional <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook</a> change.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentChangeEvent.cellChanges"></a><span class="ts" id=3586 data-target="#details-3586" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cellChanges</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocumentCellChange">NotebookDocumentCellChange</a>[]</span>

<a name="NotebookDocumentChangeEvent.contentChanges"></a><span class="ts" id=3585 data-target="#details-3585" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">contentChanges</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocumentContentChange">NotebookDocumentContentChange</a>[]</span>

</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentContentChange"></a><span class="code-item" id=3575>NotebookDocumentContentChange</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Describes a structural change to a notebook document, e.g newly added and removed cells.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#NotebookDocumentChangeEvent">NotebookDocumentChangeEvent</a></p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentChange.addedCells"></a><span class="ts" id=3577 data-target="#details-3577" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">addedCells</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCell">NotebookCell</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3577">
<div class="comment"><p>Cells that have been added to the document.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentChange.range"></a><span class="ts" id=3576 data-target="#details-3576" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">range</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookRange">NotebookRange</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3576">

<p>Note that no cells have been <a href="#NotebookDocumentContentChange.removedCells">removed</a>
when this range is <a href="#NotebookRange.isEmpty">empty</a>.</p>

</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentChange.removedCells"></a><span class="ts" id=3578 data-target="#details-3578" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">removedCells</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookCell">NotebookCell</a>[]</span>
