</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentContentOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=3687>NotebookDocumentContentOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Notebook content options define what parts of a notebook are persisted. Note</p>
<p>For instance, a notebook serializer can opt-out of saving outputs and in that case the editor doesn&#39;t mark a
notebooks as <a href="#NotebookDocument.isDirty">dirty</a> when its output has changed.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentOptions.transientCellMetadata"></a><span class="ts" id=3689 data-target="#details-3689" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">transientCellMetadata</span><span>?</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3689">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if a cell metadata property change event will trigger notebook document content
change events and if it will be used in the diff editor, defaults to false. If the
content provider doesn&#39;t persist a metadata property in the file document, it should be
set to true.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentOptions.transientDocumentMetadata"></a><span class="ts" id=3693 data-target="#details-3693" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">transientDocumentMetadata</span><span>?</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3693">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if a document metadata property change event will trigger notebook document
content change event and if it will be used in the diff editor, defaults to false. If the
content provider doesn&#39;t persist a metadata property in the file document, it should be
set to true.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentContentOptions.transientOutputs"></a><span class="ts" id=3688 data-target="#details-3688" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">transientOutputs</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3688">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if output change events will trigger notebook document content change events and
if it will be used in the diff editor, defaults to false. If the content provider doesn&#39;t
persist the outputs in the file document, this should be set to true.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentShowOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=232>NotebookDocumentShowOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents options to configure the behavior of showing a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook document</a> in an <a href="#NotebookEditor">notebook editor</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentShowOptions.preserveFocus"></a><span class="ts" id=234 data-target="#details-234" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">preserveFocus</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-234">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional flag that when <code>true</code> will stop the <a href="#NotebookEditor">notebook editor</a> from taking focus.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentShowOptions.preview"></a><span class="ts" id=235 data-target="#details-235" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">preview</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-235">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional flag that controls if an <a href="#NotebookEditor">notebook editor</a>-tab shows as preview. Preview tabs will
be replaced and reused until set to stay - either explicitly or through editing. The default behaviour depends
on the <code>workbench.editor.enablePreview</code>-setting.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentShowOptions.selections"></a><span class="ts" id=236 data-target="#details-236" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">selections</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookRange">NotebookRange</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-236">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional selection to apply for the document in the <a href="#NotebookEditor">notebook editor</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentShowOptions.viewColumn"></a><span class="ts" id=233 data-target="#details-233" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">viewColumn</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ViewColumn">ViewColumn</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-233">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional view column in which the <a href="#NotebookEditor">notebook editor</a> should be shown.
The default is the <a href="#ViewColumn.Active">active</a>. Columns that do not exist
will be created as needed up to the maximum of <a href="#ViewColumn.Nine">ViewColumn.Nine</a>.
Use <a href="#ViewColumn.Beside">ViewColumn.Beside</a> to open the editor to the side of the currently
active one.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent"></a><span class="code-item" id=3587>NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event that is fired when a <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook document</a> will be saved.</p>
<p>To make modifications to the document before it is being saved, call the
<a href="#NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil">waitUntil</a>-function with a thenable
that resolves to a <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.notebook"></a><span class="ts" id=3589 data-target="#details-3589" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">notebook</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookDocument">NotebookDocument</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3589">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#NotebookDocument">notebook document</a> that will be saved.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.reason"></a><span class="ts" id=3590 data-target="#details-3590" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">reason</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocumentSaveReason">TextDocumentSaveReason</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3590">
<div class="comment"><p>The reason why save was triggered.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.token"></a><span class="ts" id=3588 data-target="#details-3588" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3588">
<div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil"></a><span class="ts" id=3592 data-target="#details-3592" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">waitUntil</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceEdit">WorkspaceEdit</a>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3592">
<div class="comment"><p>Allows to pause the event loop and to apply <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.
Edits of subsequent calls to this function will be applied in order. The
edits will be <em>ignored</em> if concurrent modifications of the notebook document happened.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This function can only be called during event dispatch and not
in an asynchronous manner:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onWillSaveNotebookDocument</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// async, will *throw* an error</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">setTimeout</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(() </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// sync, OK</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="thenable"></a><span class="ts" id=3593 data-target="#details-3593" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceEdit">WorkspaceEdit</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A thenable that resolves to <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="NotebookDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil"></a><span class="ts" id=3594 data-target="#details-3594" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">waitUntil</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3594">
<div class="comment"><p>Allows to pause the event loop until the provided thenable resolved.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This function can only be called during event dispatch.</p>

<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="thenable"></a><span class="ts" id=3595 data-target="#details-3595" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A thenable that delays saving.</p>

<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>

### <a name="NotebookEdit"></a><span class="code-item" id=923>NotebookEdit</span>

#### Static



<a name="NotebookEdit.deleteCells"></a><span class="ts" id=933 data-target="#details-933" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">deleteCells</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">range</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookRange">NotebookRange</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookEdit">NotebookEdit</a></span>

</div>

### <a name="NotebookRange"></a><span class="code-item" id=3603>NotebookRange</span>

### <a name="NotebookSerializer"></a><span class="code-item" id=3678>NotebookSerializer</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The notebook serializer enables the editor to open notebook files.</p>
<p>At its core the editor only knows a <a href="#NotebookData">notebook data structure</a> but not
how that data structure is written to a file, nor how it is read from a file. The
notebook serializer bridges this gap by deserializing bytes into notebook data and
vice versa.</p>
</div>

<a name="NotebookSerializer.deserializeNotebook"></a><span class="ts" id=3680 data-target="#details-3680" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">deserializeNotebook</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">content</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Uint8Array</span>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookData">NotebookData</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#NotebookData">NotebookData</a>&gt;</span>

</div>

<tr><td><a name="content"></a><span class="ts" id=3681 data-target="#details-3681" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">content</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Uint8Array</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Contents of a notebook file.</p>
</div></td></tr>

### <a name="OpenDialogOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=524>OpenDialogOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Options to configure the behaviour of a file open dialog.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note 1: On Windows and Linux, a file dialog cannot be both a file selector and a folder selector, so if you
set both <code>canSelectFiles</code> and <code>canSelectFolders</code> to <code>true</code> on these platforms, a folder selector will be shown.</li>
<li>Note 2: Explicitly setting <code>canSelectFiles</code> and <code>canSelectFolders</code> to <code>false</code> is futile
and the editor then silently adjusts the options to select files.</li>
</ul>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.canSelectFiles"></a><span class="ts" id=527 data-target="#details-527" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">canSelectFiles</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-527">
<div class="comment"><p>Allow to select files, defaults to <code>true</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.canSelectFolders"></a><span class="ts" id=528 data-target="#details-528" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">canSelectFolders</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-528">
<div class="comment"><p>Allow to select folders, defaults to <code>false</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.canSelectMany"></a><span class="ts" id=529 data-target="#details-529" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">canSelectMany</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-529">
<div class="comment"><p>Allow to select many files or folders.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.defaultUri"></a><span class="ts" id=525 data-target="#details-525" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">defaultUri</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-525">
<div class="comment"><p>The resource the dialog shows when opened.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.filters"></a><span class="ts" id=530 data-target="#details-530" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">filters</span><span>?</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-530">
<div class="comment"><p>A set of file filters that are used by the dialog. Each entry is a human-readable label,
like &quot;TypeScript&quot;, and an array of extensions, for example:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">{</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Images&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;png&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;jpg&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">],</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;TypeScript&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;ts&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;tsx&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.openLabel"></a><span class="ts" id=526 data-target="#details-526" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">openLabel</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-526">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string for the open button.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="OpenDialogOptions.title"></a><span class="ts" id=534 data-target="#details-534" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">title</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>

</div>
</div>

### <a name="Position"></a><span class="code-item" id=51>Position</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a line and character position, such as
the position of the cursor.</p>
<p>Position objects are <strong>immutable</strong>. Use the <a href="#Position.with">with</a> or
<a href="#Position.translate">translate</a> methods to derive new positions
from an existing position.</p>
</div>

report on how much work finished</p>
</div></td></tr>

### <a name="ProgressLocation"></a><span class="code-item" id=3068>ProgressLocation</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A location in the editor at which progress information can be shown. It depends on the
location how progress is visually represented.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="ProgressLocation.SourceControl"></a><span class="ts" id=3069 data-target="#details-3069" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">SourceControl</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3069">
<div class="comment"><p>Show progress for the source control viewlet, as overlay for the icon and as progress bar
inside the viewlet (when visible). Neither supports cancellation nor discrete progress nor
a label to describe the operation.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ProgressLocation.Window"></a><span class="ts" id=3070 data-target="#details-3070" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Window</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">10</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3070">
<div class="comment"><p>Show progress in the status bar of the editor. Neither supports cancellation nor discrete progress.
Supports rendering of <a href="#ThemeIcon">theme icons</a> via the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax in the progress label.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ProgressLocation.Notification"></a><span class="ts" id=3071 data-target="#details-3071" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Notification</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">15</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3071">
<div class="comment"><p>Show progress as notification with an optional cancel button. Supports to show infinite and discrete
progress but does not support rendering of icons.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="ProgressOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=3072>ProgressOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Value-object describing where and how progress should show.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="ProgressOptions.cancellable"></a><span class="ts" id=3077 data-target="#details-3077" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cancellable</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3077">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if a cancel button should show to allow the user to
cancel the long running operation.  Note that currently only
<code>ProgressLocation.Notification</code> is supporting to show a cancel
button.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ProgressOptions.location"></a><span class="ts" id=3073 data-target="#details-3073" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">location</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProgressLocation">ProgressLocation</a> &#124; {viewId: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3073">
<div class="comment"><p>The location at which progress should show.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ProgressOptions.title"></a><span class="ts" id=3076 data-target="#details-3076" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">title</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3076">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which will be used to describe the
operation.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="ProviderResult"></a><span class="code-item" id=582>ProviderResult&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A provider result represents the values a provider, like the <a href="#HoverProvider">HoverProvider</a>,
may return. For once this is the actual result type <code>T</code>, like <code>Hover</code>, or a thenable that resolves
to that type <code>T</code>. In addition, <code>null</code> and <code>undefined</code> can be returned - either directly or from a
thenable.</p>
<p>The snippets below are all valid implementations of the <a href="#HoverProvider">HoverProvider</a>:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">HoverProvider</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">provideHover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pos</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">token</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">ProviderResult</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt; {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Hello World&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">HoverProvider</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">provideHover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pos</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">token</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">ProviderResult</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt; {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">resolve</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">resolve</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Hello World&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    });</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">let</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">c</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">HoverProvider</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">provideHover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">doc</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pos</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">token</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">ProviderResult</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Hover</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt; {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">return</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// undefined</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>



<a name="ProviderResult"></a><span class="ts" id=582 data-target="#details-582" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">ProviderResult</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span> &#124; <a class="type-literal">null</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">undefined</span> &#124; <a class="type-literal">null</a>&gt;</span>

### <a name="Pseudoterminal"></a><span class="code-item" id=2954>Pseudoterminal</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Defines the interface of a terminal pty, enabling extensions to control a terminal.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="Pseudoterminal.onDidChangeName"></a><span class="ts" id=2958 data-target="#details-2958" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeName</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2958">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that when fired allows changing the name of the terminal.</p>
<p>Events fired before <a href="#Pseudoterminal.open">Pseudoterminal.open</a> is called will be be ignored.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Change the terminal name to &quot;My new terminal&quot;.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">changeNameEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pty</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Pseudoterminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidWrite:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidChangeName:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">changeNameEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">open</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">changeNameEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;My new terminal&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">close</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {}</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">name:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;My terminal&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pty</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Pseudoterminal.onDidClose"></a><span class="ts" id=2957 data-target="#details-2957" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidClose</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">number</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2957">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that when fired will signal that the pty is closed and dispose of the terminal.</p>
<p>Events fired before <a href="#Pseudoterminal.open">Pseudoterminal.open</a> is called will be be ignored.</p>
<p>A number can be used to provide an exit code for the terminal. Exit codes must be
positive and a non-zero exit codes signals failure which shows a notification for a
regular terminal and allows dependent tasks to proceed when used with the
<code>CustomExecution</code> API.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Exit the terminal when &quot;y&quot; is pressed, otherwise show a notification.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">closeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">void</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pty</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Pseudoterminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidWrite:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidClose:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">closeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">open</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Press y to exit successfully&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">close</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {},</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">handleInput</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">data</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #C586C0">if</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> (</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">data</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">!==</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;y&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">showInformationMessage</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Something went wrong&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">closeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">terminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">name:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Exit example&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pty</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">terminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">show</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #569CD6">true</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Pseudoterminal.onDidOverrideDimensions"></a><span class="ts" id=2956 data-target="#details-2956" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidOverrideDimensions</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalDimensions">TerminalDimensions</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2956">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that when fired allows overriding the <a href="#Pseudoterminal.setDimensions">dimensions</a> of the
terminal. Note that when set, the overridden dimensions will only take effect when they
are lower than the actual dimensions of the terminal (ie. there will never be a scroll
bar). Set to <code>undefined</code> for the terminal to go back to the regular dimensions (fit to
the size of the panel).</p>
<p>Events fired before <a href="#Pseudoterminal.open">Pseudoterminal.open</a> is called will be be ignored.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Override the dimensions of a terminal to 20 columns and 10 rows</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">dimensionsEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">TerminalDimensions</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pty</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Pseudoterminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidWrite:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidOverrideDimensions:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">dimensionsEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">open</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">dimensionsEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">columns:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">20</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">rows:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">10</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    });</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  },</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">close</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {}</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">name:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;My terminal&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pty</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Pseudoterminal.onDidWrite"></a><span class="ts" id=2955 data-target="#details-2955" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidWrite</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2955">
<div class="comment"><p>An event that when fired will write data to the terminal. Unlike
<a href="#Terminal.sendText">Terminal.sendText</a> which sends text to the underlying child
pseudo-device (the child), this will write the text to parent pseudo-device (the
<em>terminal</em> itself).</p>
<p>Note writing <code>\n</code> will just move the cursor down 1 row, you need to write <code>\r</code> as well
to move the cursor to the left-most cell.</p>
<p>Events fired before <a href="#Pseudoterminal.open">Pseudoterminal.open</a> is called will be be ignored.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Write red text to the terminal</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pty</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Pseudoterminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidWrite:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">open</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\x1b</span><span style="color: #CE9178">[31mHello world</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\x1b</span><span style="color: #CE9178">[0m&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">),</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">close</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {}</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">name:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;My terminal&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pty</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Move the cursor to the 10th row and 20th column and write an asterisk</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\x1b</span><span style="color: #CE9178">[10;20H*&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>

<a name="Pseudoterminal.handleInput"></a><span class="ts" id=2965 data-target="#details-2965" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">handleInput</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">data</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2965">
<div class="comment"><p>Implement to handle incoming keystrokes in the terminal or when an extension calls
<a href="#Terminal.sendText">Terminal.sendText</a>. <code>data</code> contains the keystrokes/text serialized into
their corresponding VT sequence representation.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="data"></a><span class="ts" id=2966 data-target="#details-2966" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">data</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The incoming data.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Echo input in the terminal. The sequence for enter (<code>\r</code>) is translated to
CRLF to go to a new line and move the cursor to the start of the line.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">EventEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&lt;</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">&gt;();</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pty</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">Pseudoterminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">onDidWrite:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">open</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {},</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">close</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> () </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {},</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">handleInput</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">data</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">writeEmitter</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">fire</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">data</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\r</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">?</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\r\n</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">data</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">name:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;Local echo&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">pty</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div></td></tr>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-2968">
<div class="comment"><p>Implement to handle when the number of rows and columns that fit into the terminal panel
changes, for example when font size changes or when the panel is resized. The initial
state of a terminal&#39;s dimensions should be treated as <code>undefined</code> until this is triggered
as the size of a terminal isn&#39;t known until it shows up in the user interface.</p>
<p>When dimensions are overridden by
<a href="#Pseudoterminal.onDidOverrideDimensions">onDidOverrideDimensions</a>, <code>setDimensions</code> will
continue to be called with the regular panel dimensions, allowing the extension continue
to react dimension changes.</p>
</div>

### <a name="QuickDiffProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=3805>QuickDiffProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A quick diff provider provides a <a href="#Uri">uri</a> to the original state of a
modified resource. The editor will use this information to render ad&#39;hoc diffs
within the text.</p>
</div>

### <a name="QuickInput"></a><span class="code-item" id=3078>QuickInput</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A light-weight user input UI that is initially not visible. After
configuring it through its properties the extension can make it
visible by calling <a href="#QuickInput.show">QuickInput.show</a>.</p>
<p>There are several reasons why this UI might have to be hidden and
the extension will be notified through <a href="#QuickInput.onDidHide">QuickInput.onDidHide</a>.
(Examples include: an explicit call to <a href="#QuickInput.hide">QuickInput.hide</a>,
the user pressing Esc, some other input UI opening, etc.)</p>
<p>A user pressing Enter or some other gesture implying acceptance
of the current state does not automatically hide this UI component.
It is up to the extension to decide whether to accept the user&#39;s input
and if the UI should indeed be hidden through a call to <a href="#QuickInput.hide">QuickInput.hide</a>.</p>
<p>When the extension no longer needs this input UI, it should
<a href="#QuickInput.dispose">QuickInput.dispose</a> it to allow for freeing up
any resources associated with it.</p>
<p>See <a href="#QuickPick">QuickPick</a> and <a href="#InputBox">InputBox</a> for concrete UIs.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="QuickInput.onDidHide"></a><span class="ts" id=3089 data-target="#details-3089" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidHide</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3089">
<div class="comment"><p>An event signaling when this input UI is hidden.</p>
<p>There are several reasons why this UI might have to be hidden and
the extension will be notified through <a href="#QuickInput.onDidHide">QuickInput.onDidHide</a>.
(Examples include: an explicit call to <a href="#QuickInput.hide">QuickInput.hide</a>,
the user pressing Esc, some other input UI opening, etc.)</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="QuickInput.busy"></a><span class="ts" id=3083 data-target="#details-3083" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">busy</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3083">
<div class="comment"><p>If the UI should show a progress indicator. Defaults to false.</p>
<p>Change this to true, e.g., while loading more data or validating
user input.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickInput.enabled"></a><span class="ts" id=3082 data-target="#details-3082" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">enabled</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3082">
<div class="comment"><p>If the UI should allow for user input. Defaults to true.</p>
<p>Change this to false, e.g., while validating user input or
loading data for the next step in user input.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickInput.ignoreFocusOut"></a><span class="ts" id=3084 data-target="#details-3084" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">ignoreFocusOut</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3084">
<div class="comment"><p>If the UI should stay open even when loosing UI focus. Defaults to false.
This setting is ignored on iPad and is always false.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickInput.step"></a><span class="ts" id=3080 data-target="#details-3080" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">step</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>

<div class="comment"><p>An optional current step count.</p>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-3081">

#### Static



<a name="QuickInputButtons.Back"></a><span class="ts" id=3154 data-target="#details-3154" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Back</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#QuickInputButton">QuickInputButton</a></span>

### <a name="QuickPick"></a><span class="code-item" id=3092>QuickPick&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A concrete <a href="#QuickInput">QuickInput</a> to let the user pick an item from a
list of items of type T. The items can be filtered through a filter text field and
there is an option <a href="#QuickPick.canSelectMany">canSelectMany</a> to allow for
selecting multiple items.</p>
<p>Note that in many cases the more convenient <a href="#window.showQuickPick">window.showQuickPick</a>
is easier to use. <a href="#window.createQuickPick">window.createQuickPick</a> should be used
when <a href="#window.showQuickPick">window.showQuickPick</a> does not offer the required flexibility.</p>
</div>

<a name="QuickPick.onDidHide"></a><span class="ts" id=3119 data-target="#details-3119" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidHide</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>

</div>

### <a name="QuickPickItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=499>QuickPickItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents an item that can be selected from
a list of items.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="QuickPickItem.alwaysShow"></a><span class="ts" id=509 data-target="#details-509" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">alwaysShow</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-509">
<div class="comment"><p>Always show this item.</p>
<p>Note: this property is ignored when <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">kind</a> is set to <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">QuickPickItemKind.Separator</a></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.buttons"></a><span class="ts" id=510 data-target="#details-510" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">buttons</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#QuickInputButton">QuickInputButton</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-510">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional buttons that will be rendered on this particular item. These buttons will trigger
an <a href="#QuickPickItemButtonEvent">QuickPickItemButtonEvent</a> when clicked. Buttons are only rendered when using a quickpick
created by the <a href="#window.createQuickPick">createQuickPick()</a> API. Buttons are not rendered when using
the <a href="#window.showQuickPick">showQuickPick()</a> API.</p>
<p>Note: this property is ignored when <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">kind</a> is set to <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">QuickPickItemKind.Separator</a></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.description"></a><span class="ts" id=506 data-target="#details-506" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">description</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-506">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which is rendered less prominent in the same line. Supports rendering of
<a href="#ThemeIcon">theme icons</a> via the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax.</p>
<p>Note: this property is ignored when <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">kind</a> is set to <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">QuickPickItemKind.Separator</a></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.detail"></a><span class="ts" id=507 data-target="#details-507" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">detail</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-507">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which is rendered less prominent in a separate line. Supports rendering of
<a href="#ThemeIcon">theme icons</a> via the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax.</p>
<p>Note: this property is ignored when <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">kind</a> is set to <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">QuickPickItemKind.Separator</a></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.iconPath"></a><span class="ts" id=502 data-target="#details-502" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">iconPath</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> &#124; {dark: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, light: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-502">
<div class="comment"><p>The icon path or <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> for the QuickPickItem.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.kind"></a><span class="ts" id=501 data-target="#details-501" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#QuickPickItemKind">QuickPickItemKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-501">
<div class="comment"><p>The kind of QuickPickItem that will determine how this item is rendered in the quick pick. When not specified,
the default is <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Default">QuickPickItemKind.Default</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.label"></a><span class="ts" id=500 data-target="#details-500" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-500">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which is rendered prominent. Supports rendering of <a href="#ThemeIcon">theme icons</a> via
the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItem.picked"></a><span class="ts" id=508 data-target="#details-508" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">picked</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-508">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional flag indicating if this item is picked initially. This is only honored when using
the <a href="#window.showQuickPick">showQuickPick()</a> API. To do the same thing with
the <a href="#window.createQuickPick">createQuickPick()</a> API, simply set the <a href="#QuickPick.selectedItems">QuickPick.selectedItems</a>
to the items you want picked initially.
(<em>Note:</em> This is only honored when the picker allows multiple selections.)</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#QuickPickOptions.canPickMany">QuickPickOptions.canPickMany</a></p>
<p>Note: this property is ignored when <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">kind</a> is set to <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">QuickPickItemKind.Separator</a></p>
</div>
</div>

This event does not fire for buttons in the title bar.</p>

</div>
</div>

### <a name="QuickPickItemKind"></a><span class="code-item" id=496>QuickPickItemKind</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The kind of <a href="#QuickPickItem">quick pick item</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="QuickPickItemKind.Separator"></a><span class="ts" id=497 data-target="#details-497" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Separator</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">-1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-497">
<div class="comment"><p>When a <a href="#QuickPickItem">QuickPickItem</a> has a kind of <a href="#QuickPickItemKind.Separator">Separator</a>, the item is just a visual separator and does not represent a real item.
The only property that applies is <a href="#QuickPickItem.label">label </a>. All other properties on <a href="#QuickPickItem">QuickPickItem</a> will be ignored and have no effect.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="QuickPickItemKind.Default"></a><span class="ts" id=498 data-target="#details-498" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Default</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">0</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-498">
<div class="comment"><p>The default <a href="#QuickPickItem.kind">QuickPickItem.kind</a> is an item that can be selected in the quick pick.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="Range"></a><span class="code-item" id=94>Range</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A range represents an ordered pair of two positions.
It is guaranteed that <a href="#Range.start">start</a>.isBeforeOrEqual(<a href="#Range.end">end</a>)</p>
<p>Range objects are <strong>immutable</strong>. Use the <a href="#Range.with">with</a>,
<a href="#Range.intersection">intersection</a>, or <a href="#Range.union">union</a> methods
to derive new ranges from an existing range.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors



<a name="Range.new Range"></a><span class="ts" id=96 data-target="#details-96" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">new Range</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">start</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">end</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-96">
<div class="comment"><p>Create a new range from two positions. If <code>start</code> is not
before or equal to <code>end</code>, the values will be swapped.</p>
</div>

<table class="table table-bordered">

### <a name="RelativePattern"></a><span class="code-item" id=567>RelativePattern</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A relative pattern is a helper to construct glob patterns that are matched
relatively to a base file path. The base path can either be an absolute file
path as string or uri or a <a href="#WorkspaceFolder">workspace folder</a>, which is the
preferred way of creating the relative pattern.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors



<a name="RelativePattern.new RelativePattern"></a><span class="ts" id=569 data-target="#details-569" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">new RelativePattern</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">base</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#WorkspaceFolder">WorkspaceFolder</a>, <span class="ident">pattern</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#RelativePattern">RelativePattern</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-569">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a new relative pattern object with a base file path and pattern to match. This pattern
will be matched on file paths relative to the base.</p>
<p>Example:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">?.[</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">];</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #C586C0">if</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> (</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// Match any TypeScript file in the root of this workspace folder</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">pattern1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">new</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">RelativePattern</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">folder</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;*.ts&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// Match any TypeScript file in `someFolder` inside this workspace folder</span></span>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-572">
<div class="comment"><p>A base file path to which this pattern will be matched against relatively. The
file path must be absolute, should not have any trailing path separators and
not include any relative segments (<code>.</code> or <code>..</code>).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="RelativePattern.pattern"></a><span class="ts" id=574 data-target="#details-574" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">pattern</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-574">
<div class="comment"><p>A file glob pattern like <code>*.{ts,js}</code> that will be matched on file paths
relative to the base path.</p>
<p>Example: Given a base of <code>/home/work/folder</code> and a file path of <code>/home/work/folder/index.js</code>,
the file glob pattern will match on <code>index.js</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="RenameProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1069>RenameProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The rename provider interface defines the contract between extensions and
the <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_rename-symbol">rename</a>-feature.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="RenameProvider.prepareRename"></a><span class="ts" id=1077 data-target="#details-1077" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">prepareRename</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a> &#124; {placeholder: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, range: <a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a>}&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1077">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional function for resolving and validating a position <em>before</em> running rename. The result can
be a range or a range and a placeholder text. The placeholder text should be the identifier of the symbol
which is being renamed - when omitted the text in the returned range is used.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This function should throw an error or return a rejected thenable when the provided location
doesn&#39;t allow for a rename.</p>
</div>

### <a name="SelectionRangeProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1458>SelectionRangeProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The selection range provider interface defines the contract between extensions and the &quot;Expand and Shrink Selection&quot; feature.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="SelectionRangeProvider.provideSelectionRanges"></a><span class="ts" id=1460 data-target="#details-1460" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideSelectionRanges</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">positions</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>[], <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#SelectionRange">SelectionRange</a>[]&gt;</span>

<div class="comment"><p>Provide selection ranges for the given positions.</p>
<p>Selection ranges should be computed individually and independent for each position. The editor will merge
and deduplicate ranges but providers must return hierarchies of selection ranges so that a range
is <a href="#Range.contains">contained</a> by its parent.</p>
</div>

### <a name="ShellQuoting"></a><span class="code-item" id=2075>ShellQuoting</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Defines how an argument should be quoted if it contains
spaces or unsupported characters.</p>
</div>

#### Enumeration Members



<a name="ShellQuoting.Escape"></a><span class="ts" id=2076 data-target="#details-2076" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Escape</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">1</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2076">
<div class="comment"><p>Character escaping should be used. This for example
uses \ on bash and ` on PowerShell.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ShellQuoting.Strong"></a><span class="ts" id=2077 data-target="#details-2077" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Strong</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">2</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2077">
<div class="comment"><p>Strong string quoting should be used. This for example
uses &quot; for Windows cmd and &#39; for bash and PowerShell.
Strong quoting treats arguments as literal strings.
Under PowerShell echo &#39;The value is $(2 * 3)&#39; will
print <code>The value is $(2 * 3)</code></p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ShellQuoting.Weak"></a><span class="ts" id=2078 data-target="#details-2078" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">Weak</span><span>: </span><a class="type-literal">3</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2078">
<div class="comment"><p>Weak string quoting should be used. This for example
uses &quot; for Windows cmd, bash and PowerShell. Weak quoting
still performs some kind of evaluation inside the quoted
string.  Under PowerShell echo &quot;The value is $(2 * 3)&quot;
will print <code>The value is 6</code></p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="ShellQuotingOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=2059>ShellQuotingOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The shell quoting options.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="ShellQuotingOptions.escape"></a><span class="ts" id=2060 data-target="#details-2060" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">escape</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; {charsToEscape: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, escapeChar: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2060">
<div class="comment"><p>The character used to do character escaping. If a string is provided only spaces
are escaped. If a <code>{ escapeChar, charsToEscape }</code> literal is provide all characters
in <code>charsToEscape</code> are escaped using the <code>escapeChar</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ShellQuotingOptions.strong"></a><span class="ts" id=2064 data-target="#details-2064" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">strong</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2064">
<div class="comment"><p>The character used for strong quoting. The string&#39;s length must be 1.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="ShellQuotingOptions.weak"></a><span class="ts" id=2065 data-target="#details-2065" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">weak</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2065">
<div class="comment"><p>The character used for weak quoting. The string&#39;s length must be 1.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="SnippetString"></a><span class="code-item" id=1040>SnippetString</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A snippet string is a template which allows to insert text
and to control the editor cursor when insertion happens.</p>
<p>A snippet can define tab stops and placeholders with <code>$1</code>, <code>$2</code>
and <code>${3:foo}</code>. <code>$0</code> defines the final tab stop, it defaults to
the end of the snippet. Variables are defined with <code>$name</code> and
<code>${name:default value}</code>. Also see
<a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_create-your-own-snippets">the full snippet syntax</a>.</p>
</div>

### <a name="SnippetTextEdit"></a><span class="code-item" id=908>SnippetTextEdit</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A snippet edit represents an interactive edit that is performed by
the editor.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that a snippet edit can always be performed as a normal <a href="#TextEdit">text edit</a>.
This will happen when no matching editor is open or when a <a href="#WorkspaceEdit">workspace edit</a>
contains snippet edits for multiple files. In that case only those that match the active editor
will be performed as snippet edits and the others as normal text edits.</p>
</div>
