### <a name="SourceControlResourceState"></a><span class="code-item" id=3819>SourceControlResourceState</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An source control resource state represents the state of an underlying workspace
resource within a certain <a href="#SourceControlResourceGroup">source control group</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="SourceControlResourceState.command"></a><span class="ts" id=3821 data-target="#details-3821" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">command</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3821">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#Command">Command</a> which should be run when the resource
state is open in the Source Control viewlet.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="SourceControlResourceState.contextValue"></a><span class="ts" id=3823 data-target="#details-3823" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">contextValue</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3823">
<div class="comment"><p>Context value of the resource state. This can be used to contribute resource specific actions.
For example, if a resource is given a context value as <code>diffable</code>. When contributing actions to <code>scm/resourceState/context</code>
using <code>menus</code> extension point, you can specify context value for key <code>scmResourceState</code> in <code>when</code> expressions, like <code>scmResourceState == diffable</code>.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;menus&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;scm/resourceState/context&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.diff&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;when&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;scmResourceState == diffable&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span></code></pre>
<p>This will show action <code>extension.diff</code> only for resources with <code>contextValue</code> is <code>diffable</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="SourceControlResourceState.decorations"></a><span class="ts" id=3822 data-target="#details-3822" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">decorations</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#SourceControlResourceDecorations">SourceControlResourceDecorations</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3822">

### <a name="StatusBarItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=1835>StatusBarItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A status bar item is a status bar contribution that can
show text and icons and run a command on click.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="StatusBarItem.accessibilityInformation"></a><span class="ts" id=1845 data-target="#details-1845" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">accessibilityInformation</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#AccessibilityInformation">AccessibilityInformation</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1845">
<div class="comment"><p>Accessibility information used when a screen reader interacts with this StatusBar item</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.alignment"></a><span class="ts" id=1837 data-target="#details-1837" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">alignment</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#StatusBarAlignment">StatusBarAlignment</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1837">
<div class="comment"><p>The alignment of this item.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.backgroundColor"></a><span class="ts" id=1843 data-target="#details-1843" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">backgroundColor</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ThemeColor">ThemeColor</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1843">
<div class="comment"><p>The background color for this entry.</p>
<p><em>Note</em>: only the following colors are supported:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>new ThemeColor(&#39;statusBarItem.errorBackground&#39;)</code></li>
<li><code>new ThemeColor(&#39;statusBarItem.warningBackground&#39;)</code></li>
</ul>
<p>More background colors may be supported in the future.</p>
<p><em>Note</em>: when a background color is set, the statusbar may override
the <code>color</code> choice to ensure the entry is readable in all themes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.color"></a><span class="ts" id=1842 data-target="#details-1842" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">color</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#ThemeColor">ThemeColor</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1842">
<div class="comment"><p>The foreground color for this entry.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.command"></a><span class="ts" id=1844 data-target="#details-1844" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">command</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1844">
<div class="comment"><p><a href="#Command">Command</a> or identifier of a command to run on click.</p>
<p>The command must be <a href="#commands.getCommands">known</a>.</p>
<p>Note that if this is a <a href="#Command">Command</a> object, only the <a href="#Command.command">command</a> and <a href="#Command.arguments">arguments</a>
are used by the editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.id"></a><span class="ts" id=1836 data-target="#details-1836" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">id</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1836">
<div class="comment"><p>The identifier of this item.</p>
<p><em>Note</em>: if no identifier was provided by the <a href="#window.createStatusBarItem">window.createStatusBarItem</a>
method, the identifier will match the <a href="#Extension.id">extension identifier</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.name"></a><span class="ts" id=1839 data-target="#details-1839" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">name</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1839">
<div class="comment"><p>The name of the entry, like &#39;Python Language Indicator&#39;, &#39;Git Status&#39; etc.
Try to keep the length of the name short, yet descriptive enough that
users can understand what the status bar item is about.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.priority"></a><span class="ts" id=1838 data-target="#details-1838" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">priority</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1838">
<div class="comment"><p>The priority of this item. Higher value means the item should
be shown more to the left.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.text"></a><span class="ts" id=1840 data-target="#details-1840" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">text</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1840">
<div class="comment"><p>The text to show for the entry. You can embed icons in the text by leveraging the syntax:</p>
<p><code>My text $(icon-name) contains icons like $(icon-name) this one.</code></p>
<p>Where the icon-name is taken from the ThemeIcon <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels#icon-listing">icon set</a>, e.g.
<code>light-bulb</code>, <code>thumbsup</code>, <code>zap</code> etc.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="StatusBarItem.tooltip"></a><span class="ts" id=1841 data-target="#details-1841" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">tooltip</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1841">
<div class="comment"><p>The tooltip text when you hover over this entry.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TabGroup"></a><span class="code-item" id=4449>TabGroup</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a group of tabs. A tab group itself consists of multiple tabs.</p>
</div>

#### Properties

<div class="comment"><p>The active <a href="#Tab">tab</a> in the group. This is the tab whose contents are currently
being rendered.</p>

groups can have an <a href="#TabGroup.activeTab">active tab</a>.</p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#Tab.isActive">Tab.isActive</a></p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TaskDefinition"></a><span class="code-item" id=2037>TaskDefinition</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A structure that defines a task kind in the system.
The value must be JSON-stringifyable.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TaskDefinition.type"></a><span class="ts" id=2038 data-target="#details-2038" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">type</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2038">
<div class="comment"><p>The task definition describing the task provided by an extension.
Usually a task provider defines more properties to identify
a task. They need to be defined in the package.json of the
extension under the &#39;taskDefinitions&#39; extension point. The npm
task definition for example looks like this</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">interface</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">NpmTaskDefinition</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">extends</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">TaskDefinition</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">script</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">string</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Note that type identifier starting with a &#39;$&#39; are reserved for internal
usages and shouldn&#39;t be used by extensions.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods

</div></td></tr>

</div></td></tr>
</table>

<a name="TaskProvider.resolveTask"></a><span class="ts" id=2138 data-target="#details-2138" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveTask</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">task</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2138">
<div class="comment"><p>Resolves a task that has no <a href="#Task.execution">execution</a> set. Tasks are
often created from information found in the <code>tasks.json</code>-file. Such tasks miss
the information on how to execute them and a task provider must fill in
the missing information in the <code>resolveTask</code>-method. This method will not be
called for tasks returned from the above <code>provideTasks</code> method since those
tasks are always fully resolved. A valid default implementation for the
<code>resolveTask</code> method is to return <code>undefined</code>.</p>
<p>Note that when filling in the properties of <code>task</code>, you <em>must</em> be sure to
use the exact same <code>TaskDefinition</code> and not create a new one. Other properties
may be changed.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=2140 data-target="#details-2140" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>
</div></td></tr>

<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The resolved task</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TelemetryLogger"></a><span class="code-item" id=4473>TelemetryLogger</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A telemetry logger which can be used by extensions to log usage and error telementry.</p>
<p>A logger wraps around an <a href="#TelemetrySender">sender</a> but it guarantees that</p>
<ul>
<li>user settings to disable or tweak telemetry are respected, and that</li>
<li>potential sensitive data is removed</li>
</ul>
<p>It also enables an &quot;echo UI&quot; that prints whatever data is send and it allows the editor
to forward unhandled errors to the respective extensions.</p>
<p>To get an instance of a <code>TelemetryLogger</code>, use
<a href="#env.createTelemetryLogger"><code>createTelemetryLogger</code></a>.</p>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-4474">
<div class="comment"><p>An <a href="#Event">Event</a> which fires when the enablement state of usage or error telemetry changes.</p>
</div>
</div>

</div>

<a name="TelemetryLoggerOptions.additionalCommonProperties"></a><span class="ts" id=4504 data-target="#details-4504" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">additionalCommonProperties</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Record</span>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;</span>

<div class="comment"><p>Any additional common properties which should be injected into the data object.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TelemetryLoggerOptions.ignoreBuiltInCommonProperties"></a><span class="ts" id=4502 data-target="#details-4502" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">ignoreBuiltInCommonProperties</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>

</div>



<a name="TelemetryLoggerOptions.ignoreUnhandledErrors"></a><span class="ts" id=4503 data-target="#details-4503" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">ignoreUnhandledErrors</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>

</div>

### <a name="TelemetrySender"></a><span class="code-item" id=4490>TelemetrySender</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The telemetry sender is the contract between a telemetry logger and some telemetry service. <strong>Note</strong> that extensions must NOT
call the methods of their sender directly as the logger provides extra guards and cleaning.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">sender</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #4EC9B0">TelemetrySender</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">...</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">};</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">logger</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">env</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">createTelemetryLogger</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">sender</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// GOOD - uses the logger</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">logger</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">logUsage</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;myEvent&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">myData:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;myValue&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// BAD - uses the sender directly: no data cleansing, ignores user settings, no echoing to the telemetry output channel etc</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">sender</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">logEvent</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;myEvent&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">myData:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;myValue&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span></code></pre>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="Terminal.creationOptions"></a><span class="ts" id=1860 data-target="#details-1860" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">creationOptions</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">Readonly</span>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalOptions">TerminalOptions</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#ExtensionTerminalOptions">ExtensionTerminalOptions</a>&gt;</span>

<a name="Terminal.exitStatus"></a><span class="ts" id=1861 data-target="#details-1861" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">exitStatus</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalExitStatus">TerminalExitStatus</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1861">
<div class="comment"><p>The exit status of the terminal, this will be undefined while the terminal is active.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Show a notification with the exit code when the terminal exits with a
non-zero exit code.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onDidCloseTerminal</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">t</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #C586C0">if</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> (</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">t</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">exitStatus</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">&amp;&amp;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">t</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">exitStatus</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">code</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">) {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">window</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">showInformationMessage</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">`Exit code: </span><span style="color: #569CD6">${</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">t</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">exitStatus</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">code</span><span style="color: #569CD6">}</span><span style="color: #CE9178">`</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>

The <code>terminal.ansi*</code> theme keys are
recommended for the best contrast and consistency across themes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.cwd"></a><span class="ts" id=2929 data-target="#details-2929" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cwd</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2929">
<div class="comment"><p>A path or Uri for the current working directory to be used for the terminal.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.env"></a><span class="ts" id=2930 data-target="#details-2930" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">env</span><span>?</span><span>: </span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2930">
<div class="comment"><p>Object with environment variables that will be added to the editor process.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.hideFromUser"></a><span class="ts" id=2935 data-target="#details-2935" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">hideFromUser</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2935">
<div class="comment"><p>When enabled the terminal will run the process as normal but not be surfaced to the user
until <code>Terminal.show</code> is called. The typical usage for this is when you need to run
something that may need interactivity but only want to tell the user about it when
interaction is needed. Note that the terminals will still be exposed to all extensions
as normal and they will remain hidden when the workspace is reloaded.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.iconPath"></a><span class="ts" id=2937 data-target="#details-2937" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">iconPath</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> &#124; {dark: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, light: <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2937">
<div class="comment"><p>The icon path or <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> for the terminal.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.isTransient"></a><span class="ts" id=2943 data-target="#details-2943" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isTransient</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2943">
<div class="comment"><p>Opt-out of the default terminal persistence on restart and reload.
This will only take effect when <code>terminal.integrated.enablePersistentSessions</code> is enabled.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.location"></a><span class="ts" id=2942 data-target="#details-2942" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">location</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalEditorLocationOptions">TerminalEditorLocationOptions</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalSplitLocationOptions">TerminalSplitLocationOptions</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#TerminalLocation">TerminalLocation</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2942">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#TerminalLocation">TerminalLocation</a> or <a href="#TerminalEditorLocationOptions">TerminalEditorLocationOptions</a> or <a href="#TerminalSplitLocationOptions">TerminalSplitLocationOptions</a> for the terminal.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.message"></a><span class="ts" id=2936 data-target="#details-2936" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">message</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2936">
<div class="comment"><p>A message to write to the terminal on first launch, note that this is not sent to the
process but, rather written directly to the terminal. This supports escape sequences such
a setting text style.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.name"></a><span class="ts" id=2926 data-target="#details-2926" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">name</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2926">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which will be used to represent the terminal in the UI.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.shellArgs"></a><span class="ts" id=2928 data-target="#details-2928" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">shellArgs</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2928">
<div class="comment"><p>Args for the custom shell executable. A string can be used on Windows only which allows
specifying shell args in <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-au/08dfcab2-eb6e-49a4-80eb-87d4076c98c6">command-line format</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.shellPath"></a><span class="ts" id=2927 data-target="#details-2927" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">shellPath</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2927">
<div class="comment"><p>A path to a custom shell executable to be used in the terminal.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TerminalOptions.strictEnv"></a><span class="ts" id=2934 data-target="#details-2934" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">strictEnv</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2934">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the terminal process environment should be exactly as provided in
<code>TerminalOptions.env</code>. When this is false (default), the environment will be based on the
window&#39;s environment and also apply configured platform settings like
<code>terminal.integrated.env.windows</code> on top. When this is true, the complete environment
must be provided as nothing will be inherited from the process or any configuration.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TerminalState"></a><span class="code-item" id=1882>TerminalState</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents the state of a <a href="#Terminal">Terminal</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TerminalState.isInteractedWith"></a><span class="ts" id=1883 data-target="#details-1883" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isInteractedWith</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1883">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the <a href="#Terminal">Terminal</a> has been interacted with. Interaction means that the
terminal has sent data to the process which depending on the terminal&#39;s <em>mode</em>. By
default input is sent when a key is pressed or when a command or extension sends text,
but based on the terminal&#39;s mode it can also happen on:</p>
<ul>
<li>a pointer click event</li>
<li>a pointer scroll event</li>
<li>a pointer move event</li>
<li>terminal focus in/out</li>
</ul>
<p>For more information on events that can send data see &quot;DEC Private Mode Set (DECSET)&quot; on
<a href="https://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html">https://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html</a></p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TestController"></a><span class="code-item" id=4257>TestController</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Entry point to discover and execute tests. It contains <a href="#TestController.items">TestController.items</a> which
are used to populate the editor UI, and is associated with
<a href="#TestController.createRunProfile">run profiles</a> to allow
for tests to be executed.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TestController.id"></a><span class="ts" id=4258 data-target="#details-4258" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">id</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4258">
<div class="comment"><p>The id of the controller passed in <a href="#tests.createTestController">tests.createTestController</a>.
This must be globally unique.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestController.items"></a><span class="ts" id=4260 data-target="#details-4260" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">items</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestItemCollection">TestItemCollection</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4260">
<div class="comment"><p>A collection of &quot;top-level&quot; <a href="#TestItem">TestItem</a> instances, which can in
turn have their own <a href="#TestItem.children">children</a> to form the
&quot;test tree.&quot;</p>
<p>The extension controls when to add tests. For example, extensions should
add tests for a file when <a href="#workspace.onDidOpenTextDocument">workspace.onDidOpenTextDocument</a>
fires in order for decorations for tests within a file to be visible.</p>
<p>However, the editor may sometimes explicitly request children using the
<a href="#TestController.resolveHandler">resolveHandler</a> See the documentation on that method for more details.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestController.label"></a><span class="ts" id=4259 data-target="#details-4259" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4259">
<div class="comment"><p>Human-readable label for the test controller.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestController.refreshHandler"></a><span class="ts" id=4277 data-target="#details-4277" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">refreshHandler</span><span>: </span>(token: <a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a>) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4277">
<div class="comment"><p>If this method is present, a refresh button will be present in the
UI, and this method will be invoked when it&#39;s clicked. When called,
the extension should scan the workspace for any new, changed, or
removed tests.</p>
<p>It&#39;s recommended that extensions try to update tests in realtime, using
a <a href="#FileSystemWatcher">FileSystemWatcher</a> for example, and use this method as a fallback.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature variable-declaration-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

<a name="TestController.resolveHandler"></a><span class="ts" id=4273 data-target="#details-4273" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveHandler</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>(item: <a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a>) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4273">
<div class="comment"><p>A function provided by the extension that the editor may call to request
children of a test item, if the <a href="#TestItem.canResolveChildren">TestItem.canResolveChildren</a> is
<code>true</code>. When called, the item should discover children and call
<a href="#TestController.createTestItem">TestController.createTestItem</a> as children are discovered.</p>
<p>Generally the extension manages the lifecycle of test items, but under
certain conditions the editor may request the children of a specific
item to be loaded. For example, if the user requests to re-run tests
after reloading the editor, the editor may need to call this method
to resolve the previously-run tests.</p>
<p>The item in the explorer will automatically be marked as &quot;busy&quot; until
the function returns or the returned thenable resolves.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature variable-declaration-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

requested, or <code>undefined</code> to resolve the controller&#39;s initial <a href="#TestController.items">items</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<a name="TestController.createTestRun"></a><span class="ts" id=4282 data-target="#details-4282" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">createTestRun</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">request</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRunRequest">TestRunRequest</a>, <span class="ident">name</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">persist</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRun">TestRun</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4282">
<div class="comment"><p>Creates a <a href="#TestRun">TestRun</a>. This should be called by the
<a href="#TestRunProfile">TestRunProfile</a> when a request is made to execute tests, and may
also be called if a test run is detected externally. Once created, tests
that are included in the request will be moved into the queued state.</p>
<p>All runs created using the same <code>request</code> instance will be grouped
together. This is useful if, for example, a single suite of tests is
run on multiple platforms.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">

Only tests inside the <code>include</code> may be
modified, and tests in its <code>exclude</code> are ignored.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="name"></a><span class="ts" id=4284 data-target="#details-4284" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">name</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The human-readable name of the run. This can be used to
disambiguate multiple sets of results in a test run. It is useful if
tests are run across multiple platforms, for example.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="persist"></a><span class="ts" id=4285 data-target="#details-4285" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">persist</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Whether the results created by the run should be
persisted in the editor. This may be false if the results are coming from
a file already saved externally, such as a coverage information file.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRun">TestRun</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An instance of the <a href="#TestRun">TestRun</a>. It will be considered &quot;running&quot;
from the moment this method is invoked until <a href="#TestRun.end">TestRun.end</a> is called.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>

<a name="TestController.invalidateTestResults"></a><span class="ts" id=4292 data-target="#details-4292" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">invalidateTestResults</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">items</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a> &#124; readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4292">
<div class="comment"><p>Marks an item&#39;s results as being outdated. This is commonly called when
code or configuration changes and previous results should no longer
be considered relevant. The same logic used to mark results as outdated
may be used to drive <a href="#TestRunRequest.continuous">continuous test runs</a>.</p>
<p>If an item is passed to this method, test results for the item and all of
its children will be marked as outdated. If no item is passed, then all
test owned by the TestController will be marked as outdated.</p>
<p>Any test runs started before the moment this method is called, including
runs which may still be ongoing, will be marked as outdated and deprioritized
in the editor&#39;s UI.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TestItem"></a><span class="code-item" id=4363>TestItem</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An item shown in the &quot;test explorer&quot; view.</p>
<p>A <code>TestItem</code> can represent either a test suite or a test itself, since
they both have similar capabilities.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TestItem.busy"></a><span class="ts" id=4370 data-target="#details-4370" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">busy</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4370">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether the item is shown as &quot;busy&quot; in the Test Explorer view.
This is useful for showing status while discovering children.</p>
<p>Defaults to <code>false</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.canResolveChildren"></a><span class="ts" id=4369 data-target="#details-4369" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">canResolveChildren</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4369">
<div class="comment"><p>Indicates whether this test item may have children discovered by resolving.</p>
<p>If true, this item is shown as expandable in the Test Explorer view and
expanding the item will cause <a href="#TestController.resolveHandler">TestController.resolveHandler</a>
to be invoked with the item.</p>
<p>Default to <code>false</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.children"></a><span class="ts" id=4366 data-target="#details-4366" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">children</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestItemCollection">TestItemCollection</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4366">
<div class="comment"><p>The children of this test item. For a test suite, this may contain the
individual test cases or nested suites.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.description"></a><span class="ts" id=4372 data-target="#details-4372" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">description</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4372">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional description that appears next to the label.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.error"></a><span class="ts" id=4375 data-target="#details-4375" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">error</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#MarkdownString">MarkdownString</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4375">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional error encountered while loading the test.</p>
<p>Note that this is not a test result and should only be used to represent errors in
test discovery, such as syntax errors.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.id"></a><span class="ts" id=4364 data-target="#details-4364" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">id</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4364">
<div class="comment"><p>Identifier for the <code>TestItem</code>. This is used to correlate
test results and tests in the document with those in the workspace
(test explorer). This cannot change for the lifetime of the <code>TestItem</code>,
and must be unique among its parent&#39;s direct children.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.label"></a><span class="ts" id=4371 data-target="#details-4371" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4371">
<div class="comment"><p>Display name describing the test case.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.parent"></a><span class="ts" id=4367 data-target="#details-4367" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">parent</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4367">
<div class="comment"><p>The parent of this item. It&#39;s set automatically, and is undefined
top-level items in the <a href="#TestController.items">TestController.items</a> and for items that
aren&#39;t yet included in another item&#39;s <a href="#TestItem.children">children</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.range"></a><span class="ts" id=4374 data-target="#details-4374" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">range</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4374">
<div class="comment"><p>Location of the test item in its <a href="#TestItem.uri">uri</a>.</p>
<p>This is only meaningful if the <code>uri</code> points to a file.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.sortText"></a><span class="ts" id=4373 data-target="#details-4373" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">sortText</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4373">
<div class="comment"><p>A string that should be used when comparing this item
with other items. When <code>falsy</code> the <a href="#TestItem.label">label</a>
is used.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.tags"></a><span class="ts" id=4368 data-target="#details-4368" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">tags</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TestTag">TestTag</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4368">
<div class="comment"><p>Tags associated with this test item. May be used in combination with
<a href="#TestRunProfile.tag">tags</a>, or simply as an organizational feature.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestItem.uri"></a><span class="ts" id=4365 data-target="#details-4365" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4365">
<div class="comment"><p>URI this <code>TestItem</code> is associated with. May be a file or directory.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TestItemCollection"></a><span class="code-item" id=4341>TestItemCollection</span>

<a name="TestMessage.actualOutput"></a><span class="ts" id=4387 data-target="#details-4387" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">actualOutput</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>

<a name="TestMessage.contextValue"></a><span class="ts" id=4389 data-target="#details-4389" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">contextValue</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4389">
<div class="comment"><p>Context value of the test item. This can be used to contribute message-
specific actions to the test peek view. The value set here can be found
in the <code>testMessage</code> property of the following <code>menus</code> contribution points:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>testing/message/context</code> - context menu for the message in the results tree</li>
<li><code>testing/message/content</code> - a prominent button overlaying editor content where
 the message is displayed.</li>
</ul>
<p>For example:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;menus&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;testing/message/content&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.deleteCommentThread&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;when&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;testMessage == canApplyRichDiff&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span></code></pre>
<p>The command will be called with an object containing:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>test</code>: the <a href="#TestItem">TestItem</a> the message is associated with, <em>if</em> it
 is still present in the <a href="#TestController.items">TestController.items</a> collection.</li>
<li><code>message</code>: the <a href="#TestMessage">TestMessage</a> instance.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TestRun"></a><span class="code-item" id=4307>TestRun</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A TestRun represents an in-progress or completed test run and
provides methods to report the state of individual tests in the run.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TestRun.isPersisted"></a><span class="ts" id=4310 data-target="#details-4310" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isPersisted</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4310">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the test run will be persisted across reloads by the editor.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRun.name"></a><span class="ts" id=4308 data-target="#details-4308" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">name</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4308">
<div class="comment"><p>The human-readable name of the run. This can be used to
disambiguate multiple sets of results in a test run. It is useful if
tests are run across multiple platforms, for example.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRun.token"></a><span class="ts" id=4309 data-target="#details-4309" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4309">
<div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token which will be triggered when the test run is
canceled from the UI.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TestRun.appendOutput"></a><span class="ts" id=4335 data-target="#details-4335" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">appendOutput</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">output</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">location</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Location">Location</a>, <span class="ident">test</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4335">
<div class="comment"><p>Appends raw output from the test runner. On the user&#39;s request, the
output will be displayed in a terminal. ANSI escape sequences,
such as colors and text styles, are supported. New lines must be given
as CRLF (<code>\r\n</code>) rather than LF (<code>\n</code>).</p>
</div>

location.</p>

<div class="comment"><p>If this method is present, a configuration gear will be present in the
UI, and this method will be invoked when it&#39;s clicked. When called,
you can take other editor actions, such as showing a quick pick or
opening a configuration file.</p>
</div>

<a name="TestRunProfile.isDefault"></a><span class="ts" id=4243 data-target="#details-4243" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isDefault</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4243">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether this profile is the default action that will
be taken when its kind is actioned. For example, if the user clicks
the generic &quot;run all&quot; button, then the default profile for
<a href="#TestRunProfileKind.Run">TestRunProfileKind.Run</a> will be executed, although the
user can configure this.</p>
<p>Changes the user makes in their default profiles will be reflected
in this property after a <a href="#TestRunProfile.onDidChangeDefault">onDidChangeDefault</a> event.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunProfile.kind"></a><span class="ts" id=4242 data-target="#details-4242" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">kind</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRunProfileKind">TestRunProfileKind</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4242">
<div class="comment"><p>Configures what kind of execution this profile controls. If there
are no profiles for a kind, it will not be available in the UI.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunProfile.label"></a><span class="ts" id=4241 data-target="#details-4241" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4241">
<div class="comment"><p>Label shown to the user in the UI.</p>
<p>Note that the label has some significance if the user requests that
tests be re-run in a certain way. For example, if tests were run
normally and the user requests to re-run them in debug mode, the editor
will attempt use a configuration with the same label of the <code>Debug</code>
kind. If there is no such configuration, the default will be used.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunProfile.runHandler"></a><span class="ts" id=4250 data-target="#details-4250" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">runHandler</span><span>: </span>(request: <a class="type-ref" href="#TestRunRequest">TestRunRequest</a>, token: <a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a>) =&gt; <span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4250">
<div class="comment"><p>Handler called to start a test run. When invoked, the function should call
<a href="#TestController.createTestRun">TestController.createTestRun</a> at least once, and all test runs
associated with the request should be created before the function returns
or the returned promise is resolved.</p>
<p>If <a href="#TestRunProfile.supportsContinuousRun">supportsContinuousRun</a> is set, then <a href="#TestRunRequest.continuous">TestRunRequest.continuous</a>
may be <code>true</code>. In this case, the profile should observe changes to
source code and create new test runs by calling <a href="#TestController.createTestRun">TestController.createTestRun</a>,
until the cancellation is requested on the <code>token</code>.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature variable-declaration-signature">

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=4254 data-target="#details-4254" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>

</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunProfile.supportsContinuousRun"></a><span class="ts" id=4245 data-target="#details-4245" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">supportsContinuousRun</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4245">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether this profile supports continuous running of requests. If so,
then <a href="#TestRunRequest.continuous">TestRunRequest.continuous</a> may be set to <code>true</code>. Defaults
to false.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunProfile.tag"></a><span class="ts" id=4246 data-target="#details-4246" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">tag</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestTag">TestTag</a></span>

</div>

### <a name="TestRunRequest"></a><span class="code-item" id=4296>TestRunRequest</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A TestRunRequest is a precursor to a <a href="#TestRun">TestRun</a>, which in turn is
created by passing a request to <a href="#TestController.createTestRun">TestController.createTestRun</a>. The
TestRunRequest contains information about which tests should be run, which
should not be run, and how they are run (via the <a href="#TestRunRequest.profile">profile</a>).</p>
<p>In general, TestRunRequests are created by the editor and pass to
<a href="#TestRunProfile.runHandler">TestRunProfile.runHandler</a>, however you can also create test
requests and runs outside of the <code>runHandler</code>.</p>
</div>

#### Constructors

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="exclude"></a><span class="ts" id=4300 data-target="#details-4300" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">exclude</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An array of tests to exclude from the run.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="profile"></a><span class="ts" id=4301 data-target="#details-4301" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">profile</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRunProfile">TestRunProfile</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The run profile used for this request.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="continuous"></a><span class="ts" id=4302 data-target="#details-4302" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">continuous</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Whether to run tests continuously as source changes.</p>
</div></td></tr>

</table>
</div>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TestRunRequest.continuous"></a><span class="ts" id=4306 data-target="#details-4306" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">continuous</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4306">
<div class="comment"><p>Whether the profile should run continuously as source code changes. Only
relevant for profiles that set <a href="#TestRunProfile.supportsContinuousRun">TestRunProfile.supportsContinuousRun</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunRequest.exclude"></a><span class="ts" id=4304 data-target="#details-4304" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">exclude</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4304">
<div class="comment"><p>An array of tests the user has marked as excluded from the test included
in this run; exclusions should apply after inclusions.</p>
<p>May be omitted if no exclusions were requested. Test controllers should
not run excluded tests or any children of excluded tests.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunRequest.include"></a><span class="ts" id=4303 data-target="#details-4303" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">include</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TestItem">TestItem</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4303">
<div class="comment"><p>A filter for specific tests to run. If given, the extension should run
all of the included tests and all their children, excluding any tests
that appear in <a href="#TestRunRequest.exclude">TestRunRequest.exclude</a>. If this property is
undefined, then the extension should simply run all tests.</p>
<p>The process of running tests should resolve the children of any test
items who have not yet been resolved.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TestRunRequest.profile"></a><span class="ts" id=4305 data-target="#details-4305" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">profile</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TestRunProfile">TestRunProfile</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-4305">
<div class="comment"><p>The profile used for this request. This will always be defined
for requests issued from the editor UI, though extensions may
programmatically create requests not associated with any profile.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TestTag"></a><span class="code-item" id=4235>TestTag</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Tags can be associated with <a href="#TestItem">TestItems</a> and
<a href="#TestRunProfile">TestRunProfiles</a>. A profile with a tag can only
execute tests that include that tag in their <a href="#TestItem.tags">TestItem.tags</a> array.</p>
</div>

### <a name="TextDocument"></a><span class="code-item" id=15>TextDocument</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a text document, such as a source file. Text documents have
<a href="#TextLine">lines</a> and knowledge about an underlying resource like a file.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TextDocument.eol"></a><span class="ts" id=25 data-target="#details-25" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">eol</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#EndOfLine">EndOfLine</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-25">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#EndOfLine">end of line</a> sequence that is predominately
used in this document.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.fileName"></a><span class="ts" id=17 data-target="#details-17" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">fileName</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-17">
<div class="comment"><p>The file system path of the associated resource. Shorthand
notation for <a href="#TextDocument.uri">TextDocument.uri.fsPath</a>. Independent of the uri scheme.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.isClosed"></a><span class="ts" id=22 data-target="#details-22" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isClosed</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-22">
<div class="comment"><p><code>true</code> if the document has been closed. A closed document isn&#39;t synchronized anymore
and won&#39;t be re-used when the same resource is opened again.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.isDirty"></a><span class="ts" id=21 data-target="#details-21" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isDirty</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-21">
<div class="comment"><p><code>true</code> if there are unpersisted changes.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.isUntitled"></a><span class="ts" id=18 data-target="#details-18" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">isUntitled</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-18">
<div class="comment"><p>Is this document representing an untitled file which has never been saved yet. <em>Note</em> that
this does not mean the document will be saved to disk, use <a href="#Uri.scheme">Uri.scheme</a>
to figure out where a document will be <a href="#FileSystemProvider">saved</a>, e.g. <code>file</code>, <code>ftp</code> etc.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.languageId"></a><span class="ts" id=19 data-target="#details-19" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">languageId</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-19">
<div class="comment"><p>The identifier of the language associated with this document.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.lineCount"></a><span class="ts" id=26 data-target="#details-26" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">lineCount</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-26">
<div class="comment"><p>The number of lines in this document.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.uri"></a><span class="ts" id=16 data-target="#details-16" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-16">
<div class="comment"><p>The associated uri for this document.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that most documents use the <code>file</code>-scheme, which means they are files on disk. However, <strong>not</strong> all documents are
saved on disk and therefore the <code>scheme</code> must be checked before trying to access the underlying file or siblings on disk.</p>
<p><em>See also</em></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#FileSystemProvider">FileSystemProvider</a></li>
<li><a href="#TextDocumentContentProvider">TextDocumentContentProvider</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.version"></a><span class="ts" id=20 data-target="#details-20" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">version</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-20">
<div class="comment"><p>The version number of this document (it will strictly increase after each
change, including undo/redo).</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TextDocument.getText"></a><span class="ts" id=39 data-target="#details-39" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">getText</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">range</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-39">
<div class="comment"><p>Get the text of this document. A substring can be retrieved by providing
a range. The range will be <a href="#TextDocument.validateRange">adjusted</a>.</p>
</div>

<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="range"></a><span class="ts" id=40 data-target="#details-40" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">range</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Include only the text included by the range.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The text inside the provided range or the entire text.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.getWordRangeAtPosition"></a><span class="ts" id=42 data-target="#details-42" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">getWordRangeAtPosition</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">regex</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-42">
<div class="comment"><p>Get a word-range at the given position. By default words are defined by
common separators, like space, -, _, etc. In addition, per language custom
[word definitions] can be defined. It
is also possible to provide a custom regular expression.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Note 1:</em> A custom regular expression must not match the empty string and
if it does, it will be ignored.</li>
<li><em>Note 2:</em> A custom regular expression will fail to match multiline strings
and in the name of speed regular expressions should not match words with
spaces. Use <a href="#TextLine.text">TextLine.text</a> for more complex, non-wordy, scenarios.</li>
</ul>
<p>The position will be <a href="#TextDocument.validatePosition">adjusted</a>.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="regex"></a><span class="ts" id=44 data-target="#details-44" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">regex</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-ref-ts">RegExp</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Optional regular expression that describes what a word is.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A range spanning a word, or <code>undefined</code>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocument.lineAt"></a><span class="ts" id=28 data-target="#details-28" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">lineAt</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">line</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">number</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextLine">TextLine</a></span>

<div class="comment"><p>Returns a text line denoted by the line number. Note

<div class="signature callable-signature">

<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>

<a name="TextDocument.lineAt"></a><span class="ts" id=30 data-target="#details-30" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">lineAt</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextLine">TextLine</a></span>

<div class="comment"><p>Returns a text line denoted by the position. Note
that the returned object is <em>not</em> live and changes to the

### <a name="TextDocumentContentProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=490>TextDocumentContentProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A text document content provider allows to add readonly documents
to the editor, such as source from a dll or generated html from md.</p>
<p>Content providers are <a href="#workspace.registerTextDocumentContentProvider">registered</a>
for a <a href="#Uri.scheme">uri-scheme</a>. When a uri with that scheme is to
be <a href="#workspace.openTextDocument">loaded</a> the content provider is
asked.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="TextDocumentContentProvider.onDidChange"></a><span class="ts" id=491 data-target="#details-491" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChange</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-491">
<div class="comment"><p>An event to signal a resource has changed.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TextDocumentContentProvider.provideTextDocumentContent"></a><span class="ts" id=493 data-target="#details-493" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideTextDocumentContent</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">uri</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-493">
<div class="comment"><p>Provide textual content for a given uri.</p>
<p>The editor will use the returned string-content to create a readonly
<a href="#TextDocument">document</a>. Resources allocated should be released when
the corresponding document has been <a href="#workspace.onDidCloseTextDocument">closed</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: The contents of the created <a href="#TextDocument">document</a> might not be
identical to the provided text due to end-of-line-sequence normalization.</p>
</div>

</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=495 data-target="#details-495" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token.</p>

</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TextDocumentShowOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=221>TextDocumentShowOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents options to configure the behavior of showing a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a> in an <a href="#TextEditor">editor</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TextDocumentShowOptions.preserveFocus"></a><span class="ts" id=223 data-target="#details-223" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">preserveFocus</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-223">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional flag that when <code>true</code> will stop the <a href="#TextEditor">editor</a> from taking focus.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocumentShowOptions.preview"></a><span class="ts" id=224 data-target="#details-224" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">preview</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-224">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional flag that controls if an <a href="#TextEditor">editor</a>-tab shows as preview. Preview tabs will
be replaced and reused until set to stay - either explicitly or through editing.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that the flag is ignored if a user has disabled preview editors in settings.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocumentShowOptions.selection"></a><span class="ts" id=225 data-target="#details-225" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">selection</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Range">Range</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-225">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional selection to apply for the document in the <a href="#TextEditor">editor</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocumentShowOptions.viewColumn"></a><span class="ts" id=222 data-target="#details-222" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">viewColumn</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ViewColumn">ViewColumn</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-222">
<div class="comment"><p>An optional view column in which the <a href="#TextEditor">editor</a> should be shown.
The default is the <a href="#ViewColumn.Active">active</a>. Columns that do not exist
will be created as needed up to the maximum of <a href="#ViewColumn.Nine">ViewColumn.Nine</a>.
Use <a href="#ViewColumn.Beside">ViewColumn.Beside</a> to open the editor to the side of the currently
active one.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TextDocumentWillSaveEvent"></a><span class="code-item" id=3177>TextDocumentWillSaveEvent</span>



<div class="comment"><p>An event that is fired when a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a> will be saved.</p>
<p>To make modifications to the document before it is being saved, call the
<a href="#TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil">waitUntil</a>-function with a thenable
that resolves to an array of <a href="#TextEdit">text edits</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.document"></a><span class="ts" id=3178 data-target="#details-3178" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3178">
<div class="comment"><p>The document that will be saved.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.reason"></a><span class="ts" id=3179 data-target="#details-3179" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">reason</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocumentSaveReason">TextDocumentSaveReason</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3179">
<div class="comment"><p>The reason why save was triggered.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil"></a><span class="ts" id=3181 data-target="#details-3181" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">waitUntil</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TextEdit">TextEdit</a>[]&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3181">
<div class="comment"><p>Allows to pause the event loop and to apply <a href="#TextEdit">pre-save-edits</a>.
Edits of subsequent calls to this function will be applied in order. The
edits will be <em>ignored</em> if concurrent modifications of the document happened.</p>
<p><em>Note:</em> This function can only be called during event dispatch and not
in an asynchronous manner:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">onWillSaveTextDocument</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// async, will *throw* an error</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">setTimeout</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(() </span><span style="color: #569CD6">=&gt;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">));</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// sync, OK</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">event</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">waitUntil</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">promise</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">});</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="thenable"></a><span class="ts" id=3182 data-target="#details-3182" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#TextEdit">TextEdit</a>[]&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A thenable that resolves to <a href="#TextEdit">pre-save-edits</a>.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextDocumentWillSaveEvent.waitUntil"></a><span class="ts" id=3183 data-target="#details-3183" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">waitUntil</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;<span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-3183">
<div class="comment"><p>Allows to pause the event loop until the provided thenable resolved.</p>

<tr><td><a name="thenable"></a><span class="ts" id=3184 data-target="#details-3184" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">thenable</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A thenable that delays saving.</p>

<div class="comment"><p>Represents an editor that is attached to a <a href="#TextDocument">document</a>.</p>
</div>

<div class="details collapse" id="details-330">
