### <a name="TextEditorOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=196>TextEditorOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a <a href="#TextEditor">text editor</a>&#39;s <a href="#TextEditor.options">options</a>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TextEditorOptions.cursorStyle"></a><span class="ts" id=200 data-target="#details-200" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cursorStyle</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextEditorCursorStyle">TextEditorCursorStyle</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-200">
<div class="comment"><p>The rendering style of the cursor in this editor.
When getting a text editor&#39;s options, this property will always be present.
When setting a text editor&#39;s options, this property is optional.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextEditorOptions.indentSize"></a><span class="ts" id=198 data-target="#details-198" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">indentSize</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-198">
<div class="comment"><p>The number of spaces to insert when <a href="#TextEditorOptions.insertSpaces">insertSpaces</a> is true.</p>
<p>When getting a text editor&#39;s options, this property will always be a number (resolved).
When setting a text editor&#39;s options, this property is optional and it can be a number or <code>&quot;tabSize&quot;</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextEditorOptions.insertSpaces"></a><span class="ts" id=199 data-target="#details-199" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">insertSpaces</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-199">
<div class="comment"><p>When pressing Tab insert <a href="#TextEditorOptions.tabSize">n</a> spaces.
When getting a text editor&#39;s options, this property will always be a boolean (resolved).
When setting a text editor&#39;s options, this property is optional and it can be a boolean or <code>&quot;auto&quot;</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextEditorOptions.lineNumbers"></a><span class="ts" id=201 data-target="#details-201" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">lineNumbers</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextEditorLineNumbersStyle">TextEditorLineNumbersStyle</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-201">
<div class="comment"><p>Render relative line numbers w.r.t. the current line number.
When getting a text editor&#39;s options, this property will always be present.
When setting a text editor&#39;s options, this property is optional.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TextEditorOptions.tabSize"></a><span class="ts" id=197 data-target="#details-197" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">tabSize</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">number</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-197">
<div class="comment"><p>The size in spaces a tab takes. This is used for two purposes:</p>
<ul>
<li>the rendering width of a tab character;</li>
<li>the number of spaces to insert when <a href="#TextEditorOptions.insertSpaces">insertSpaces</a> is true
and <code>indentSize</code> is set to <code>&quot;tabSize&quot;</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p>When getting a text editor&#39;s options, this property will always be a number (resolved).
When setting a text editor&#39;s options, this property is optional and it can be a number or <code>&quot;auto&quot;</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TextLine"></a><span class="code-item" id=8>TextLine</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents a line of text, such as a line of source code.</p>

<div class="comment"><p>The offset of the first character which is not a whitespace character as defined

### <a name="ThemeIcon"></a><span class="code-item" id=241>ThemeIcon</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A reference to a named icon. Currently, <a href="#ThemeIcon.File">File</a>, <a href="#ThemeIcon.Folder">Folder</a>,
and <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/icons-in-labels#icon-listing">ThemeIcon ids</a> are supported.
Using a theme icon is preferred over a custom icon as it gives product theme authors the possibility to change the icons.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that theme icons can also be rendered inside labels and descriptions. Places that support theme icons spell this out
and they use the <code>$(&lt;name&gt;)</code>-syntax, for instance <code>quickPick.label = &quot;Hello World $(globe)&quot;</code>.</p>
</div>

#### Static

</div>
</div>

### <a name="TreeDataProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=2872>TreeDataProvider&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A data provider that provides tree data</p>
</div>

#### Events

<div class="comment"><p>An optional event to signal that an element or root has changed.
This will trigger the view to update the changed element/root and its children recursively (if shown).

</div>
</div>

<a name="TreeDataProvider.resolveTreeItem"></a><span class="ts" id=2884 data-target="#details-2884" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resolveTreeItem</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">item</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TreeItem">TreeItem</a>, <span class="ident">element</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TreeItem">TreeItem</a>&gt;</span>

<div class="comment"><p>Called on hover to resolve the <a href="#TreeItem.tooltip">TreeItem</a> property if it is undefined.
Called on tree item click/open to resolve the <a href="#TreeItem.command">TreeItem</a> property if it is undefined.
Only properties that were undefined can be resolved in <code>resolveTreeItem</code>.
Functionality may be expanded later to include being called to resolve other missing
properties on selection and/or on open.</p>
<p>Will only ever be called once per TreeItem.</p>
<p>onDidChangeTreeData should not be triggered from within resolveTreeItem.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that this function is called when tree items are already showing in the UI.
Because of that, no property that changes the presentation (label, description, etc.)
can be changed.</p>
</div>

### <a name="TreeDragAndDropController"></a><span class="code-item" id=2829>TreeDragAndDropController&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Provides support for drag and drop in <code>TreeView</code>.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="TreeDragAndDropController.dragMimeTypes"></a><span class="ts" id=2831 data-target="#details-2831" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">dragMimeTypes</span><span>: </span>readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2831">
<div class="comment"><p>The mime types that the <a href="#TreeDragAndDropController.handleDrag"><code>handleDrag</code></a> method of this <code>TreeDragAndDropController</code> may add to the tree data transfer.
This could be well-defined, existing, mime types, and also mime types defined by the extension.</p>
<p>The recommended mime type of the tree (<code>application/vnd.code.tree.&lt;treeidlowercase&gt;</code>) will be automatically added.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeDragAndDropController.dropMimeTypes"></a><span class="ts" id=2830 data-target="#details-2830" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">dropMimeTypes</span><span>: </span>readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2830">
<div class="comment"><p>The mime types that the <a href="#TreeDragAndDropController.handleDrop"><code>handleDrop</code></a> method of this <code>DragAndDropController</code> supports.
This could be well-defined, existing, mime types, and also mime types defined by the extension.</p>
<p>To support drops from trees, you will need to add the mime type of that tree.
This includes drops from within the same tree.
The mime type of a tree is recommended to be of the format <code>application/vnd.code.tree.&lt;treeidlowercase&gt;</code>.</p>
<p>Use the special <code>files</code> mime type to support all types of dropped files <a href="#DataTransferFile">files</a>, regardless of the file&#39;s actual mime type.</p>
<p>To learn the mime type of a dragged item:</p>
<ol>
<li>Set up your <code>DragAndDropController</code></li>
<li>Use the Developer: Set Log Level... command to set the level to &quot;Debug&quot;</li>
<li>Open the developer tools and drag the item with unknown mime type over your tree. The mime types will be logged to the developer console</li>
</ol>
<p>Note that mime types that cannot be sent to the extension will be omitted.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TreeDragAndDropController.handleDrag"></a><span class="ts" id=2833 data-target="#details-2833" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">handleDrag</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">source</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>[], <span class="ident">dataTransfer</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DataTransfer">DataTransfer</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2833">
<div class="comment"><p>When the user starts dragging items from this <code>DragAndDropController</code>, <code>handleDrag</code> will be called.
Extensions can use <code>handleDrag</code> to add their <a href="#DataTransferItem"><code>DataTransferItem</code></a> items to the drag and drop.</p>
<p>When the items are dropped on <strong>another tree item</strong> in <strong>the same tree</strong>, your <code>DataTransferItem</code> objects
will be preserved. Use the recommended mime type for the tree (<code>application/vnd.code.tree.&lt;treeidlowercase&gt;</code>) to add
tree objects in a data transfer. See the documentation for <code>DataTransferItem</code> for how best to take advantage of this.</p>
<p>To add a data transfer item that can be dragged into the editor, use the application specific mime type &quot;text/uri-list&quot;.
The data for &quot;text/uri-list&quot; should be a string with <code>toString()</code>ed Uris separated by <code>\r\n</code>. To specify a cursor position in the file,
set the Uri&#39;s fragment to <code>L3,5</code>, where 3 is the line number and 5 is the column number.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="source"></a><span class="ts" id=2834 data-target="#details-2834" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">source</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The source items for the drag and drop operation.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="dataTransfer"></a><span class="ts" id=2835 data-target="#details-2835" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">dataTransfer</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DataTransfer">DataTransfer</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>The data transfer associated with this drag.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="token"></a><span class="ts" id=2836 data-target="#details-2836" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A cancellation token indicating that drag has been cancelled.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"></div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeDragAndDropController.handleDrop"></a><span class="ts" id=2838 data-target="#details-2838" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">handleDrop</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">target</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">dataTransfer</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#DataTransfer">DataTransfer</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">void</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2838">

</div>

When undefined, the target is the root.</p>

<a name="TreeItem.accessibilityInformation"></a><span class="ts" id=2909 data-target="#details-2909" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">accessibilityInformation</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#AccessibilityInformation">AccessibilityInformation</a></span>

<a name="TreeItem.command"></a><span class="ts" id=2906 data-target="#details-2906" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">command</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Command">Command</a></span>

<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#Command">Command</a> that should be executed when the tree item is selected.</p>
<p>Please use <code>vscode.open</code> or <code>vscode.diff</code> as command IDs when the tree item is opening
something in the editor. Using these commands ensures that the resulting editor will
appear consistent with how other built-in trees open editors.</p>
</div>

<a name="TreeItem.contextValue"></a><span class="ts" id=2908 data-target="#details-2908" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">contextValue</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2908">
<div class="comment"><p>Context value of the tree item. This can be used to contribute item specific actions in the tree.
For example, a tree item is given a context value as <code>folder</code>. When contributing actions to <code>view/item/context</code>
using <code>menus</code> extension point, you can specify context value for key <code>viewItem</code> in <code>when</code> expression like <code>viewItem == folder</code>.</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;contributes&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;menus&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;view/item/context&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: [</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      {</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;command&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;extension.deleteFolder&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">        </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">&quot;when&quot;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">: </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;viewItem == folder&quot;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">      }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">    ]</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  }</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">}</span></span></code></pre>
<p>This will show action <code>extension.deleteFolder</code> only for items with <code>contextValue</code> is <code>folder</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeItem.description"></a><span class="ts" id=2903 data-target="#details-2903" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">description</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2903">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string which is rendered less prominent.
When <code>true</code>, it is derived from <a href="#TreeItem.resourceUri">resourceUri</a> and when <code>falsy</code>, it is not shown.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeItem.iconPath"></a><span class="ts" id=2899 data-target="#details-2899" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">iconPath</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> &#124; {dark: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, light: <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>}</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2899">
<div class="comment"><p>The icon path or <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> for the tree item.
When <code>falsy</code>, <a href="#ThemeIcon.Folder">Folder Theme Icon</a> is assigned, if item is collapsible otherwise <a href="#ThemeIcon.File">File Theme Icon</a>.
When a file or folder <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> is specified, icon is derived from the current file icon theme for the specified theme icon using <a href="#TreeItem.resourceUri">resourceUri</a> (if provided).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeItem.id"></a><span class="ts" id=2898 data-target="#details-2898" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">id</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2898">
<div class="comment"><p>Optional id for the tree item that has to be unique across tree. The id is used to preserve the selection and expansion state of the tree item.</p>
<p>If not provided, an id is generated using the tree item&#39;s label. <strong>Note</strong> that when labels change, ids will change and that selection and expansion state cannot be kept stable anymore.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeItem.label"></a><span class="ts" id=2897 data-target="#details-2897" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">label</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#TreeItemLabel">TreeItemLabel</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2897">
<div class="comment"><p>A human-readable string describing this item. When <code>falsy</code>, it is derived from <a href="#TreeItem.resourceUri">resourceUri</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeItem.resourceUri"></a><span class="ts" id=2904 data-target="#details-2904" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">resourceUri</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2904">
<div class="comment"><p>The <a href="#Uri">Uri</a> of the resource representing this item.</p>
<p>Will be used to derive the <a href="#TreeItem.label">label</a>, when it is not provided.
Will be used to derive the icon from current file icon theme, when <a href="#TreeItem.iconPath">iconPath</a> has <a href="#ThemeIcon">ThemeIcon</a> value.</p>
</div>
</div>

<a name="TreeView.reveal"></a><span class="ts" id=2862 data-target="#details-2862" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">reveal</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">element</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>, <span class="ident">options</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>{expand: <span class="type-intrinsic">number</span> &#124; <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, focus: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>, select: <span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>}<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2862">
<div class="comment"><p>Reveals the given element in the tree view.
If the tree view is not visible then the tree view is shown and element is revealed.</p>
<p>By default revealed element is selected.
In order to not to select, set the option <code>select</code> to <code>false</code>.
In order to focus, set the option <code>focus</code> to <code>true</code>.
In order to expand the revealed element, set the option <code>expand</code> to <code>true</code>. To expand recursively set <code>expand</code> to the number of levels to expand.</p>
<ul>
<li><em>NOTE:</em> You can expand only to 3 levels maximum.</li>
<li><em>NOTE:</em> The <a href="#TreeDataProvider">TreeDataProvider</a> that the <code>TreeView</code> <a href="#window.createTreeView">is registered with</a> with must implement <a href="#TreeDataProvider.getParent">getParent</a> method to access this API.</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="comment"><p>Whether the tree supports multi-select. When the tree supports multi-select and a command is executed from the tree,
the first argument to the command is the tree item that the command was executed on and the second argument is an
array containing all selected tree items.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="TreeViewOptions.dragAndDropController"></a><span class="ts" id=2783 data-target="#details-2783" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">dragAndDropController</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TreeDragAndDropController">TreeDragAndDropController</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a>&gt;</span>

<a name="TreeViewOptions.manageCheckboxStateManually"></a><span class="ts" id=2784 data-target="#details-2784" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">manageCheckboxStateManually</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2784">
<div class="comment"><p>By default, when the children of a tree item have already been fetched, child checkboxes are automatically managed based on the checked state of the parent tree item.
If the tree item is collapsed by default (meaning that the children haven&#39;t yet been fetched) then child checkboxes will not be updated.
To override this behavior and manage child and parent checkbox state in the extension, set this to <code>true</code>.</p>
<p>Examples where <a href="#TreeViewOptions.manageCheckboxStateManually">TreeViewOptions.manageCheckboxStateManually</a> is false, the default behavior:</p>
<ol>
<li><p>A tree item is checked, then its children are fetched. The children will be checked.</p>
</li>
<li><p>A tree item&#39;s parent is checked. The tree item and all of it&#39;s siblings will be checked.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2
When the user checks Parent, the tree will look like this:</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<ol start="3">
<li>A tree item and all of it&#39;s siblings are checked. The parent will be checked.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2
When the user checks Child 1 and Child 2, the tree will look like this:</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<ol start="4">
<li>A tree item is unchecked. The parent will be unchecked.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2
When the user unchecks Child 1, the tree will look like this:</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Parent<ul>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 1</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Child 2</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="TypeHierarchyProvider"></a><span class="code-item" id=1524>TypeHierarchyProvider</span>



<div class="comment"><p>The type hierarchy provider interface describes the contract between extensions
and the type hierarchy feature.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="TypeHierarchyProvider.prepareTypeHierarchy"></a><span class="ts" id=1526 data-target="#details-1526" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">prepareTypeHierarchy</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">document</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TextDocument">TextDocument</a>, <span class="ident">position</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Position">Position</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TypeHierarchyItem">TypeHierarchyItem</a> &#124; <a class="type-ref" href="#TypeHierarchyItem">TypeHierarchyItem</a>[]&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-1526">
<div class="comment"><p>Bootstraps type hierarchy by returning the item that is denoted by the given document
and position. This item will be used as entry into the type graph. Providers should
return <code>undefined</code> or <code>null</code> when there is no item at the given location.</p>
</div>

<a name="TypeHierarchyProvider.provideTypeHierarchySubtypes"></a><span class="ts" id=1535 data-target="#details-1535" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">provideTypeHierarchySubtypes</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">item</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#TypeHierarchyItem">TypeHierarchyItem</a>, <span class="ident">token</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#CancellationToken">CancellationToken</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#ProviderResult">ProviderResult</a>&lt;<a class="type-ref" href="#TypeHierarchyItem">TypeHierarchyItem</a>[]&gt;</span>

### <a name="Uri"></a><span class="code-item" id=384>Uri</span>



<div class="comment"><p>A universal resource identifier representing either a file on disk
or another resource, like untitled resources.</p>
</div>

#### Static



<a name="Uri.file"></a><span class="ts" id=390 data-target="#details-390" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">file</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">path</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-390">
<div class="comment"><p>Create an URI from a file system path. The <a href="#Uri.scheme">scheme</a>
will be <code>file</code>.</p>
<p>The <em>difference</em> between <a href="#Uri.parse">Uri.parse</a> and <a href="#Uri.file">Uri.file</a> is that the latter treats the argument
as path, not as stringified-uri. E.g. <code>Uri.file(path)</code> is <em>not</em> the same as
<code>Uri.parse(&#39;file://&#39; + path)</code> because the path might contain characters that are
interpreted (# and ?). See the following sample:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">good</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">URI</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/coding/c#/project1&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">good</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">scheme</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">good</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/coding/c#/project1&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">good</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">fragment</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">bad</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">URI</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">parse</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file://&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/coding/c#/project1&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">bad</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">scheme</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">bad</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/coding/c&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">; </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// path is now broken</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">bad</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">fragment</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/project1&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">

<a name="Uri.joinPath"></a><span class="ts" id=393 data-target="#details-393" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">joinPath</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">base</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>, <span>...</span><span class="ident">pathSegments</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]<span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-393">
<div class="comment"><p>Create a new uri which path is the result of joining
the path of the base uri with the provided path segments.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note 1: <code>joinPath</code> only affects the path component
and all other components (scheme, authority, query, and fragment) are
left as they are.</li>
<li>Note 2: The base uri must have a path; an error is thrown otherwise.</li>
</ul>
<p>The path segments are normalized in the following ways:</p>
<ul>
<li>sequences of path separators (<code>/</code> or <code>\</code>) are replaced with a single separator</li>
<li>for <code>file</code>-uris on windows, the backslash-character (``) is considered a path-separator</li>
<li>the <code>..</code>-segment denotes the parent segment, the <code>.</code> denotes the current segment</li>
<li>paths have a root which always remains, for instance on windows drive-letters are roots
so that is true: <code>joinPath(Uri.file(&#39;file:///c:/root&#39;), &#39;../../other&#39;).fsPath === &#39;c:/other&#39;</code></li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="base"></a><span class="ts" id=394 data-target="#details-394" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">base</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>An uri. Must have a path.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="pathSegments"></a><span class="ts" id=395 data-target="#details-395" data-toggle="collapse"><span>...</span><span class="ident">pathSegments</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>One more more path fragments</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A new uri which path is joined with the given fragments</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Uri.parse"></a><span class="ts" id=386 data-target="#details-386" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">parse</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">value</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>, <span class="ident">strict</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-386">
<div class="comment"><p>Create an URI from a string, e.g. <code>http://www.example.com/some/path</code>,
<code>file:///usr/home</code>, or <code>scheme:with/path</code>.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that for a while uris without a <code>scheme</code> were accepted. That is not correct
as all uris should have a scheme. To avoid breakage of existing code the optional
<code>strict</code>-argument has been added. We <em>strongly</em> advise to use it, e.g. <code>Uri.parse(&#39;my:uri&#39;, true)</code></p>
<p><em>See also</em>
<a href="#Uri.toString">Uri.toString</a></p>
</div>

</table>

<a name="Uri.authority"></a><span class="ts" id=413 data-target="#details-413" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">authority</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-413">
<div class="comment"><p>Authority is the <code>www.example.com</code> part of <code>http://www.example.com/some/path?query#fragment</code>.
The part between the first double slashes and the next slash.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Uri.fragment"></a><span class="ts" id=416 data-target="#details-416" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">fragment</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-416">
<div class="comment"><p>Fragment is the <code>fragment</code> part of <code>http://www.example.com/some/path?query#fragment</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Uri.fsPath"></a><span class="ts" id=417 data-target="#details-417" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">fsPath</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-417">
<div class="comment"><p>The string representing the corresponding file system path of this Uri.</p>
<p>Will handle UNC paths and normalize windows drive letters to lower-case. Also
uses the platform specific path separator.</p>
<ul>
<li>Will <em>not</em> validate the path for invalid characters and semantics.</li>
<li>Will <em>not</em> look at the scheme of this Uri.</li>
<li>The resulting string shall <em>not</em> be used for display purposes but
for disk operations, like <code>readFile</code> et al.</li>
</ul>
<p>The <em>difference</em> to the <a href="#Uri.path">path</a>-property is the use of the platform specific
path separator and the handling of UNC paths. The sample below outlines the difference:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">u</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">URI</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">parse</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;file://server/c$/folder/file.txt&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">u</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">authority</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;server&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">u</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">path</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/shares/c$/file.txt&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">u</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">fsPath</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\\</span><span style="color: #CE9178">serverc$</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\f</span><span style="color: #CE9178">older</span><span style="color: #D7BA7D">\f</span><span style="color: #CE9178">ile.txt&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Uri.path"></a><span class="ts" id=414 data-target="#details-414" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">path</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-414">
<div class="comment"><p>Path is the <code>/some/path</code> part of <code>http://www.example.com/some/path?query#fragment</code>.</p>
</div>
</div>

<a name="Uri.toJSON"></a><span class="ts" id=431 data-target="#details-431" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">toJSON</span><span>(</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span></span>

<a name="Uri.toString"></a><span class="ts" id=428 data-target="#details-428" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">toString</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">skipEncoding</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-428">
<div class="comment"><p>Returns a string representation of this Uri. The representation and normalization
of a URI depends on the scheme.</p>
<ul>
<li>The resulting string can be safely used with <a href="#Uri.parse">Uri.parse</a>.</li>
<li>The resulting string shall <em>not</em> be used for display purposes.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Note</em> that the implementation will encode <em>aggressive</em> which often leads to unexpected,
but not incorrect, results. For instance, colons are encoded to <code>%3A</code> which might be unexpected
in file-uri. Also <code>&amp;</code> and <code>=</code> will be encoded which might be unexpected for http-uris. For stability
reasons this cannot be changed anymore. If you suffer from too aggressive encoding you should use
the <code>skipEncoding</code>-argument: <code>uri.toString(true)</code>.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="skipEncoding"></a><span class="ts" id=429 data-target="#details-429" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">skipEncoding</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Do not percentage-encode the result, defaults to <code>false</code>. Note that
    the <code>#</code> and <code>?</code> characters occurring in the path will always be encoded.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A string representation of this Uri.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">assert</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">ok</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">other</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">toString</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">() </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">===</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;after:some/file/path&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>

### <a name="Webview"></a><span class="code-item" id=2317>Webview</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Displays html content, similarly to an iframe.</p>
</div>

#### Events



<a name="Webview.onDidReceiveMessage"></a><span class="ts" id=2320 data-target="#details-2320" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidReceiveMessage</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">any</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2320">
<div class="comment"><p>Fired when the webview content posts a message.</p>
<p>Webview content can post strings or json serializable objects back to an extension. They cannot
post <code>Blob</code>, <code>File</code>, <code>ImageData</code> and other DOM specific objects since the extension that receives the
message does not run in a browser environment.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="Webview.cspSource"></a><span class="ts" id=2327 data-target="#details-2327" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">cspSource</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2327">
<div class="comment"><p>Content security policy source for webview resources.</p>
<p>This is the origin that should be used in a content security policy rule:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #CE9178">`img-src https: </span><span style="color: #569CD6">${</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">webview</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">cspSource</span><span style="color: #569CD6">}</span><span style="color: #CE9178"> ...;`</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Webview.html"></a><span class="ts" id=2319 data-target="#details-2319" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">html</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">string</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2319">
<div class="comment"><p>HTML contents of the webview.</p>
<p>This should be a complete, valid html document. Changing this property causes the webview to be reloaded.</p>
<p>Webviews are sandboxed from normal extension process, so all communication with the webview must use
message passing. To send a message from the extension to the webview, use <a href="#Webview.postMessage">postMessage</a>.
To send message from the webview back to an extension, use the <code>acquireVsCodeApi</code> function inside the webview
to get a handle to the editor&#39;s api and then call <code>.postMessage()</code>:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #808080">&lt;</span><span style="color: #569CD6">script</span><span style="color: #808080">&gt;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #D4D4D4">    </span><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">vscode</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4"> = </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">acquireVsCodeApi</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">(); </span><span style="color: #6A9955">// acquireVsCodeApi can only be invoked once</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #D4D4D4">    </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">postMessage</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">message:</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;hello!&#39;</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #808080">&lt;/</span><span style="color: #569CD6">script</span><span style="color: #808080">&gt;</span></span></code></pre>
<p>To load a resources from the workspace inside a webview, use the <a href="#Webview.asWebviewUri">asWebviewUri</a> method
and ensure the resource&#39;s directory is listed in <a href="#WebviewOptions.localResourceRoots">WebviewOptions.localResourceRoots</a>.</p>
<p>Keep in mind that even though webviews are sandboxed, they still allow running scripts and loading arbitrary content,
so extensions must follow all standard web security best practices when working with webviews. This includes
properly sanitizing all untrusted input (including content from the workspace) and
setting a <a href="https://aka.ms/vscode-api-webview-csp">content security policy</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="Webview.options"></a><span class="ts" id=2318 data-target="#details-2318" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">options</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WebviewOptions">WebviewOptions</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2318">
<div class="comment"><p>Content settings for the webview.</p>
</div>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="Webview.asWebviewUri"></a><span class="ts" id=2325 data-target="#details-2325" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">asWebviewUri</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">localResource</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2325">
<div class="comment"><p>Convert a uri for the local file system to one that can be used inside webviews.</p>
<p>Webviews cannot directly load resources from the workspace or local file system using <code>file:</code> uris. The
<code>asWebviewUri</code> function takes a local <code>file:</code> uri and converts it into a uri that can be used inside of
a webview to load the same resource:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">webview</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">html</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">`&lt;img src=&quot;</span><span style="color: #569CD6">${</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">webview</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">asWebviewUri</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">(</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #D4D4D4">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">Uri</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">file</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;/Users/codey/workspace/cat.gif&#39;</span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">)</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #D4D4D4">)</span><span style="color: #569CD6">}</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&quot;&gt;`</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
</div>

<a name="Webview.postMessage"></a><span class="ts" id=2322 data-target="#details-2322" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">postMessage</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">message</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2322">
<div class="comment"><p>Post a message to the webview content.</p>
<p>Messages are only delivered if the webview is live (either visible or in the
background with <code>retainContextWhenHidden</code>).</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="message"></a><span class="ts" id=2323 data-target="#details-2323" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">message</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">any</span></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Body of the message. This must be a string or other json serializable object.</p>
<p>  For older versions of vscode, if an <code>ArrayBuffer</code> is included in <code>message</code>,
  it will not be serialized properly and will not be received by the webview.
  Similarly any TypedArrays, such as a <code>Uint8Array</code>, will be very inefficiently
  serialized and will also not be recreated as a typed array inside the webview.</p>
<p>  However if your extension targets vscode 1.57+ in the <code>engines</code> field of its
  <code>package.json</code>, any <code>ArrayBuffer</code> values that appear in <code>message</code> will be more
  efficiently transferred to the webview and will also be correctly recreated inside
  of the webview.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>A promise that resolves when the message is posted to a webview or when it is
dropped because the message was not deliverable.</p>
<p>  Returns <code>true</code> if the message was posted to the webview. Messages can only be posted to
live webviews (i.e. either visible webviews or hidden webviews that set <code>retainContextWhenHidden</code>).</p>
<p>  A response of <code>true</code> does not mean that the message was actually received by the webview.
  For example, no message listeners may be have been hooked up inside the webview or the webview may
  have been destroyed after the message was posted but before it was received.</p>
<p>  If you want confirm that a message as actually received, you can try having your webview posting a
  confirmation message back to your extension.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="WebviewOptions"></a><span class="code-item" id=2311>WebviewOptions</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Content settings for a webview.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="WebviewOptions.enableCommandUris"></a><span class="ts" id=2314 data-target="#details-2314" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">enableCommandUris</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span> &#124; readonly <span class="type-intrinsic">string</span>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2314">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether command uris are enabled in webview content or not.</p>
<p>Defaults to <code>false</code> (command uris are disabled).</p>
<p>If you pass in an array, only the commands in the array are allowed.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="WebviewOptions.enableForms"></a><span class="ts" id=2313 data-target="#details-2313" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">enableForms</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2313">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether forms are enabled in the webview content or not.</p>
<p>Defaults to true if <a href="#WebviewOptions.enableScripts">scripts are enabled</a>. Otherwise defaults to false.
Explicitly setting this property to either true or false overrides the default.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="WebviewOptions.enableScripts"></a><span class="ts" id=2312 data-target="#details-2312" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">enableScripts</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2312">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls whether scripts are enabled in the webview content or not.</p>
<p>Defaults to false (scripts-disabled).</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="WebviewOptions.localResourceRoots"></a><span class="ts" id=2315 data-target="#details-2315" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">localResourceRoots</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#Uri">Uri</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2315">
<div class="comment"><p>Root paths from which the webview can load local (filesystem) resources using uris from <code>asWebviewUri</code></p>
<p>Default to the root folders of the current workspace plus the extension&#39;s install directory.</p>
<p>Pass in an empty array to disallow access to any local resources.</p>
</div>
</div>



<a name="WebviewOptions.portMapping"></a><span class="ts" id=2316 data-target="#details-2316" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">portMapping</span><span>?</span><span>: </span>readonly <a class="type-ref" href="#WebviewPortMapping">WebviewPortMapping</a>[]</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2316">
<div class="comment"><p>Mappings of localhost ports used inside the webview.</p>
<p>Port mapping allow webviews to transparently define how localhost ports are resolved. This can be used
to allow using a static localhost port inside the webview that is resolved to random port that a service is
running on.</p>
<p>If a webview accesses localhost content, we recommend that you specify port mappings even if
the <code>webviewPort</code> and <code>extensionHostPort</code> ports are the same.</p>
<p><em>Note</em> that port mappings only work for <code>http</code> or <code>https</code> urls. Websocket urls (e.g. <code>ws://localhost:3000</code>)
cannot be mapped to another port.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="comment"><p>Content settings for a webview panel.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="WebviewPanelOptions.enableFindWidget"></a><span class="ts" id=2329 data-target="#details-2329" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">enableFindWidget</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2329">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if the find widget is enabled in the panel.</p>
<p>Defaults to <code>false</code>.</p>

<a name="WebviewPanelOptions.retainContextWhenHidden"></a><span class="ts" id=2330 data-target="#details-2330" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">retainContextWhenHidden</span><span>?</span><span>: </span><span class="type-intrinsic">boolean</span></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2330">
<div class="comment"><p>Controls if the webview panel&#39;s content (iframe) is kept around even when the panel
is no longer visible.</p>
<p>Normally the webview panel&#39;s html context is created when the panel becomes visible
and destroyed when it is hidden. Extensions that have complex state
or UI can set the <code>retainContextWhenHidden</code> to make the editor keep the webview
context around, even when the webview moves to a background tab. When a webview using
<code>retainContextWhenHidden</code> becomes hidden, its scripts and other dynamic content are suspended.
When the panel becomes visible again, the context is automatically restored
in the exact same state it was in originally. You cannot send messages to a
hidden webview, even with <code>retainContextWhenHidden</code> enabled.</p>
<p><code>retainContextWhenHidden</code> has a high memory overhead and should only be used if
your panel&#39;s context cannot be quickly saved and restored.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="WebviewPanelSerializer"></a><span class="code-item" id=2353>WebviewPanelSerializer&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Restore webview panels that have been persisted when vscode shuts down.</p>
<p>There are two types of webview persistence:</p>
<ul>
<li>Persistence within a session.</li>
<li>Persistence across sessions (across restarts of the editor).</li>
</ul>
<p>A <code>WebviewPanelSerializer</code> is only required for the second case: persisting a webview across sessions.</p>
<p>Persistence within a session allows a webview to save its state when it becomes hidden
and restore its content from this state when it becomes visible again. It is powered entirely
by the webview content itself. To save off a persisted state, call <code>acquireVsCodeApi().setState()</code> with
any json serializable object. To restore the state again, call <code>getState()</code></p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Within the webview</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">acquireVsCodeApi</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">();</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Get existing state</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">oldState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">getState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">() </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">||</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Update state</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">setState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">oldState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>A <code>WebviewPanelSerializer</code> extends this persistence across restarts of the editor. When the editor is shutdown,
it will save off the state from <code>setState</code> of all webviews that have a serializer. When the
webview first becomes visible after the restart, this state is passed to <code>deserializeWebviewPanel</code>.
The extension can then restore the old <code>WebviewPanel</code> from this state.</p>
</div>

#### Methods



<a name="WebviewPanelSerializer.deserializeWebviewPanel"></a><span class="ts" id=2355 data-target="#details-2355" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">deserializeWebviewPanel</span><span>(</span><span class="ident">webviewPanel</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WebviewPanel">WebviewPanel</a>, <span class="ident">state</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a><span>)</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2355">
<div class="comment"><p>Restore a webview panel from its serialized <code>state</code>.</p>
<p>Called when a serialized webview first becomes visible.</p>
</div>
<div class="signature callable-signature">
<table class="table table-bordered">
<tr><th>Parameter</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><a name="webviewPanel"></a><span class="ts" id=2356 data-target="#details-2356" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">webviewPanel</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#WebviewPanel">WebviewPanel</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Webview panel to restore. The serializer should take ownership of this panel. The
serializer must restore the webview&#39;s <code>.html</code> and hook up all webview events.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><td><a name="state"></a><span class="ts" id=2357 data-target="#details-2357" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">state</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a></span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Persisted state from the webview content.</p>
</div></td></tr>
<tr><th>Returns</th><th>Description</th></tr>
<tr><td><span class="ts"><a class="type-ref" href="#Thenable">Thenable</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span></td><td><div class="comment"><p>Thenable indicating that the webview has been fully restored.</p>
</div></td></tr>
</table>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="WebviewView"></a><span class="code-item" id=2359>WebviewView</span>

#### Events



<a name="WebviewView.onDidChangeVisibility"></a><span class="ts" id=2367 data-target="#details-2367" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidChangeVisibility</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2367">
<div class="comment"><p>Event fired when the visibility of the view changes.</p>
<p>Actions that trigger a visibility change:</p>

<li>The view is collapsed or expanded.</li>
<li>The user switches to a different view group in the sidebar or panel.</li>

<a name="WebviewView.onDidDispose"></a><span class="ts" id=2365 data-target="#details-2365" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">onDidDispose</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#Event">Event</a>&lt;<span class="type-intrinsic">void</span>&gt;</span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2365">

<p>Views are disposed when they are explicitly hidden by a user (this happens when a user
right clicks in a view and unchecks the webview view).</p>
<p>Trying to use the view after it has been disposed throws an exception.</p>
</div>

### <a name="WebviewViewResolveContext"></a><span class="code-item" id=2371>WebviewViewResolveContext&lt;T&gt;</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Additional information the webview view being resolved.</p>
</div>

#### Properties



<a name="WebviewViewResolveContext.state"></a><span class="ts" id=2372 data-target="#details-2372" data-toggle="collapse"><span class="ident">state</span><span>: </span><a class="type-ref" href="#T">T</a></span>
<div class="details collapse" id="details-2372">
<div class="comment"><p>Persisted state from the webview content.</p>
<p>To save resources, the editor normally deallocates webview documents (the iframe content) that are not visible.
For example, when the user collapse a view or switches to another top level activity in the sidebar, the
<code>WebviewView</code> itself is kept alive but the webview&#39;s underlying document is deallocated. It is recreated when
the view becomes visible again.</p>
<p>You can prevent this behavior by setting <code>retainContextWhenHidden</code> in the <code>WebviewOptions</code>. However this
increases resource usage and should be avoided wherever possible. Instead, you can use persisted state to
save off a webview&#39;s state so that it can be quickly recreated as needed.</p>
<p>To save off a persisted state, inside the webview call <code>acquireVsCodeApi().setState()</code> with
any json serializable object. To restore the state again, call <code>getState()</code>. For example:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Within the webview</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">acquireVsCodeApi</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">();</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Get existing state</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">oldState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">getState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">() </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">||</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// Update state</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #DCDCAA">setState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">({ </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">oldState</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">+</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> });</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>The editor ensures that the persisted state is saved correctly when a webview is hidden and across
editor restarts.</p>
</div>
</div>

### <a name="WorkspaceConfiguration"></a><span class="code-item" id=1623>WorkspaceConfiguration</span>



<div class="comment"><p>Represents the configuration. It is a merged view of</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Default Settings</em></li>
<li><em>Global (User) Settings</em></li>
<li><em>Workspace settings</em></li>
<li><em>Workspace Folder settings</em> - From one of the <a href="#workspace.workspaceFolders">Workspace Folders</a> under which requested resource belongs to.</li>
<li><em>Language settings</em> - Settings defined under requested language.</li>
</ul>
<p>The <em>effective</em> value (returned by <a href="#WorkspaceConfiguration.get">get</a>) is computed by overriding or merging the values in the following order:</p>
<ol>
<li><code>defaultValue</code> (if defined in <code>package.json</code> otherwise derived from the value&#39;s type)</li>
<li><code>globalValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>workspaceValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>workspaceFolderValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>defaultLanguageValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>globalLanguageValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>workspaceLanguageValue</code> (if defined)</li>
<li><code>workspaceFolderLanguageValue</code> (if defined)</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> Only <code>object</code> value types are merged and all other value types are overridden.</p>
<p>Example 1: Overriding</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">defaultValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;on&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">globalValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;relative&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolderValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;off&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;off&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Example 2: Language Values</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">defaultValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;on&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">globalValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;relative&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolderValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;off&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">globalLanguageValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;on&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;on&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">;</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Example 3: Object Values</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">defaultValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">2</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">globalValue</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">3</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">c:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">4</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #9CDCFE">value</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> { </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">a:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">1</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">b:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">3</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">, </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">c:</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">4</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> };</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p><em>Note:</em> Workspace and Workspace Folder configurations contains <code>launch</code> and <code>tasks</code> settings. Their basename will be
part of the section identifier. The following snippets shows how to retrieve all configurations
from <code>launch.json</code>:</p>
<pre class="shiki" style="background-color: #1e1e1e"><code><span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// launch.json configuration</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">config</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">getConfiguration</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;launch&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">,</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">  </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">vscode</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspace</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">workspaceFolders</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">[</span><span style="color: #B5CEA8">0</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">].</span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">uri</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #6A9955">// retrieve values</span></span>
<span class="line"><span style="color: #569CD6">const</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #4FC1FF">values</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #D4D4D4">=</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB"> </span><span style="color: #9CDCFE">config</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">.</span><span style="color: #DCDCAA">get</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">(</span><span style="color: #CE9178">&#39;configurations&#39;</span><span style="color: #BBBBBB">);</span></span>
<span class="line"></span></code></pre>
<p>Refer to <a href="https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/settings">Settings</a> for more information.</p>
</div>
